original: snang ba dang snang bar 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba dang snang bar 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because appearance and non-appearance are mutually exclusive.

original: ji ste don bdag nyid kyis snang ba yin na ni /
analyzed: ji ste don bdag nyid kyis snang ba yin na ni /
translated: If the object itself appears,

original: shes pa des ci zhig bya /
analyzed: shes pa des ci zhig bya /
translated: what does the cognition do?

original: de'i phyir sems ni sgyu ma lta bu'o ;
analyzed: de'i phyir sems ni sgyu ma lta bu'o ;
translated: Therefore, mind is like an illusion.

original: / de med ni ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ces bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: / de med ni ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ces bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: How is there complete enlightenment without that?

original: bcom ldan de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: The Blessed One said, “No, Subhūti.”

original: med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: The answer is because it does not exist.

original: gud na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: gud na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “Elsewhere” is the answer.

original: chos de zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid do //
analyzed: chos de zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid do //
translated: “That dharma” refers to the self.

original: ma lags so zhes bya ba ni de ni gtan du med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes sgongs so //
analyzed: ma lags so zhes bya ba ni de ni gtan du med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes sgongs so //
translated: “No” means it is utterly non-existent.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: To clarify this,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, I do not see that dharma.”

original: yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba bstan par mi nus te /
translated: Existence and non-existence cannot be taught.

original: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin la zhes bya ba dang / dgag pa dag 'brel ba med pa'i @173a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin la zhes bya ba dang / dgag pa dag 'brel ba med pa'i @173a * //
translated: The negation is not related to the object.

original: phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: chos gang la yang zhes bya ba ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: chos gang la yang zhes bya ba ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The phrase “with regard to any dharma” is easy to understand.

original: 'on kyang de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: 'on kyang de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: However, the phrase “in that case” and so on is as follows.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni mi bzod pa'o //
translated: “ However” indicates disagreement.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: “ In that case” means that the characteristic of grasping is not tenable.

original: 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of grasping is not tenable.

original: shin tu smos pas ni 'di ltar ston to //
analyzed: shin tu smos pas ni 'di ltar ston to //
translated: The word “indeed” teaches this.

original: ji ltar 'dzin pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid de bzhin du mtshungs par ldan pa thams cad kyang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzin pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid de bzhin du mtshungs par ldan pa thams cad kyang ngo //
translated: Just as the characteristic of grasping is empty of its own characteristic, so too all that is associated with it is empty.

original: de dag kyang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they also have the characteristic of grasping.🔽All phenomena that are objects are empty of the characteristic of objects.

original: dmigs par gyur pa chos thams cad kyang dmigs pa ni gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dmigs par gyur pa chos thams cad kyang dmigs pa ni gzung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because the characteristic of an object is the characteristic of being grasped.

original: chos thams cad kyang ci rigs par gzung bar bya ba dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang ci rigs par gzung bar bya ba dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all dharmas are characterized as the apprehended object and apprehending subject, respectively.

original: yang ji ltar gzung bar bya ba dang / 'dzin pa med ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar gzung bar bya ba dang / 'dzin pa med ce na /
translated: How is there neither the apprehended object nor apprehending subject?

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir gzung ba bya ba dang / 'dzin pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir gzung ba bya ba dang / 'dzin pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: The apprehended object and apprehending subject are not tenable because they are not different,

original: sor mo bzhin no //
analyzed: sor mo bzhin no //
translated: like the fingers of one’s own hand.

original: skyes pa tha dad pa ni pha rol la snang ba mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa ni rang nyid kyis snang ba med pa'i phyir de ni bsgom par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa tha dad pa ni pha rol la snang ba mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa ni rang nyid kyis snang ba med pa'i phyir de ni bsgom par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Since the difference of what is produced is not tenable in the appearance of the other, and what is not produced is not tenable in the absence of its own appearance, it is not to be cultivated.

original: yang dang yang du blo mi 'jug pa nyid na bong bu'i rva bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dang yang du blo mi 'jug pa nyid na bong bu'i rva bzhin no //
translated: Since the mind does not engage again and again, it is like the horn of a donkey.

original: de chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos gang yang zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos gang yang zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sogs pa'o //
translated: As for “that dharma,” etc., “any dharma” refers to perfect complete awakening, etc.

original: thob par bgyi ba ni skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thob par bgyi ba ni skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: “Attainment” means production.

original: spong bar bgyid pa ni 'dor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: spong bar bgyid pa ni 'dor bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Abandonment” means rejection.

original: med pa la ni cung zad kyang bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa la ni cung zad kyang bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is nothing whatsoever that can be done for the nonexistent.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di nyid la brten pa rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di nyid la brten pa rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the bodhisattva is perfected in full enlightenment in dependence on just this dependent origination,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Lord] declares, “How is it, Subhūti?” and so on.

original: med pa la ni thob pa med do zhes bya ba bsams nas /
analyzed: med pa la ni thob pa med do zhes bya ba bsams nas /
translated: Thinking that there is no attainment for the nonexistent,

original: bla na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bzhin du shin tu dben par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bzhin du shin tu dben par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: [Subhūti] says, “How is it, O Lord, that the perfection of wisdom is the highest perfection?” and so on. The meaning is: How can it be that the perfection of wisdom is extremely isolated, like the perfection of wisdom? It cannot be,

original: shin tu med pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa mi rigs so zhes bsams so //
analyzed: shin tu med pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa mi rigs so zhes bsams so //
translated: because it is unreasonable that the nonexistent should be accomplished and the accomplishing [act] should be accomplished.

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Having thus spoken, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir dang de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ni rgyu dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dang de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ni rgyu dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don to //
translated: The meaning of “because” and “therefore” is: because the effect is in accordance with the cause.

original: rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs yongs su @173b rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs yongs su @173b rdzogs par byed de /
translated: By Subhuti, if, etc., the reason is completed.

original: gal te yang dag par shes pa ni rnam par rtog par 'gyur bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang dag par shes pa ni rnam par rtog par 'gyur bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: If, however, the perfect knowledge is conceptualized, it is not the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug bsdu ba ste /
translated: By Subhuti, thus, etc., the conclusion is drawn.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste zhes bya ba ni mngon par rdzog par 'tshang mi rgya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes bsams so //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ste zhes bya ba ni mngon par rdzog par 'tshang mi rgya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes bsams so //
translated: He thinks that does not fully know means does not fully know without conceptualizing.

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang yang rgya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang yang rgya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: By Subhuti, he fully knows, etc., the conclusion is drawn.

original: kun du brtags pa'i ngo bor ni gsum po 'di dag med de /
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i ngo bor ni gsum po 'di dag med de /
translated: In the imagined nature, these three do not exist.

original: des stong pa'i rnam par rig pa'i ngo bor ni yod do zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: des stong pa'i rnam par rig pa'i ngo bor ni yod do zhes dgongs so //
translated: He thinks that in the nature of representation, which is empty of that, they do exist.

original: de lta mod kyi kun rdzob ji ltar snang ba nyid med pa nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi kun rdzob ji ltar snang ba nyid med pa nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid ni don dam pa'o //
translated: However, since the conventional appears just as it is, emptiness is the ultimate.

original: don zab mo la spyod do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir don la gzhan gyis spyod par mi nus pas dka' ba'i byed pa ste /
analyzed: don zab mo la spyod do zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir don la gzhan gyis spyod par mi nus pas dka' ba'i byed pa ste /
translated: The phrase one engages in the profound meaning refers to the fact that it is difficult for others to engage in the meaning.

original: gang gi phyir de bcom ldan 'das kyis de mngon sum du mdzad par spyod kyang mngon sum du mdzad pa ni sems can gyi don gyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bcom ldan 'das kyis de mngon sum du mdzad par spyod kyang mngon sum du mdzad pa ni sems can gyi don gyi dbang gis so //
translated: Because the Bhagavān engages in that which is directly perceived, he engages in the direct perception of that, but he does so for the sake of sentient beings.

original: bka' stsal ba'i don zhes bya ba ni mngon par dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: bka' stsal ba'i don zhes bya ba ni mngon par dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of what is spoken is the intended meaning.

original: dka' ba ni gzhan dag la'o //
analyzed: dka' ba ni gzhan dag la'o //
translated: It is difficult for others,

original: sla ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bsams so //
analyzed: sla ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bsams so //
translated: but easy for the bodhisattvas.

original: ci'i phyir sla zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sla zhe na /
translated: Why is it easy?

original: thabs la mkhas pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Because of skill in means.

original: thabs de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: thabs de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do //
translated: And that means is the perfection of wisdom itself.

original: de'i phyir de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān said, “In this way,” and so on.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The phrase “one who” refers to the bodhisattva.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni zab mo'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni zab mo'i don to //
translated: The phrase “this” refers to the profound meaning.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bas so //
translated: By means of what? By means of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na de tsam gyis spyod par 'gyur zha na /
analyzed: ci ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na de tsam gyis spyod par 'gyur zha na /
translated: If one practices the perfection of wisdom, to that extent one practices.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One said, “If, etc.”

original: mi zhum pa ni mi brdzi ba ste /
analyzed: mi zhum pa ni mi brdzi ba ste /
translated: Not shrinking means not being overwhelmed.

original: 'di ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: mi 'gong ba la sogs pa drug po 'di ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gong ba la sogs pa drug po 'di ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The six, beginning with not being puffed up, are the explanation.

original: mi 'gong ba dang / yang dag par mi 'gong pa ni 'di la dga' ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gong ba dang / yang dag par mi 'gong pa ni 'di la dga' ba med pa'o //
translated: Not being puffed up and not being completely puffed up is not delighting in this.

original: rgyab kyis phyogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni dga' ba med pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyab kyis phyogs pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni dga' ba med pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not turning away is not not delighting.

original: mi skrag ces bya ba ni 'di gtong bar 'dod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi skrag ces bya ba ni 'di gtong bar 'dod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not being frightened is not wanting to give this up.

original: mi dngang ba ni mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: mi dngang ba ni mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Not being terrified is not giving it up.

original: dngang bar mi 'gyur ba ni rgyun du mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: dngang bar mi 'gyur ba ni rgyun du mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Not becoming terrified is not continuously giving it up.

original: de nyid ni nyams pa rnam pa drug 'gog par rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: de nyid ni nyams pa rnam pa drug 'gog par rtogs par byed de /
translated: That very [non-shrinking] is understood to stop the six kinds of degeneration.

original: gang 'di mngon du gyur pa la shin tu dga' ba de ni 'di @174a * //
analyzed: gang 'di mngon du gyur pa la shin tu dga' ba de ni 'di @174a * //
translated: This is the joy of actualizing the path.🔽

original: la spyod do //🔽gzhan yang gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang gal te bdag ces bya bar nye bar gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang bdag gi nyan thos zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dir ngo bo nyid la sogs pa'i don dgu ni 'jug pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: la spyod do // gzhan yang gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang gal te bdag ces bya bar nye bar gyur to zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang bdag gi nyan thos zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dir ngo bo nyid la sogs pa'i don dgu ni 'jug pa'i phyogs te /
translated: He who delights in this manifestation practices this.🔽Moreover, if, etc.🔽Moreover, if the self, etc.🔽Moreover, my disciples, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' blang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the nine meanings of identity, etc. are the engaged position, because the bodhisattva is the one who is to be taken up.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa ni kun du rmongs pa'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa ni kun du rmongs pa'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Among them, conceptualization is the false knowledge of delusion.

original: de la dang po ni ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Among them, the first is the conceptualization of identity.

original: ngo bo nyid kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag par 'gro'o snyam pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lhag par 'gro'o snyam pa'o //
translated: The identity is the thought, “I will go to unsurpassed perfect awakening.”

original: de'i lam ni byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i lam ni byang chub kyi sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The path of that is the meaning of the thought of awakening.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa ni bdag nyid kyi byang chub dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stong pa nyid la gang mi shes pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i shes pa gsum la rlom sems pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa ni bdag nyid kyi byang chub dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stong pa nyid la gang mi shes pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i shes pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i shes pa gsum la rlom sems pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization is the conceit of three kinds of ignorance: ignorance of one's own enlightenment, the perfection of wisdom, and emptiness; ignorance of the non-concentrated mind; and ignorance of the concentrated mind.

original: bdag spyod do zhes bya ba dang / bdag byang chub chen po dang nye'o snyam pa dang / bdag byang chub dman pa las ring ngo snyam pa'o //🔽'di'i gnyen po ni bcom ldan 'das sgyu ma lta bu'i sems zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: bdag spyod do zhes bya ba dang / bdag byang chub chen po dang nye'o snyam pa dang / bdag byang chub dman pa las ring ngo snyam pa'o // 'di'i gnyen po ni bcom ldan 'das sgyu ma lta bu'i sems zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: The thought I am practicing and the thought I am close to great enlightenment and the thought I am far from inferior enlightenment.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis te /
translated: The antidote to that is from Blessed One, the mind is like an illusion up to Blessed One, it is like this.

original: 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o /🔽bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang ni nye la /
analyzed: 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bdag ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang ni nye la /
translated: This is the conceptualization of essence.

original: byang chub dman pa dang ni ring ste /
analyzed: byang chub dman pa dang ni ring ste /
translated: The thought I am close to perfect complete enlightenment and the thought I am far from inferior enlightenment.

original: gang gi phyir bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin no zhes bya ba ni kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs yin no zhes bya ba ni kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: The thought I am of the Buddha family is a delusion.

original: 'di'i gnyen po ni rigs te de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i gnyen po ni rigs te de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The remedy for that is the family, which is the perfection of nonconceptual wisdom,

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is like space.

original: 'di ni rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs kyi rnam par rtog pa'o // bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: This is the conception of the family.

original: bdag pa lam dag par 'grub pa ni yod de /
analyzed: bdag pa lam dag par 'grub pa ni yod de /
translated: The thought I am pure, and will attain purity is a delusion.🔽The remedy for that is the thought I am impure, and will attain purity, which is the perfection of nonconceptual wisdom,🔽because it is like a magical creation.

original: de bas na bdag byang chub chen po dang ni nye'o //
analyzed: de bas na bdag byang chub chen po dang ni nye'o //
translated: The thought I am near to great enlightenment,

original: dman pa'i byang chub dang ni ring ngo snyam pa ni kun tu rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: dman pa'i byang chub dang ni ring ngo snyam pa ni kun tu rmongs pa'o //
translated: and far from the enlightenment of the disciples is a delusion.🔽The remedy for that is the thought I am near to the attainment of the enlightenment of the disciples,

original: yang dag par 'grub pa 'di'i gnyen po ni de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa 'di'i gnyen po ni de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: and far from the attainment of great enlightenment, which is the perfection of nonconceptual wisdom,

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is like an illusory person.

original: 'di ni gnyen po yang dag par 'grub pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs @174b pa la ;
analyzed: 'di ni gnyen po yang dag par 'grub pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs @174b pa la ;
translated: This is the conception of the accomplishment of the antidote.

original: gzugs brnyan ni snang ba'o //

analyzed: gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zab mo zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
translated: Therefore, the profound is the antidote.

original: de la mi spyod pa ni lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la mi spyod pa ni lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Not practicing that is the incompleteness of the aspects of the path.

original: des na de bdud la sogs pas tshugs par sla ba ste /
analyzed: des na de bdud la sogs pas tshugs par sla ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is easy for that one to be overcome by demons, etc.

original: go cha ma bgos pa bzhin du 'thab pa'i zla bos tshugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: go cha ma bgos pa bzhin du 'thab pa'i zla bos tshugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be attacked by the moon of opponents, as if he were fighting without armor.

original: 'di ni lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conception of the incompleteness of the aspects of the path.

original: de ltar spyod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar spyod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Also, although he practices thus, etc.

original: gang zhes bya ba 'dir yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba 'dir yang sbyar ro //
translated: The word he is also to be supplied here.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gtsor byas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gtsor byas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa yin te /
translated: Thus means that he practices the perfections, with the perfection of wisdom as the chief.

original: de ltar spyod ces bya ba ni don to //
analyzed: de ltar spyod ces bya ba ni don to //
translated: The meaning of practices thus is the same as before.

original: de ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What will happen?

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning the reality limit answers this.

original: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba ni gtso bo chen po yin pa'i phyir mkhar gyi rgyal po de'i rjes su 'brang ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtso bo des 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba ni gtso bo chen po yin pa'i phyir mkhar gyi rgyal po de'i rjes su 'brang ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtso bo des 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as the universal monarch is the chief, and the kings of the citadels follow him, so the perfection of wisdom is the chief, and the other perfections follow it, because of the nonapprehension of cyclic life and nirvana.

original: ji ltar de dag pha rol tu phyin pa de rnams kyis 'khor bar mi ltung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag pha rol tu phyin pa de rnams kyis 'khor bar mi ltung ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as they do not fall into cyclic existence through those perfections,

original: gang zag la bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du mi byed do //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa'i ye shes kyis mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du mi byed do //
translated: so they do not actualize nirvana through the intuition of the selflessness of persons.

original: gal te gtso bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med pa de'i tshe ni dman pa'i byang chub mngon sum du mi byed do //
analyzed: gal te gtso bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med pa de'i tshe ni dman pa'i byang chub mngon sum du mi byed do //
translated: If they did not have the perfection of wisdom, which is the chief of those perfections, they would not actualize the lesser enlightenment.🔽By this method, etc.

original: rnam grangs 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽'dis ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur bas so //
translated: By this means, etc.

original: de nyid ni gang chos rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽mngon sum du mi byed ces bya ba ni de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid ni gang chos rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // mngon sum du mi byed ces bya ba ni de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: That itself is stated in the line beginning “of all phenomena.”🔽They do not actualize it. Why is that?

original: ched du bya ba mi ldog pa ste /
analyzed: ched du bya ba mi ldog pa ste /
translated: Because they do not turn away from their aim.

original: ched du bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: ched du bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Their aim is the desire to attain perfect enlightenment.

original: de las mi ldog pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de las mi ldog pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why do they not turn away from that?

original: gang gi phyir ji srid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ma log pa de'i bar du de de kho na'i don la spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji srid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ma log pa de'i bar du de de kho na'i don la spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because as long as one does not turn away from the perfection of wisdom, one practices the meaning of that alone.

original: @176b gzhan dag kyang mi spyod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: @176b gzhan dag kyang mi spyod pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that others do not practice it,

original: de'i khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are included in that.

original: dper na chu bran thams cad chu bo chen po'i nang du 'dres nas /
analyzed: dper na chu bran thams cad chu bo chen po'i nang du 'dres nas /
translated: For example, all the small rivers merge into the great rivers

original: rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ste mi ldog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ste mi ldog pa bzhin no //
translated: and go to the great ocean and do not return.

original: 'di ni ched du bya ba log pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ched du bya ba log pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the misconception of the wrong purpose.

original: rnam par rtog pa dgu po 'di dag kyang yum chen mo las rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas sbyar te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dgu po 'di dag kyang yum chen mo las rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas sbyar te /
translated: These nine misconceptions are applied in the Great Mother Perfection of Wisdom in terms of the perfection of one's own goal.

original: de'i phyir nyi tshe ba dang / sna tshogs nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa de dag ji ltar gsungs pa de bzhin du re zhig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyi tshe ba dang / sna tshogs nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa de dag ji ltar gsungs pa de bzhin du re zhig brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the misconceptions of limitedness and variety should be explained as they are taught.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ni lag pa g-yon pa dang 'dra la drug pa ni lag pa g-yas pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga ni lag pa g-yon pa dang 'dra la drug pa ni lag pa g-yas pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The five perfections are like the left hand, and the sixth is like the right hand.

original: gnyi ga ni bya ba thams cad la dgongs pa 'grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ni bya ba thams cad la dgongs pa 'grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
translated: Both are successful in all their aims.

original: gal te yang lag pa g-yas pa dang 'dra ba'i drug pa de med pa'i tshe ni nyi tshe ba'i bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang lag pa g-yas pa dang 'dra ba'i drug pa de med pa'i tshe ni nyi tshe ba'i bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the sixth perfection, which is like the right hand, were missing, then the other five would be incomplete.

original: 'di ni nyi tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyi tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is a limited conception.

original: de ltar ro sna tshogs pa'i chu bran ni chu bo dang / rgya mtsho chen por zhugs na ro gcig tu 'gyur ba de bzhin du rigs tha dad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang /
analyzed: de ltar ro sna tshogs pa'i chu bran ni chu bo dang / rgya mtsho chen por zhugs na ro gcig tu 'gyur ba de bzhin du rigs tha dad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang /
translated: Just as the various streams of water become of one taste when they enter the great ocean, so the five perfections of different kinds🔽become of one taste when they enter the sixth.

original: drug par zhugs na mtshan nyid gcig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: drug par zhugs na mtshan nyid gcig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
translated: This is the antidote.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag mtshan nyid sna tshogs pa de bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang ngo //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag mtshan nyid sna tshogs pa de bzhin du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang ngo //
translated: Just as these perfections have various characteristics, so also does perfect enlightenment.

original: 'di ni sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conception of variety.

original: 'dir yang bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam pa'i go cha'i dbang du byas nas rnam par rtog pa 'di gnyis de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir yang bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam pa'i go cha'i dbang du byas nas rnam par rtog pa 'di gnyis de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here also, the Lord, in the context of the armor of the ultimate, has stated these two conceptions, beginning with “Then the venerable Subhuti . . .”

original: de la go cha bgos pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni dka' ba nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: de la go cha bgos pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni dka' ba nyid du bstan te /
translated: There, the phrase “having buckled on the armor” indicates difficulty,

original: sems can mtha' yas pa'i don byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can mtha' yas pa'i don byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to work for the welfare of infinite sentient beings.

original: de lta mod kyi de bzhin du go cha ni bgo bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi de bzhin du go cha ni bgo bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Nevertheless, one should buckle on the armor in just this way,

original: 'di lta bu'i bsam pa chen po med par bdag dang gzhan gyi don bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i bsam pa chen po med par bdag dang gzhan gyi don bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
translated: because without such a great resolve, it is not possible to work for the welfare of oneself and others. This is the antidote.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don gang yang mi byed pas bdag nyid dul bar bya ba'i don du go cha med pa 'di ni nyi tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don gang yang mi byed pas bdag nyid dul bar bya ba'i don du go cha med pa 'di ni nyi tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conception that one should not buckle on the armor because one does not work for the welfare of all sentient beings, but only for one’s own self-discipline, is a limited conception.

original: sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The antidote to the discursive thought of variety is sameness.

original: de nyid mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mi mthun pa'o //
translated: That is the incompatibility.

original: mchog tu dka' ba byed pa nyid ni sems can rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽gdul bar @177a * //
analyzed: mchog tu dka' ba byed pa nyid ni sems can rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // gdul bar @177a * //
translated: The performance of the most difficult task is spoken of in the passage beginning “sentient beings are difficult to tame.

original: bya ba zhes bya ba ni gdul bar 'os pa'i sems can rnams so //
analyzed: bya ba zhes bya ba ni gdul bar 'os pa'i sems can rnams so //
translated: Those to be tamed are sentient beings who are fit to be tamed.

original: de lta mod kyi gang la dka' ba byed pa yin zhe na /🔽de'i phyir de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi gang la dka' ba byed pa yin zhe na / de'i phyir de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: But in regard to whom is the performance of the difficult task?🔽Therefore, it is said, “Thus, O sons of gods.

original: dpes bstan par bya ba'i phyir lha'i bu dag gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
analyzed: dpes bstan par bya ba'i phyir lha'i bu dag gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ;
translated: In order to illustrate this by an example, it is said, “O sons of gods, suppose someone were to say.

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa ga las zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de'i phyir lha'i bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa ga las zhes bya ba'i don to // de'i phyir lha'i bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: Why is that? The meaning is: on the basis of what similarity?🔽Therefore, it is said, “O sons of gods, it is just so.

original: lha'i bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The summary is stated in the passage beginning, “O sons of gods.

original: yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir lha'i bu dag gang zhes bya ba gsungs pa la /
analyzed: yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir lha'i bu dag gang zhes bya ba gsungs pa la /
translated: Again, in order to teach, he says, “O sons of gods!”

original: sems can nam mkha' dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can nam mkha' dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that sentient beings are like space.

original: ci'i phyir rtsod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtsod pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is there a dispute?

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
translated: He says, “The bodhisattva…” up to “…should know.”

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gtan tshigs so //🔽rtsod pa ni 'thab mo ste 'di sems can 'dul bar mi 'dod pa 'am /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gtan tshigs so // rtsod pa ni 'thab mo ste 'di sems can 'dul bar mi 'dod pa 'am /
translated: The word “again” is a reason.🔽A dispute is a fight, which is not wishing to tame sentient beings,

original: sems can de dag yongs su gtong ba ni 'thab mo'o //
analyzed: sems can de dag yongs su gtong ba ni 'thab mo'o //
translated: or it is a fight to give up those sentient beings.

original: de ltar gdul bar bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar gdul bar bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus, in regard to what is to be tamed, etc.,

original: ji ltar gdul bar bya ba de bzhin du gdul bar bya ba yang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar gdul bar bya ba de bzhin du gdul bar bya ba yang ngo //
translated: just as there is what is to be tamed, so there is also what is not to be tamed.

original: de bas na de med pas shin tu yang mchog tu dka' ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de med pas shin tu yang mchog tu dka' ba byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of that, it is extremely difficult to do.

original: gang gi phyir bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed par nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed par nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of being able to do what is for one’s own and others’ benefit,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpas sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva should view all sentient beings as the same.

original: de yang 'dir ji ltar na spyod pa yin par shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de yang 'dir ji ltar na spyod pa yin par shes par bya zhe na /
translated: And how should he know that this is the practice here?

original: gal te 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “If he thinks thus,” and so on.

original: zhum par ma gyur pa ni mi skyo ba ste /
analyzed: zhum par ma gyur pa ni mi skyo ba ste /
translated: “Not becoming fainthearted” means not becoming discouraged.

original: shin tu yang dga' ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu yang dga' ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is very joyful.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la spyod pa na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la spyod pa na /
translated: Why is that?🔽He thinks, “Because I see the selflessness of phenomena.”

original: gtan tshigs gang yin /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang yin /
translated: What is the reason?

original: gang yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang ma yin te /
translated: Nothing at all.

original: chos bdag med pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bsams so //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bsams so //
translated: Because I see the selflessness of phenomena.

original: de'i phyir sems can dben pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //🔽lha'i bu dag de ltar na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can dben pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no // lha'i bu dag de ltar na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Therefore, “Because sentient beings are isolated,” and so on, is the answer.

original: blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: “Divine princes, thus,” and so on up to “should be seen” is the conclusion.

original: chos thams cad dben zhing mnyam pa nyid ces bya bas ni gnyen po rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: chos thams cad dben zhing mnyam pa nyid ces bya bas ni gnyen po rgya cher bstan to //
translated: The phrase all phenomena are isolated and equal indicates the extensive antidote.

original: sems can sna tshogs pa dang / chos sna tshogs pa dben pa de bas na /
analyzed: sems can sna tshogs pa dang / chos sna tshogs pa dben pa de bas na /
translated: Since the various sentient beings and the various phenomena are isolated,🔽the perfection of wisdom is not of one taste.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ro gcig pa ma yin no snyam pa @177b ni sna tshogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par ro gcig pa ma yin no snyam pa @177b ni sna tshogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The thought it is not of one taste is the conceptualization of variety.

original: lha'i bu dag gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ltar bshad pa la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ltar bshad pa la zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase sons of gods, if you think and so on. The phrase in that explanation refers to the explanation above.

original: de ltar na de'i bshad pa ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i bshad pa ni nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase in that explanation means in that teaching.

original: chos thams cad dben pa nyid ces bya ba ni spyod pa'i dus su mthong na /
analyzed: chos thams cad dben pa nyid ces bya ba ni spyod pa'i dus su mthong na /
translated: The phrase all phenomena are isolated refers to the time of practice.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhum par mi byed ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //🔽zhum par mi byed ces bya ba ni gnas pa dang / 'jug pa la ma rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhum par mi byed ces bya ba dang sbyar ro // zhum par mi byed ces bya ba ni gnas pa dang / 'jug pa la ma rmongs pa ste /
translated: The phrase the bodhisattva does not become fainthearted is connected to that.

original: gang nas 'gro bar bya ba dang / gang du gnas par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: gang nas 'gro bar bya ba dang / gang du gnas par bya ba la'o //
translated: The phrase does not become fainthearted means is not confused about abiding and engaging, that is, about where to go and where to abide.

original: de nyid kyis chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du yang dag par rig cing /
analyzed: de nyid kyis chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du yang dag par rig cing /
translated: By that very fact, he knows all phenomena to be sameness,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dag la ma rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dag la ma rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not confused about those perfections of wisdom.

original: de ltar na gang gis byang chub der 'gro bar bya ba dang / gnas pa de nyid rang nyid la rag las pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de ltar na gang gis byang chub der 'gro bar bya ba dang / gnas pa de nyid rang nyid la rag las pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Thus, the very cause and effect situation that is to be gone to and abides in enlightenment is dependent on himself.

original: des gang gis der 'gro ba dang / gang du gnas pa ni der yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang de nyid du 'gro zhing de nyid du gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: des gang gis der 'gro ba dang / gang du gnas pa ni der yongs su bsngos pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang de nyid du 'gro zhing de nyid du gnas pa yin te /
translated: The five perfections that are dedicated to that are also gone to and abide in that very place, by which one goes there and abides there.

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i 'khor lo rin po che gang nas 'gro ba dang / gang du gnas pa der dpung gi tshogs thams cad de nas 'gro zhing de nyid du gnas pa de lta bu ste gnyen po'o //
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i 'khor lo rin po che gang nas 'gro ba dang / gang du gnas pa der dpung gi tshogs thams cad de nas 'gro zhing de nyid du gnas pa de lta bu ste gnyen po'o //
translated: For example, wherever the precious wheel of the universal monarch goes and abides, the entire army goes there and abides there.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i ma rig pa ni drug pa'i snang ba med pa des na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i ma rig pa ni drug pa'i snang ba med pa des na /
translated: The ignorance of the five perfections is the nonappearance of the sixth.

original: gnas pa dang 'jug pa la nges pa med pas gnas pa dang 'jug pa la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa dang 'jug pa la nges pa med pas gnas pa dang 'jug pa la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conception of confusion about abiding and engaging is due to the uncertainty of abiding and engaging.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for “in this way,” etc.,

original: zhum par mi byed pa des rtogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: zhum par mi byed pa des rtogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: the realization by that non-discouragement is the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: mngon par zhen pa dang // chos kyi dngos po btags pa dang // chags pa dang ni gnyen po dang // ji ltar 'dod bzhin 'gro nyams la //

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bzhin du yod de /

analyzed: de gang la yod pa ni gnyen po'o //
translated: The antidote to that is to not attend to those dharmas.🔽The idea that “not attending to those dharmas is the antidote” is a conceptual thought.🔽The antidote to that is to not attend to those dharmas.

original: mngon par zhen pa yod na ji ltar mi gnas snyam pa ni mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa yod na ji ltar mi gnas snyam pa ni mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //

analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa cung zad kyang med pa ni gnyen po'o //

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos kyi dngos po rnams btags par yod pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos kyi dngos po rnams btags par yod pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva's perfection of giving, perfection of morality, up to the knowledge of all aspects, these things are imputedly existent.

original: 'di ni chos kyi dngos po btags pa yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi dngos po btags pa yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conceptualization of imputed existence of things.

original: de yang 'di la med pa 'di ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de yang 'di la med pa 'di ni gnyen po'o //
translated: And that does not exist here, this is the antidote.

original: chags pa nyid kyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de la mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: chags pa nyid kyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de la mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: One who is attached to perfect enlightenment will fully awaken to that.

original: gzhan du na rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro snyam pa ni chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro snyam pa ni chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, because of turning away, this is the conceptualization of attachment.

original: chos thams cad la chags pa med na /
analyzed: chos thams cad la chags pa med na /
translated: If there is no attachment to all dharmas,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med cing ma chags na cung zad kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med do //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med cing ma chags na cung zad kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med do //
translated: without grasping and without attachment, there is not even the slightest full awakening.

original: gal te de ltar spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
translated: If one practices in this way, one practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa ma yin /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa ma yin /
translated: The perfection of giving is not empty,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: the perfection of morality is not empty, etc.

original: de thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyen pa'o //
analyzed: de thams cad stong pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyen pa'o //
translated: This is the antidote to the conception of emptiness.

original: chos thams @178b cad kyi rnam pa thams cad dmigs pa ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba nyams pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams @178b cad kyi rnam pa thams cad dmigs pa ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro ba nyams pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conception of the loss of going as desired is the observation of all aspects of all things.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la de yod pa ma yin pa ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la de yod pa ma yin pa ni gnyen po'o //
translated: The antidote to that is the non-existence of that in the Bodhisattva.

original: rnam pa dgu po 'di dag ni yum chen mo dag las gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu po 'di dag ni yum chen mo dag las gsungs so //
translated: These nine conceptions are taught in the Great Mother Scripture.

original: 'dir ni spyir rdzas su yod pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyen po dang bcas pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir ni spyir rdzas su yod pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyen po dang bcas pa ni /
translated: Here, in general, the conception of substantial apprehension and its antidote are taught.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas zhum par mi bgyid de zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la mkhyen bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas zhum par mi bgyid de zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la mkhyen bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then, the Bhagavān, from “knowing” up to “does not become fainthearted” is stated.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis mi mkhyen pa ni cung zad kyang med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis mi mkhyen pa ni cung zad kyang med pa'o //
translated: “Knowing” means that there is nothing whatsoever that the Bhagavān does not know.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i rdzas su yod pa'i gang zag gi ngo bo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la grags pa'i rdzas su yod pa'i gang zag gi ngo bo //
translated: “Bodhisattva mahāsattva” is the nature of a person substantially existent in worldly renown.

original: de rgyu gang gis zhum par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rdzas su yod pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de rgyu gang gis zhum par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rdzas su yod pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: “By what cause does he not become fainthearted?” is the conception of a substantially existent apprehender.

original: de'i gnyen po ni mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The antidote to that is non-observation.

original: de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das dben pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das dben pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: That itself is stated by the Bhagavān with “seclusion,” and so on.

original: med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of “because it does not exist” is

original: de nyid rang nyid med par zhum par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid rang nyid med par zhum par ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: how can that itself, which is itself non-existent, become fainthearted?

original: gang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the second conception of an apprehender,

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:🔽The nine conceptual thoughts are:🔽the non-occurrence of the intended object,🔽the ascertainment of the path and non-path,🔽birth with cessation,🔽the possession and non-possession of things,

original: ched bzhin nges par mi 'byung dang // lam dang lam min nges 'dzin dang // 'gog dang bcas pa'i skye ba dang // dngos po ldan dang mi ldan dang // gnas dang rigs dang 'jig pa dang // don du gnyer dang rgyu med dang // phyir rgol ba ni dmigs pa la //
analyzed: ched bzhin nges par mi 'byung dang // lam dang lam min nges 'dzin dang // 'gog dang bcas pa'i skye ba dang // dngos po ldan dang mi ldan dang // gnas dang rigs dang 'jig pa dang // don du gnyer dang rgyu med dang // phyir rgol ba ni dmigs pa la //
translated: abiding, type, destruction,🔽purposelessness, and the absence of cause,🔽and the observation of an opponent.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog gzhan yin no //
translated: These are the other conceptual thoughts.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is stated.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ni dang po nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dgu po 'di ni de dag gi chos ma yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ni dang po nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dgu po 'di ni de dag gi chos ma yin no //
translated: These nine conceptual thoughts are not the phenomena of ordinary beings because they are the first.

original: 'on kyang 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos yin te /
translated: However, they are the phenomena of noble śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: de dag gis spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis spang bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are to be abandoned by them.

original: de dag gi gnyen po ni mdo las ji ltar kha lo sgyur bas rta rnams la yang dag pa'i lam ston pa ltar /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po ni mdo las ji ltar kha lo sgyur bas rta rnams la yang dag pa'i lam ston pa ltar /
translated: Their antidotes are as follows. Just as a charioteer shows horses the correct path,

original: drug las kyang lnga po rnams la de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: drug las kyang lnga po rnams la de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
translated: And the antidote to the sixth is the statement, “The same is true of the first five.”

original: drug pa med par ni kha lo sgyur ba med do //
analyzed: drug pa med par ni kha lo sgyur ba med do //
translated: But without the sixth, there is no charioteer.

original: 'di ni ched du bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du nges par mi 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ched du bya ba ji lta ba bzhin du nges par mi 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the misconception of the non-production of the object as it really is.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi @179a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi @179a * //
translated: The path of the knowledge of all modes

original: lam ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam yin la /
analyzed: lam ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam yin la /
translated: is the path of the bodhisattvas.

original: dman pa'i byang chub kyi lam ni de dag gi lam ma yin te /
analyzed: dman pa'i byang chub kyi lam ni de dag gi lam ma yin te /
translated: The path to the lesser enlightenment is not their path.

original: de dag nyid nges par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni drug pa kho na ste gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid nges par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni drug pa kho na ste gnyen po'o //
translated: The antidote to the seventh is the statement, “Only they are the holders of the Dharma.”

original: de med pa'i lam dang lam ma yin pa nges par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i lam dang lam ma yin pa nges par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the misconception of the path and the non-path.

original: 'di ni chos gang la yang bskyed pa 'am 'gog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos gang la yang bskyed pa 'am 'gog pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not the production or stopping of any dharma.

original: chos 'di tshad mar byas nas zhes bya ba'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: chos 'di tshad mar byas nas zhes bya ba'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The antidote to the eighth is the statement, “Having taken this Dharma as the standard.

original: bskyed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: bskyed pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams so //
translated: ” Production is the dharmas of the Buddhas.

original: 'gog pa ni de'i sgrib pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni de'i sgrib pa rnams te /
translated: Stopping is their obscurations.

original: 'di ni skye ba dang / 'gog pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //🔽chos thams cad dang ldan pas yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni skye ba dang / 'gog pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o // chos thams cad dang ldan pas yang ma yin /
translated: This is the concept of origination and cessation.

original: mi ldan pas yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: mi ldan pas yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
translated: All dharmas are neither conjoined nor disjoined.🔽This is the antidote.

original: ldan pa dang mi ldan pa snyam pa 'di ni ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa dang mi ldan pa snyam pa 'di ni ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The idea of conjoined and disjoined is the concept of conjoined and disjoined.

original: gzugs la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o zhes rnal 'byor du byed cing chos thams cad gang la yang mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyen pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o zhes rnal 'byor du byed cing chos thams cad gang la yang mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyen pa'o //
translated: One should not stand in form, etc. to: the knowledge of all modes.🔽This is the antidote.

original: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par bya'o snyam pa ni gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par bya'o snyam pa ni gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The idea of standing in form, etc. to: the knowledge of all modes is the concept of standing.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu 'dod pas sa bon btab nas yongs su smin pa ni dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu 'dod pas sa bon btab nas yongs su smin pa ni dpyod par byed do //
translated: Just as one who wants fruit plants a tree, and when it has grown, tends it,

original: de bzhin du byang chub chen po 'dod pas pha rol tu phyin pa dag la bslabs nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub chen po 'dod pas pha rol tu phyin pa dag la bslabs nas /
translated: Likewise, one who desires great enlightenment should train in the perfections,

original: de dag gis sems can yongs su bzung zhing 'khor ba las yongs su bsgral bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de dag gis sems can yongs su bzung zhing 'khor ba las yongs su bsgral bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
translated: and should take up sentient beings and liberate them from cyclic existence.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed nas /
translated: Having generated the thought of enlightenment,

original: sems can btang snyoms byed pa 'di ni rigs rnam par 'jig pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sems can btang snyoms byed pa 'di ni rigs rnam par 'jig pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: to abandon sentient beings is the conceptualization of the destruction of the family.

original: don du gnyer ba ni dgos pa don du gnyer ba ste /
analyzed: don du gnyer ba ni dgos pa don du gnyer ba ste /
translated: One who desires the aim is one who desires the aim of the purpose.

original: chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba rjes su thob par 'dod par drug pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba rjes su thob par 'dod par drug pa la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
translated: One should train in the sixth in order to attain mastery over all dharmas and to attain the desired aim.

original: de la bslab par mi bya'o snyam pa ni don du mi gnyer ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la bslab par mi bya'o snyam pa ni don du mi gnyer ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: To think, I should not train in that is the conceptualization of non-desire.

original: drug pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: drug pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyu ste /
translated: The sixth is the cause of all the Buddha dharmas,

original: rin po che thams cad kyi rgya mtsho bzhin no //
analyzed: rin po che thams cad kyi rgya mtsho bzhin no //
translated: like the ocean of all jewels.

original: de yongs su bsgoms na dkar po'i chos sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de yongs su bsgoms na dkar po'i chos sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o //

original: drug pa med pa na rgyu med pa'i phyir ro snyam pa ni rgyu med @179b pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: drug pa med pa na rgyu med pa'i phyir ro snyam pa ni rgyu med @179b pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /
translated: When he practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams dgongs par mdzad de /🔽gzugs la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams dgongs par mdzad de / gzugs la sogs pa nas /
translated: the Buddhas of the three times think of him.🔽From form up to omniscience,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yang ma yin zhing /

analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ma yin pa de bzhin du dgongs pa mdzad do //
translated: but here, just as he is not from form up to omniscience, so they think of him.

original: 'di ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyen po'o //
translated: This is the antidote.

original: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dgongs pa mdzad de snyam pa ni phyir rgol ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la dgongs pa mdzad de snyam pa ni phyir rgol ba'i chos la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The thought They think of him from form up to omniscience is the conceptualization of the opponent's object.

original: dbye ba rnam pa dgu po 'di dag kyang bcom ldan 'das yum chen mo dag las gsungs so //🔽'dir ni spyir btags par yod pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyen po dang bcas pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das chos gang yang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dbye ba rnam pa dgu po 'di dag kyang bcom ldan 'das yum chen mo dag las gsungs so // 'dir ni spyir btags par yod pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyen po dang bcas pa / bcom ldan 'das chos gang yang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: These nine divisions are also taught in the great mother sutras.

original: chos de yang dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: chos de yang dmigs su med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
translated: Here, in general, the conceptualization of the apprehended as existent by imputation together with its antidote is taught by “Bhagavan, if any dharma” up to “that dharma is not apprehended.”

original: chos gang yang zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: chos gang yang zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: “Any dharma” refers to

original: phung po la sogs pa'i yul la bdag tu btags pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i yul la bdag tu btags pa'o //
translated: the imputation of self in the domain of the aggregates and so on.

original: zhum par 'gyur ba ma mchis pa ni rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhum par 'gyur ba ma mchis pa ni rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro //

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /

original: de ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “why is that?” and so on is stated.

original: chos gang yang zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'am sems so //
analyzed: chos gang yang zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'am sems so //
translated: “Any dharma” refers to the aggregates and so on or the mind.

original: chos gang gis zhes bya ba ni sems kyis so //
analyzed: chos gang gis zhes bya ba ni sems kyis so //
translated: “By any dharma” refers to the mind.

original: chos gang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: chos gang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: “Any dharma” refers to the bodhisattva.

original: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni zhal gyis bzhes pa'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni zhal gyis bzhes pa'o //
translated: So it is is the acceptance.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni sems can rdzas su yod pa dang / ngar 'dzin pa'i yul phung po la sogs pa dang / sems byang chub sems dpa' med pa ni gnyen por gsungs so ;
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni sems can rdzas su yod pa dang / ngar 'dzin pa'i yul phung po la sogs pa dang / sems byang chub sems dpa' med pa ni gnyen por gsungs so ;
translated: By this much, the substantial existence of sentient beings, the aggregates, etc. , which are the objects of the conception of self, and the non-existence of the mind as a Bodhisattva are taught as the antidotes.

original: /'di ni btags par yod pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: /'di ni btags par yod pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth misconception, that of the existence of the apprehended as a designation.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par rtog pa bzhi po'i gnyen po bcom ldan 'das yum las rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par rtog pa bzhi po'i gnyen po bcom ldan 'das yum las rgya cher bstan to //
translated: Thus, the Transcendent Lord has extensively taught in the Perfection of Wisdom the antidotes to the four misconceptions.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa ni /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa ni /
translated: In this regard, the practice of the Bodhisattva

original: ji ltar shes par bya ba de ni /
analyzed: ji ltar shes par bya ba de ni /
translated: is just as it is to be understood.

original: yang rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Again, Subhuti, Bodhisattva and so on is stated.

original: brjod pa ni tshig go //
analyzed: brjod pa ni tshig go //

analyzed: bshad pa ni don to // bstan pa ni khyad par med par brjod pa'i phyir bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation is the meaning.🔽The teaching is the teaching because it is expressed without distinction.

original: gsang bar brjod pa'i phyir nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gsang bar brjod pa'i phyir nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The clear description is the clear description because it is expressed in secret.

original: zhum par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dman par mi 'gyur ba'o //🔽yi mi @180a * //🔽gsod ces bya bas ni skyo bas so //
analyzed: zhum par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dman par mi 'gyur ba'o // yi mi @180a * // gsod ces bya bas ni skyo bas so //

original: yi mi gsod pas mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgyun du skyo bas so //
analyzed: yi mi gsod pas mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgyun du skyo bas so //

original: kun tu zhum par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rlom pas so //
analyzed: kun tu zhum par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rlom pas so //

analyzed: yang dag par zhum par mi 'gyur ba ni rgyun du rlom par mi 'gyur bas so //
translated: “Not utterly downcast” means not continuously conceited.

original: phyir phyogs pa ni rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyir phyogs pa ni rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
translated: “Not turning away” means not turning one’s back.

original: yid phyir phyogs par mi byed pa ni yang mngon du phyogs par mi byed pa'o //🔽mi skrag pa ni skrag pa la mngon du bltas pas so //🔽mi dngang ba ni yang dag par mi dngang bas so //
analyzed: yid phyir phyogs par mi byed pa ni yang mngon du phyogs par mi byed pa'o // mi skrag pa ni skrag pa la mngon du bltas pas so // mi dngang ba ni yang dag par mi dngang bas so //
translated: “Not turning away the mind” means not turning away from the manifest.🔽“Not frightened” means not frightened by what is manifest.🔽“Not terrified” means not terrified by what is real.

original: dngang bar mi 'gyur ba ni rtag pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dngang bar mi 'gyur ba ni rtag pa nyid kyis so //
translated: “Not trembling with fear” means not trembling with fear.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di spyod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di spyod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be known that this perfection of wisdom is practiced.

original: de la mi spyod na ni zhum pa la sogs par nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mi spyod na ni zhum pa la sogs par nges par 'gyur ro //

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar ni rab 'byor gyis khas blangs pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar spyod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni khyad par can gyi phan yon gsungs so ;

analyzed: / phan 'dogs pa ni khyad par du bdag gir mdzad pa'o //

original: dgongs par mdzad pa ni dran par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: dgongs par mdzad pa ni dran par mdzad pa ste /

analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos ston par mdzad pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: ming dang zhes bya ba ni ming du btags pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang zhes bya ba ni ming du btags pa'o //

analyzed: rus ni sh'akya la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: stobs ni lus kyi stobs dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs so //

original: kha dog ni phags pa'i yon tan /
analyzed: kha dog ni phags pa'i yon tan /

original: gzugs ni kha dog dang dbyibs te ;
analyzed: gzugs ni kha dog dang dbyibs te ;

original: 'di dag yongs su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag yongs su brjod pa'o //

analyzed: khyad par gyi khyad par du gyur pa ni gzugs so //

analyzed: ched du brjod do zhes bya ba ni rjod par byed pa ste /
translated: The expression expresses means to make known.

original: gang gi yon tan zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi yon tan zhe na /

analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so ; /'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba ni dpe bstan to //

analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don bstan to //

analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhus pa'o //

analyzed: rab 'byor de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan no //
translated: The expression Subhuti, it is not so indicates the answer.

analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni thams cad yang @180b dag pa med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rab 'byor gyos gsol pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yang dris pa'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //

original: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug bsdu ba'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //

analyzed: rab 'byor 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug bsdu ba'o //

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: The statement beginning with Moreover, Subhūti is the next topic.

analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyis dbang po de thob pa ni thob pa'o //

analyzed: gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
translated: The summary beginning with These, Subhūti is the summary.

original: ji ltar mos par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mos par 'gyur zhe na /

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs te /

analyzed: de dag las kyang zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa 'ba' zhig ma yin pa'o ;

analyzed: / gang dag ce na gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa dang de'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: “ By them” means by Akṣobhya and his bodhisattvas.

analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni thos pa'i phan yon mjug bsdu ba dang / de bzhin du sgrub pa la sogs pa'i phan yon khyad par du gyur pa gsungs so //
translated: Beginning with “thus” , the benefits of hearing are summarized, and the benefits of practice, etc., are stated in particular.

original: de ltar phan yon khyad par du gyur pa gsungs nas /
analyzed: de ltar phan yon khyad par du gyur pa gsungs nas /
translated: Having stated the special benefits in this way,

analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par le'u rdzogs pa'i bar gyis bstan te /
translated: the special perfection of wisdom that is the present topic is taught up to the end of the chapter.

original: rab 'byor gyis skabs de ston pa ni rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis skabs de ston pa ni rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Subhūti’s teaching of that topic is stated beginning with “Subhūti having said” .

original: de bzhin nyid ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid tsam kho na ma gtogs pa'i phyir dang / kun du brtags pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa snang ba med pa'i phyir chos gang yang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ma gtogs par zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid tsam kho na ma gtogs pa'i phyir dang / kun du brtags pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa snang ba med pa'i phyir chos gang yang dmigs su med do //
translated: “Except for suchness” means that, because only suchness is not included, and because the various imagined appearances are not perceived, no dharma is perceived.

analyzed: de'i tshe chos gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: “At that time, what dharma” and so on is easy to understand.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin nyid kyang re zhig dmigs su med na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin nyid kyang re zhig dmigs su med na zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Subhūti, suchness itself is not perceived” means

original: de ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: that it is not an object of apprehension.

analyzed: gang de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o // thogs pa zhes bya ba ni rdugs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in suchness🔽“obstruction” means “hindrance.”

original: brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni dbang du byas pa'o /
analyzed: brtsams pa zhes bya ba ni dbang du byas pa'o /
translated: “Commence” means “take up.”

original: @181a * // chos smras pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pa smra ba'o //
analyzed: @181a * // chos smras pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pa smra ba'o //
translated: “Dharma preacher” means “one who speaks rationally.”

original: chos ni sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: “Dharma” means the nirvāṇa of the buddhas.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i chos ni rjes su mthun pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i chos ni rjes su mthun pa'i lam mo //
translated: The Dharma that is in accordance with it is the path that is in accordance with it.

original: lung bstan pa ni brda sprod pa'o //
analyzed: lung bstan pa ni brda sprod pa'o //
translated: The prediction is the prediction.

original: lung ston pa ni lung ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lung ston pa ni lung ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The one who predicts is the one who predicts.

original: chos thams cad dben pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad dben pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the isolation of all phenomena.

original: de la gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin te /

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa de la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa de la gnas pa'o //
translated: The state of abiding in the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

analyzed: koo shi ka gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab 'byor gyis gnas pa las byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa khyad par du gyur pa ston par byed do //
translated: Kausika,  and so on, shows that Subhuti's state of abiding is a special state of abiding for the Bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'thad pa gsungs te /
analyzed: koo shi ka zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'thad pa gsungs te /

analyzed: spyod pa ni ting nge 'dzin grub pa'i don du'o //
translated: The practice is for the sake of accomplishing meditative stabilization.

original: gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin grub pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin grub pa'o //

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //

original: rtogs par dka' ba ni gong nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba ni gong nyid du bshad do //
