original: snying po la sogs pa'i le'u ni snying po'i le'u'o //
analyzed: snying po la sogs pa'i le'u ni snying po'i le'u'o //
translated: The chapter on the heart and so on is the chapter on the heart.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel /
translated: Noble One, this is the commentary on the perfection of wisdom in eight thousand lines.

original: slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'o /
translated: This is the twenty-seventh chapter of the Supreme Essence Ornament of Clear Realization, composed by the master Ratnākaraśānti.

original: // / sgyu ma lta bu dang snying po'i le'u dag tu mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa bstan nas mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas na nges par byang chub thob par ston te /
analyzed: // / sgyu ma lta bu dang snying po'i le'u dag tu mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa bstan nas mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas na nges par byang chub thob par ston te /
translated: Having explained the conceptions to be abandoned through seeing in the chapters on illusion-like and essence, it shows that if one abides in the perfection of wisdom of the path of seeing and so forth, one will definitely attain enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir de nyid kyi rgyu gsum ni le'u 'dis dang po brjod par bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid kyi rgyu gsum ni le'u 'dis dang po brjod par bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, the first of the three causes for that is stated in this chapter.

original: phyi nas ni byang chub kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phyi nas ni byang chub kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Later, it is the characteristic of enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir rgyu gsum gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu gsum gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Therefore, in terms of the three causes,🔽in the treatise,

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: it says:🔽The teaching of enlightenment from others,🔽its cause is complete giving,

original: byang chub gzhan las ston pa dang // de yi rgyu ni yongs gtong dang // de thob bar chad med pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: byang chub gzhan las ston pa dang // de yi rgyu ni yongs gtong dang // de thob bar chad med pa'i rgyu //
translated: the cause of attaining it without obstruction,🔽and the cause of attaining it quickly.

original: bsod nams mang po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is the characteristic of great merit.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas na byang chub de thob pa ni thob pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas na byang chub de thob pa ni thob pa'o //
translated: If one abides in the perfection of wisdom as explained, one attains that enlightenment.

original: de'i bar chad med pa ni med na mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bar chad med pa ni med na mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: Its non-obstruction is the non-absence of the cause.

original: rgyu ni shes par byed pa ste rnam pa gsum gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu ni shes par byed pa ste rnam pa gsum gsungs so //
translated: The cause is the producer, and three types are mentioned.

original: mdo las byang chub ston pa ni gang gzhan dag la lung ston pa ste de ni rgyu dang po'o //
analyzed: mdo las byang chub ston pa ni gang gzhan dag la lung ston pa ste de ni rgyu dang po'o //
translated: In the sutra, the teaching of enlightenment is the prediction for others, which is the first cause.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'phags pa kun dga' bo la yongs su gtad pa ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'phags pa kun dga' bo la yongs su gtad pa ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The entrustment to the noble Ananda as the cause of future enlightenment is the second cause.

original: bsod nams mang po'i mtshan nyid ni rgyu @181b gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po'i mtshan nyid ni rgyu @181b gsum pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of great merit is the third cause.

original: de'i phyir mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las /
translated: Therefore, in the sutra, it is said:

original: de nas de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Then at that time... and so on.

original: me tog bkram pa zhes bya bar lung ston pa la /
analyzed: me tog bkram pa zhes bya bar lung ston pa la /
translated: In the prediction called Scattering Flowers,

original: de nas lha rnams kyi me tog dag blangs nas /
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi me tog dag blangs nas /
translated: after taking the flowers of the gods,

original: lung bstan par bya ba rnams kyis gtor ba dang / de nas 'od zer byung ste slar zhugs pa na kun dga' bos zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag lung bstan te /
analyzed: lung bstan par bya ba rnams kyis gtor ba dang / de nas 'od zer byung ste slar zhugs pa na kun dga' bos zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag lung bstan te /
translated: and then light rays issued forth and reentered, and Ananda asked about them, and the Lord prophesied them.

original: des de dag lung bstan pas /
analyzed: des de dag lung bstan pas /
translated: By that prophecy,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du yang mtshon te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du yang mtshon te /
translated: they were indicated in other world systems,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bstan pa'i phyir dang / tshe dang dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i dus kyang ring ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bstan pa'i phyir dang / tshe dang dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i dus kyang ring ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they were taught as world systems, and because the time of the life and true Dharma would be long.

original: de'i 'og tu kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then, Ananda, therefore, etc., up to

original: gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: should be maintained, is the conclusion.

original: 'di ni skabs kyi gnas pas ni byang chub thob pa'i rgyu dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni skabs kyi gnas pas ni byang chub thob pa'i rgyu dang po'o //
translated: This is the first cause of attaining enlightenment by the state of opportunity.

original: kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang su dag ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang su dag ces bya ba nas /
translated: Ananda, whatever Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas, etc., up to

original: mngon du gyur pa yin par rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa yin par rtogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: should be understood as manifest, is the second cause of attaining enlightenment by the state of opportunity.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan bstan to //🔽kun dga' bo gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan bstan to // kun dga' bo gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: The qualities of the perfection of wisdom are taught.

original: rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gang 'di dag mnyan nas mi spong ba de dag gi yon tan gsungs te /
analyzed: rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gang 'di dag mnyan nas mi spong ba de dag gi yon tan gsungs te /
translated: With Ānanda, whoever, etc., up to should be known, the qualities of those who, having listened to this, do not abandon it are taught.

original: smod par byed pa ni yid kyis smod pa'o //
analyzed: smod par byed pa ni yid kyis smod pa'o //
translated: To deprecate is to deprecate mentally.

original: 'gal bar byed pa ni yid kyis btang ba'o //🔽'khrug par byed pa ni de las 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal bar byed pa ni yid kyis btang ba'o // 'khrug par byed pa ni de las 'khrug pa'o //
translated: To contradict is to mentally reject.🔽To agitate is to agitate about it.

original: 'jig par byed pa ni sbas nas 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa ni sbas nas 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: To destroy is to destroy it in secret.

original: spong bar byed pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i gnod par byed pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: spong bar byed pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i gnod par byed pa brjod pa'o //
translated: To abandon is to express false criticism.

original: 'gog par byed pa ni snying po med par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog par byed pa ni snying po med par brjod pa'o //
translated: To stop is to express it as worthless.

original: 'dud pa ni de dag la zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'dud pa ni de dag la zhen pa'o //
translated: To bow is to be attached to it.

original: kun dga' bo 'di ltar yang zhes bya ba nas spyad par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rgyu gnyis gnyis gsungs te //
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'di ltar yang zhes bya ba nas spyad par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rgyu gnyis gnyis gsungs te //
translated: With Ānanda, it should be known that whoever, etc., up to should be known, two causes are taught.

original: slu ba med pa'i smon lam dang byas pa gzo ba'o //
analyzed: slu ba med pa'i smon lam dang byas pa gzo ba'o //
translated: and the unerring aspiration and gratitude.

original: de nyid gang su dag ces bya ba la sogs pas rgya cher dri bar byas nas /
analyzed: de nyid gang su dag ces bya ba la sogs pas rgya cher dri bar byas nas /
translated: That very thing is stated in detail in the question beginning with “whoever.”

original: kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtad pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gtad pa gsungs te /
translated: “Therefore, Ānanda,” etc. states the entrustment.

original: gtad pa ni yang dag par gtad pa'o //
analyzed: gtad pa ni yang dag par gtad pa'o //
translated: Entrustment is the correct entrustment.

original: de nyid rjes su 'brel pa ni rjes su gtad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rjes su 'brel pa ni rjes su gtad pa'o //
translated: That very thing is the connection, the entrustment.

original: yi ge 'dus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: yi ge 'dus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: In the passage beginning with “the collection of letters,”

original: yi ge 'dus pa ni yi ge'i @182a * //
analyzed: yi ge 'dus pa ni yi ge'i @182a * //
translated: the collection of letters is the collection of letters.

original: tshogs so // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: tshogs so // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is stated, “because of grasping,” etc.

original: ci'i phyir gtad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gtad pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is there an entrustment?

original: 'di ci nas kyang nub par mi 'gyur bzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ci nas kyang nub par mi 'gyur bzhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is stated, “so that this will not disappear.”

original: ji ltar nub par mi 'gyur ba de ltar khyod kyis shig pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar nub par mi 'gyur ba de ltar khyod kyis shig pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that you should do it in such a way that it will not disappear.

original: kun dga' bo gal te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Ānanda, if,” etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gnyis pa'i gleng gzhi brjod nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gnyis pa'i gleng gzhi brjod nas /
translated: Here, later means afterwards.🔽Will be lost means will be destroyed.🔽 Entrusting is not quickly giving up.🔽Will not be able to remember means will forget.🔽 Pleased and delighted means will be happy.🔽 Mother means gives rise to the seed.🔽 Nourisher means makes the seed grow.🔽 Giver means produces.🔽 The passage from Ananda, this perfection of wisdom, up to this point expresses the nidana.

original: kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba nas ni gtad pa gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba nas ni gtad pa gnyis pa ste /
translated: The second entrusting is from Therefore, Ananda, up to this point.

original: 'dir phyis zhes bya bas ni phyi nas so //
analyzed: 'dir phyis zhes bya bas ni phyi nas so //
translated: Here, later means afterwards.

original: chud gsan pa ni nyams par byas pa'o //
analyzed: chud gsan pa ni nyams par byas pa'o //
translated: Will be lost means will be destroyed.

original: gtad pa ni myur bar rjes su mi gtang ba'o //
analyzed: gtad pa ni myur bar rjes su mi gtang ba'o //
translated: Entrusting is not quickly giving up.

original: dran par mi nus pa ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dran par mi nus pa ni brjod pa'o //
translated: Will not be able to remember means will forget.

original: mgu par byas pa dang / mnyes par byas pa ni dgyes par ro //
analyzed: mgu par byas pa dang / mnyes par byas pa ni dgyes par ro //
translated: Pleased and delighted means will be happy.

original: yum ni sa bon bskyed pa'o //🔽skyed pa ni sa bon rgyas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yum ni sa bon bskyed pa'o // skyed pa ni sa bon rgyas par byed pa'o //
translated: Mother means gives rise to the seed.🔽 Nourisher means makes the seed grow.

original: 'byin pa ni skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byin pa ni skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Giver means produces.

original: kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: kun dga' bo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from Ananda, this perfection of wisdom, up to this point expresses the nidana.🔽 The second entrusting is from Therefore, Ananda, up to this point.🔽 Here, later means afterwards.🔽Will be lost means will be destroyed.🔽 Entrusting is not quickly giving up.🔽Will not be able to remember means will forget.🔽 Pleased and delighted means will be happy.🔽 Mother means gives rise to the seed.🔽 Nourisher means makes the seed grow.

original: ston pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gleng gzhi brjod nas /🔽kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ston pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gleng gzhi brjod nas /🔽kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Giver means produces.

original: rjes su bstan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gtad pa gsum pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gtad pa gsum pa ste /
translated: The third entrustment is indicated by the passage up to “should be taught.

original: 'dir nges pa'i tshig bzang po ni legs par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir nges pa'i tshig bzang po ni legs par brjod pa'o //
translated: ” Here, good expression is good speech.

original: chos kyi sku nyid ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku nyid ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The Dharma Body itself is the perfection of wisdom itself.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ni de nyid de 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bya ba rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ni de nyid de 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bya ba rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Its nature is that itself, which should be connected with the activities that will be explained.

original: de la bya ba ni bkur sti la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bya ba ni bkur sti la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, activity is respect, etc.

original: dbul ba ni me tog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbul ba ni me tog la sogs pa'o //
translated: Offering is flowers, etc.

original: bsam par bya ba ni ston pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam par bya ba ni ston pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: What should be thought is teaching, etc.

original: dge ba zhes bya ba ni bsod nams 'dod pas so //
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba ni bsod nams 'dod pas so //
translated: Virtuous means desiring merit.

original: reg par gnas pa ni de nyid mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg par gnas pa ni de nyid mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The state of contact is for the sake of realizing that itself.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Endowed with good qualities means by virtue, etc.

original: 'dir thub par bshad pa ni gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir thub par bshad pa ni gsungs pa'o //
translated: Here, the Sage’s explanation is what was said.

original: bskal pa'i mtha' 'am /
analyzed: bskal pa'i mtha' 'am /
translated: The end of the eon,

original: de bas lhag par yang bshad du yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de bas lhag par yang bshad du yod mod kyi /
translated: or even more than that, could be explained.

original: 'on kyang kun dga' bo la ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdor bsdus nas bshad do //🔽de nas yang kun dga' bo gang la la zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang kun dga' bo la ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdor bsdus nas bshad do // de nas yang kun dga' bo gang la la zhes bya ba nas /
translated: However, it is summarized in the passage beginning with “Ānanda, how is it?”

original: thob par byed pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gleng gzhi brjod nas /
analyzed: thob par byed pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gleng gzhi brjod nas /
translated: Then, beginning with “Ānanda, whoever,” up to “attains,” it states the nidāna.

original: kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba nas rjes su gtad do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gtad pa bzhi pa @182b gsungs te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de lta bas na zhes bya ba nas rjes su gtad do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gtad pa bzhi pa @182b gsungs te /
translated: Then, beginning with “Therefore, Ānanda,” up to “entrusts,” it teaches the fourth entrustment.

original: bzhi pa zhes brjod par bya ba la gnyis pa zhes brjod pa ni brjod pa dang / rjod pa'i spyis gsum gcig tu byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa zhes brjod par bya ba la gnyis pa zhes brjod pa ni brjod pa dang / rjod pa'i spyis gsum gcig tu byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It should be called the fourth, but it is called the second because the first and second are combined into one by the general term “statement” and “statement.”

original: gtad pa dang rjes su gtad pa ni gtad pa zhes bya ba don gcig go //
analyzed: gtad pa dang rjes su gtad pa ni gtad pa zhes bya ba don gcig go //
translated: Entrustment and entrusting are synonyms.

original: de ltar gtad pa rnam pa bzhi ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gtad pa rnam pa bzhi ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //
translated: Thus, the four entrustments are the second cause.

original: de nas kun dga' bo 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas gleng gzhi brjod nas /🔽kun dga' bo gal te khyod kyis zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas kun dga' bo 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas gleng gzhi brjod nas /🔽kun dga' bo gal te khyod kyis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then, beginning with “Ānanda, it is like this,” it states the nidāna.🔽Then, beginning with “Ānanda, if you,” up to “the Tathāgata’s teachings,” it teaches the fifth entrustment.

original: 'di ni gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: 'di ni gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: This is not the case, up to: this is not the case.

original: 'dir dus kyi mtha' ni skad cig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dus kyi mtha' ni skad cig pa'o //
translated: Here, the end of time is momentary.

original: skad cig ma brgya nyi shu la ni de'i skad cig go //
analyzed: skad cig ma brgya nyi shu la ni de'i skad cig go //
translated: One hundred and twenty moments is one of its moments.

original: de'i skad cig drug cu la thang cig go //🔽thang cig sum cu la ni yud tsam mo //
analyzed: de'i skad cig drug cu la thang cig go // thang cig sum cu la ni yud tsam mo //
translated: Sixty of its moments is one second.🔽Thirty seconds is one minute.

original: de sum cu la ni chu tshod do //
analyzed: de sum cu la ni chu tshod do //
translated: Thirty minutes is one hour.

original: 'di ni bsod nams mang po nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni bsod nams mang po nyid do //
translated: This is the abundance of merit.

original: rgyu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third cause.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'khor dang bcas pa bstan pa dang / mi snang bar byas pa ni dpe'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'khor dang bcas pa bstan pa dang / mi snang bar byas pa ni dpe'o //
translated: Then, the Blessed One, etc. illustrates the realm of the Blessed One Akshobhya together with his retinue, and the invisibility of the realm is the example.

original: 'dir rgya mtsho lta bu zhes bya ba ni rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽zad pa nyid ni bsam gtan phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rgya mtsho lta bu zhes bya ba ni rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir ro // zad pa nyid ni bsam gtan phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the ocean-like is because of its vastness.🔽The exhaustion is the perfection of meditation.

original: mi bskyod pa nyid ni shes rab phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa nyid ni shes rab phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The unshakability is the perfection of wisdom.

original: don la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir kun dga' bo de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni rigs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: don la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir kun dga' bo de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni rigs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to apply it to the meaning, he says, Ananda, thus... and so on. He states the reasoning with all dharmas... and so on.

original: dgos pa byed nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba gzhan no //
analyzed: dgos pa byed nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba gzhan no //
translated: The other thesis is, It is not able to perform a function.

original: byed pa med pa la sogs pa'i rigs pa ni smras zin to //🔽kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byed pa med pa la sogs pa'i rigs pa ni smras zin to // kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The reasoning of being without activity and so on has already been stated.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la slob po zhes bya bas ni phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la slob po zhes bya bas ni phan yon bstan to //
translated: Ananda, the bodhisattva... up to trains in the perfections teaches the benefits.

original: chags pa med pa nyid ni dmigs pa nyid dam /
analyzed: chags pa med pa nyid ni dmigs pa nyid dam /
translated: Non-attachment is either the object or

original: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes nyid do //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes nyid do //
translated: the unobstructed wisdom.

original: tshad ni rgya nges pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ni rgya nges pa'o //
translated: Measure is the determination of extent.

original: zad pa ni dus nges pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa ni dus nges pa'o //
translated: End is the determination of time.

original: mtha' ma ni grangs nges pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' ma ni grangs nges pa'o //
translated: Limit is the determination of number.

original: tshad chad pa ni tshad kyis yongs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: tshad chad pa ni tshad kyis yongs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The measure is cut off by the measure.

original: tshad med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being immeasurable means because of not being observed.

original: zad pa ni 'bring ngo //
analyzed: zad pa ni 'bring ngo //
translated: End is middling.

original: yongs su zad pa ni med pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su zad pa ni med pa'o //
translated: Exhaustion is non-existence.

original: nam mkha' mi zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' mi zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du zad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because space is inexhaustible, means because it is inexhaustible like space.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa @183a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa @183a * //
translated: Because of what? Because all dharmas are non-arisen.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad skye ba med pa des na de dag dmigs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad skye ba med pa des na de dag dmigs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Because all dharmas are non-arisen, they have the characteristic of non-apprehension.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang nam mkha' bzhin du mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang nam mkha' bzhin du mi zad pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom, like space, is inexhaustible.

original: mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du byas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du byas pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment means actualization.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zad pa med pa nyid ces bya ba ni de dag skye ba med pas so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zad pa med pa nyid ces bya ba ni de dag skye ba med pas so //
translated: The inexhaustibility of form, etc. means that they are non-arisen.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: Similarly, ignorance, etc.

original: de la 'di ni zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa yang mi zad pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de la 'di ni zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa yang mi zad pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Therein, this means that the aggregates and ignorance, etc. are inexhaustible.

original: mtha' gnyis ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'o //
translated: The two extremes are arising and perishing.

original: dbus ni skye ba gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dbus ni skye ba gnas pa'o //
translated: The middle is the place of birth.

original: ma 'dres pa ni de dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ni de dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: Unmixed means not common with that.

original: chos gang yang ma mthong ngo zhes bya bas ni phung po rnams yongs su gzung ba'o //
analyzed: chos gang yang ma mthong ngo zhes bya bas ni phung po rnams yongs su gzung ba'o //
translated: By I do not see any dharma at all, the aggregates are included.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong bas so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong bas so //
translated: Because of seeing dependent origination.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: Eternal means without beginning or end.

original: brtan pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: Stable means abiding.

original: ther zug pa ni mtha' ma med pa'o //🔽byed pa po'am /
analyzed: ther zug pa ni mtha' ma med pa'o // byed pa po'am /
translated: Unchanging means without end.

original: tshor ba po zhes bya ba ni spyod pa po dang / len pa po med pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba po zhes bya ba ni spyod pa po dang / len pa po med pa'o //
translated: Maker or experiencer means without an agent or appropriator.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, this...

original: gting rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: gting rnyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: ... will not find a basis is easy to understand.

original: 'di man chad kyis ni zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di man chad kyis ni zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i byang chub kyi mtshan nyid gsungs te /
translated: From here on, the characteristics of the enlightenment of the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising are taught.

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: In the treatise, it is said:

original: dri ma zad dang mi skye ba'i //
analyzed: dri ma zad dang mi skye ba'i //
translated: The knowledge of the exhaustion of defilements and non-arising

original: ye shes byang chub ces brjod de //
analyzed: ye shes byang chub ces brjod de //
translated: Is called enlightenment.

original: zad med skye med phyir de dag //🔽go rims bzhin du shes par bya //
analyzed: zad med skye med phyir de dag // go rims bzhin du shes par bya //
translated: Because of the non-exhaustion and non-production of those,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: they should be known in order as the knowledges of exhaustion and of non-production.

original: dri ma ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The defilements are the conceptual thoughts of the passions.

original: de dag zad pa dang / mi skye ba'i ye shes ni byang chub ste /
analyzed: de dag zad pa dang / mi skye ba'i ye shes ni byang chub ste /
translated: The knowledge of the exhaustion and non-production of those is enlightenment.

original: ye shes de yang zad pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa de dag la go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes de yang zad pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa de dag la go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: And that knowledge should be known in order as the knowledge of exhaustion and the knowledge of non-production.

original: zad pa gtan du med par shes pa ni zad pa shes pa dang / gtan du skye ba med par shes pa nyid kyis skye ba med par shes pa'o zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: zad pa gtan du med par shes pa ni zad pa shes pa dang / gtan du skye ba med par shes pa nyid kyis skye ba med par shes pa'o zhes dgongs so //
translated: The knowledge of the exhaustion of the defilements is the knowledge of exhaustion, and the knowledge of the non-production of the passions is the knowledge of non-production.

original: ji ste byang chub kyi mtshan nyid gzhan yod kyang de'i phyir 'di bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji ste byang chub kyi mtshan nyid gzhan yod kyang de'i phyir 'di bshad ce na /
translated: But if there is another characteristic of enlightenment, why is it explained?

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis rnam par rtog pa rnams zad pa na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis rnam par rtog pa rnams zad pa na /
translated: When the conceptual thoughts are exhausted by the path of insight,

original: zad pa dang mi skye bar rnam par lta ba'i don to //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye bar rnam par lta ba'i don to //
translated: the knowledge of the exhaustion and non-production of those is the knowledge of exhaustion and the knowledge of non-production.

original: de nyid / 'gog pa @183b med pa'i rang bzhin la //
analyzed: de nyid / 'gog pa @183b med pa'i rang bzhin la //
translated: That itself is the knowledge of non-production.🔽The knowledge of non-production is the knowledge of the non-production of the passions.

original: mthong zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
analyzed: mthong zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
translated: The knowledge of exhaustion is the knowledge of the exhaustion of the defilements.🔽The knowledge of non-production is the knowledge of the non-production of the passions.

original: rnam par rtog rigs ci zhig zad //
analyzed: rnam par rtog rigs ci zhig zad //
translated: What type of conceptualization is exhausted?

original: skye med rnam pa ci zhig 'thob //
analyzed: skye med rnam pa ci zhig 'thob //
translated: What type of non-arising is attained?

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The nature of conceptualizations is suchness.

original: nam yang de la zad pa dang skye ba med do //
analyzed: nam yang de la zad pa dang skye ba med do //
translated: Never is there exhaustion or arising in it.

original: rigs nyid ni rigs te rnam pa'o //🔽de bas na mthong ba'i lam gyis rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa gang yang zad pa'am /
analyzed: rigs nyid ni rigs te rnam pa'o // de bas na mthong ba'i lam gyis rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa gang yang zad pa'am /
translated: The type itself is the type, the aspect.

original: skye bar 'dor ba med do //
analyzed: skye bar 'dor ba med do //
translated: Therefore, by the path of seeing, no type of conceptualization is exhausted or abandoned.

original: gzhan dag ni /🔽zad pa shes pa bden rnams la //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni / zad pa shes pa bden rnams la //
translated: Others say:

original: yongs su shes la sogs pa yin //🔽yang shes pa ni byar med sogs //
analyzed: yongs su shes la sogs pa yin // yang shes pa ni byar med sogs //
translated: The knowledge of exhaustion is the thorough knowledge of the truths and so on.

original: mi skye ba yi chos 'dod do //
analyzed: mi skye ba yi chos 'dod do //
translated: The knowledge of nonarising is the nonarising of the phenomena of the object of action and so on.

original: zhes smra'o // de dag ni phung po bden pa bzhi rnams yod par sems te /
analyzed: zhes smra'o // de dag ni phung po bden pa bzhi rnams yod par sems te /
translated: They assert that the aggregates are the four truths.

original: de la mdor na nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal zad pa dang / yang mi skye ba thob ste /
analyzed: de la mdor na nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal zad pa dang / yang mi skye ba thob ste /
translated: In brief, they think that the exhaustion of affliction and suffering and the attainment of nonarising

original: de dag thob pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thob pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: The transcendent wisdom that obtains those is the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: gtso bor ni de bzhin gshegs pa shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams kyang spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: gtso bor ni de bzhin gshegs pa shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams kyang spangs pa yin te /
translated: The principal one is the Tathagata, who abandons the afflictive obstructions and also the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de dag gi nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa yang zad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa yang zad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because he also eliminates the nonafflictive ignorance of those.

original: de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel that,

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: the treatise states:🔽The Teacher has said that phenomena exist,

original: chos rnams kyang yod ces bya dang / shes bya la yang sgrib zad par //
analyzed: chos rnams kyang yod ces bya dang / shes bya la yang sgrib zad par //
translated: and that the obstructions to omniscience are eliminated.

original: ston pa gzhan gyis brjod pa gang //
analyzed: ston pa gzhan gyis brjod pa gang //
translated: This is what other teachers say.

original: 'di la kho bos mtshar du rtsis //🔽'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
analyzed: 'di la kho bos mtshar du rtsis // 'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
translated: I find this amazing.🔽There is nothing to be removed

original: bsnan par bya ba'ang cung zad med //🔽yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
analyzed: bsnan par bya ba'ang cung zad med // yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
translated: in this, nor is there anything to be added.🔽The real is seen as real

original: yang dag mthong na rnam par grol //
analyzed: yang dag mthong na rnam par grol //
translated: when one sees the real, one is liberated.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi bzod pa'o //
translated: The word “this” refers to the nonacceptance of the above.

original: de la kho bos mtshar du rtsis //
analyzed: de la kho bos mtshar du rtsis //
translated: I find this amazing.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen po dag tu mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen po dag tu mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is because it is not reasonable as a counteragent to what is incompatible.

original: de'i phyir / 'di la bsal bya gang yang med //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di la bsal bya gang yang med //
translated: Therefore, there is nothing whatsoever to be removed

original: ces bya ba ni gang zag dang chos rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro //🔽bsnan par bya ba cung zad med //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gang zag dang chos rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro // bsnan par bya ba cung zad med //
translated: in this regard, because the person and phenomena do not exist in themselves.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: Nor is there the slightest thing to be added.

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa dag thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa dag thog ma dang tha ma med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the selflessness of the person and phenomena are without beginning or end.

original: 'on kyang de gnyi ga la yang dag pa nyid du yang dag pa nyid blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de gnyi ga la yang dag pa nyid du yang dag pa nyid blta bar bya'o //
translated: Nevertheless, the reality of both should be seen as reality.

original: gang gi phyir gang zag la bdag med pa'i yang @184a * //🔽dag pa mthong na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zag la bdag med pa'i yang @184a * // dag pa mthong na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol la /
translated: Because when the reality of the selflessness of the person is seen,🔽one is liberated from the obscurations of the mental afflictions.

original: chos la bdag med pa'i yang dag pa mthong na shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i yang dag pa mthong na shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And when the reality of the selflessness of phenomena is seen, one is liberated from the obscurations to omniscience.

original: de yang sgyu ma lta bu dang / snying po'i le'u las mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams spong bar bstan to //
analyzed: de yang sgyu ma lta bu dang / snying po'i le'u las mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams spong bar bstan to //
translated: Moreover, the chapter on the essence teaches the abandonment of the conceptual thoughts to be abandoned by seeing, through the example of an illusion.

original: de bas na gang gi phyir mthong ba'i lam gyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba ni rab 'byor de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de bas na gang gi phyir mthong ba'i lam gyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba ni rab 'byor de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Therefore, the passage beginning with “Subhūti, for these reasons” teaches the abandonment of the conceptual thoughts to be abandoned by seeing through the path of seeing.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: Here, “for these reasons” is the reason.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i dus na'o //
translated: “In that case” refers to the time of seeing.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid de de la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid de de la spyod pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the essence of the path of seeing, and one practices it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs dris pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs dris pa'o //
translated: “Why is that?” asks for the reason for the definition of the path of seeing.

original: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba 'dir yang gi don gyis rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba 'dir yang gi don gyis rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Here, the perfection of wisdom should be understood by the meaning of the word “also” in the phrase “the perfection of concentration.”

original: des na ma smos pa bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: des na ma smos pa bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the unmentioned is included.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ga las shes she na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ga las shes she na /
translated: From where is the perfection of wisdom known?

original: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The statement beginning Subhūti is made.

original: bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The completion of cultivation is connected with the statement the six perfections.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni so so re re la yang tshogs pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni so so re re la yang tshogs pa yod pa ste /
translated: All means that each one has a collection,

original: re rer drug 'dus so zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: re rer drug 'dus so zhes dgongs so //
translated: thinking six are included in each one.

original: de bas na drug tshan drug gi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: de bas na drug tshan drug gi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of the six sets of six is the path of seeing.

original: bcom ldan 'das yum 'dir ni mdor bsdus pa yin pas de'i phyir mtshan nyid tsam 'dir gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yum 'dir ni mdor bsdus pa yin pas de'i phyir mtshan nyid tsam 'dir gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In this Mother of the Victorious Ones, it is concise, therefore, only the characteristics are stated here.

original: re rer yang thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du 'dus so //
analyzed: re rer yang thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du 'dus so //
translated: In each one, all are included just as they are.

original: de rgyas par ni yum chen mo dag las gsungs so //
analyzed: de rgyas par ni yum chen mo dag las gsungs so //
translated: That is extensively taught in the Great Mother sutras.

original: 'dir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos las /
translated: Here, in the treatise, it is said:

original: sbyin pa la sogs re re la //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs re re la //
translated: In each one of generosity and so forth,

original: de dag phan tshun bsdus pa gang //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun bsdus pa gang //
translated: whatever mutually includes those,

original: skad cig gcig pa'i bzod pa yis //
analyzed: skad cig gcig pa'i bzod pa yis //
translated: Through the acceptance of the single instant,🔽

original: bsdus pa de 'dir bsdu ba'i lam //
analyzed: bsdus pa de 'dir bsdu ba'i lam //
translated: The path of integration is here

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽re re nyid yin pas re re ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / re re nyid yin pas re re ste /
translated: said to be the acceptance of a single moment.🔽The term “each” means “one by one.”

original: de'i dngos po ni re re nyid do //🔽des ni sbyin pa la sogs re re la zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni re re nyid do // des ni sbyin pa la sogs re re la zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: The state of each is “each one.”🔽“In each one” means in each of the transcendences, generosity, etc.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag gi phan tshun ni gcig la gcig ste /🔽gang 'di la bsdus pa yod pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rtse mo'i @184b mngon par rtogs pa'o de yang skad cig gcig yin gyi /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag gi phan tshun ni gcig la gcig ste / gang 'di la bsdus pa yod pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rtse mo'i @184b mngon par rtogs pa'o de yang skad cig gcig yin gyi /
translated: “Mutual integration” means one in relation to the other.

original: bcu drug ni ma yin no //🔽de yang bzod pas yang dag par bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: bcu drug ni ma yin no // de yang bzod pas yang dag par bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The path of seeing is said to be the culmination of the transcendences, and that is a single moment, not sixteen.

original: bzod pa brgyad dang shes pa brgyad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa brgyad dang shes pa brgyad ni ma yin no //
translated: And that is integrated by acceptance, not by the eight knowledges and eight acceptances.

original: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: This is the culmination of the path of seeing.

original: de nas bsgom pa'i lam ni thabs la mkhas pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas bsgom pa'i lam ni thabs la mkhas pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: Then, the path of meditation is described in the verse beginning with “all skillful means.”

original: thabs dag dang mkhas pa yin pas ni thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dag dang mkhas pa yin pas ni thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: He is skilled in means, because he is pure and wise.

original: seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa dang / thod rgal gyi ting nge 'dzin ni thabs te /
analyzed: seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa dang / thod rgal gyi ting nge 'dzin ni thabs te /
translated: The means are the lion’s sport and serial meditative absorptions,

original: de ni rten nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rten nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the very basis.

original: mkhas pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs las bzlog pa las rnam par lta ba ste /
