analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bstangs shing gang yongs su bzung ba de med pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization of nonexistence is the conceptualization that “that which was taught and upheld by the perfect Buddha does not exist.”

original: de'i gnyen po ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par byas nas /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par byas nas /
translated: The antidote to that is “having trained in the perfection of wisdom,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
translated: one should train in the perfection of generosity,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par byed de /
translated: and one should attain the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: @186b des na phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstangs shing bdag yongs su bzung nas /
analyzed: @186b des na phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstangs shing bdag yongs su bzung nas /
translated: Therefore, all the Buddhas of the ten directions have served him and taken him as their protector.🔽And he has repaid the debt to his own mother.

original: rang nyid kyi yum la de dag byas pa gzo ba yin no zhes de ltar shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi yum la de dag byas pa gzo ba yin no zhes de ltar shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: One should understand it in this way.

original: yon tan med pa ni phan yon med pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan med pa ni phan yon med pa'o //
translated: The absence of good qualities is the absence of benefit.

original: sbyor ba dang mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i dus gsum yin pa'i phyir dus gsum mo //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i dus gsum yin pa'i phyir dus gsum mo //
translated: It is threefold because of the three times of preparation, seeing, and meditation.

original: de dus gsum la rnam par sbyar ba ni rtog pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de dus gsum la rnam par sbyar ba ni rtog pa gsum mo //
translated: The three thoughts are the application of those to the three times.

original: de'i gnyen po ni phan yon no //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni phan yon no //
translated: The antidote to those is the benefit.

original: rgyas pas khyad par du gsungs pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa'i phan yon no //
analyzed: rgyas pas khyad par du gsungs pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa'i phan yon no //
translated: This is the benefit of practicing the perfection of wisdom, accomplishing the perfection of wisdom, and meditating on the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis dus kyi yon tan med pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis dus kyi yon tan med pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsum mo //
translated: These are the three misconceptions about the qualities of the path of application, the path of seeing, and the path of cultivation, respectively.

original: legs pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam sbyor ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsum mo //
analyzed: legs pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam sbyor ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsum mo //
translated: The “good path” is the path to nirvana, which is threefold, according to its division into the path of application and so on.🔽The remedies for these are, respectively, the practice of the peacefulness of form, feeling, and so on, the practice of their dependence, the practice of their emptiness, and the practice of their insubstantiality.

original: de rnams kyi gnyen po ni go rims bzhin du gzugs dang / tshor ba la sogs pa zhi ba dang / rag las pa dang / gsog dang / snying po med pas de la spyod par bya ba dang / nam mkha' stong pa nyid du mngon par sgrub pas mngon par bsgrub par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnyen po ni go rims bzhin du gzugs dang / tshor ba la sogs pa zhi ba dang / rag las pa dang / gsog dang / snying po med pas de la spyod par bya ba dang / nam mkha' stong pa nyid du mngon par sgrub pas mngon par bsgrub par bya ba dang /
translated: The practice of the emptiness of space is the practice of the path of application.🔽The practice of the emptiness of space is the practice of the path of seeing.

original: nam mkha' stong pa nyid du sgom pas 'di bsgom par bya ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' stong pa nyid du sgom pas 'di bsgom par bya ba ste /
translated: The practice of the emptiness of space is the practice of the path of cultivation.

original: 'di ni sbyor ba la sogs pa byang chub kyi lam gsum la kun du rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba la sogs pa byang chub kyi lam gsum la kun du rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: These are the three misconceptions about the three paths of enlightenment, the path of application and so on.

original: 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa dgu tshan dang po bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa dgu tshan dang po bstan to //
translated: This teaches the first group of nine misconceptions.

original: dgu tshan gnyis pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: dgu tshan gnyis pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The second group of nine is taught in terms of the misconceptions.

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: gnyis pa sems dang sems byung rnams //🔽'jug pa'i yul can yin bzhed de //🔽sems mi skye dang byang chub kyi /
analyzed: gnyis pa sems dang sems byung rnams // 'jug pa'i yul can yin bzhed de // sems mi skye dang byang chub kyi /
translated: The second is the domain of mind and mental factors.🔽The nonarising of mind, the attention of the essence of enlightenment,

original: snying po yid la byed pa dang // theg pa dman pa yid byed dang // rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid mi byed //
analyzed: snying po yid la byed pa dang // theg pa dman pa yid byed dang // rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid mi byed //
translated: the attention of the lesser vehicle, the nonattention of perfect enlightenment,

original: bsgom dang sgom pa med pa dang // de dag las ni bzlog nyid dang // ji bzhin don min rnam rtog pa //🔽bsgom pa'i lam 'di shes par bya //
analyzed: bsgom dang sgom pa med pa dang // de dag las ni bzlog nyid dang // ji bzhin don min rnam rtog pa // bsgom pa'i lam 'di shes par bya //
translated: meditation and nonmeditation, the opposite of those, and the misconception of the meaning as it is

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis @187a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis @187a * //
translated: should be understood as the path of meditation.

original: pa ni sems dang / sems las byung ba 'jug pa de'i yul can no //
analyzed: pa ni sems dang / sems las byung ba 'jug pa de'i yul can no //
translated: The second misconception regarding the apprehended is the domain of the mind and mental factors that engage it.

original: 'di yun ring po ji srid spyad na spyod par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yun ring po ji srid spyad na spyod par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o //
translated: How long does one practice this?

original: dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung nas zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung nas zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: The first is from the production of the thought of enlightenment up to the end.

original: 'di ni sems bskyed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems bskyed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conception of the production of the thought of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du yid la byed pa ni 'di ji ltar spyad par bya mngon par bsgrub par bya ba sgom par bya zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du yid la byed pa ni 'di ji ltar spyad par bya mngon par bsgrub par bya ba sgom par bya zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The conception of the thought of enlightenment as up to the seat of enlightenment is the conception of the thought of enlightenment as practice, as accomplishment, as meditation.

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi snying po yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi snying po yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conception of the thought of enlightenment as the seat of enlightenment.

original: theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa'i go skabs mi 'byed pa 'di ni theg pa dman pa dag yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa'i go skabs mi 'byed pa 'di ni theg pa dman pa dag yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conception of the thought of enlightenment as not giving an opportunity to the thought of the Lesser Vehicle is the conception of the thought of the Lesser Vehicle.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa mi 'dor bas chos nyid gang yin pa la spyad pa dang / ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba mi 'jug pa de ltar spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa mi 'dor bas chos nyid gang yin pa la spyad pa dang / ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba mi 'jug pa de ltar spyad par bya'o //
translated: The conception of the thought of enlightenment as not abandoning the thought of the knowledge of all modes is the conception of the thought of the knowledge of all modes.

original: 'di ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid la mi byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid la mi byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conception of the thought of enlightenment as not giving an opportunity to the thought of the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas is the conception of the thought of the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas.🔽The conception of the thought of enlightenment as not abandoning the knowledge of the paths of the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas is the conception of the knowledge of the paths of the Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas.🔽The conception of the thought of enlightenment as not abandoning the knowledge of the thoughts of all beings is the conception of the knowledge of the thoughts of all beings.🔽The conception of the thought of enlightenment as not abandoning the knowledge of the thoughts and doings of all beings is the conception of the knowledge of the thoughts and doings of all beings.🔽The conception of the thought of enlightenment as not abandoning the knowledge of the thoughts and doings of all beings is the conception of the knowledge of the thoughts and doings of all beings.🔽The conception of the thought of enlightenment as not abandoning the knowledge of the thoughts and doings of all beings is the conception of the knowledge of the thoughts and doings of all beings.

original: ci bsgoms pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par 'gyur ba dang / ci ma bsgoms pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par 'gyur ba dang / bsgom pa yang med /
analyzed: ci bsgoms pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par 'gyur ba dang / ci ma bsgoms pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par 'gyur ba dang / bsgom pa yang med /
translated: It is the conceptual thought that thinks, “I will attain omniscience through meditation” or “I will attain omniscience without meditating.”

original: bsgom pa med pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa med pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: What is the conceptual thought that is neither meditation nor non-meditation?🔽It is the conceptual thought that thinks, “I will attain omniscience through meditation” or “I will attain omniscience without meditating.”🔽What is the conceptual thought that is neither meditation nor non-meditation?🔽It is the conceptual thought that thinks, “I will attain omniscience through meditation” or “I will attain omniscience without meditating.”🔽What is the conceptual thought that is neither meditation nor non-meditation?🔽It is the conceptual thought that thinks, “I will attain omniscience through meditation” or “I will attain omniscience without meditating.”

original: ma bsgoms pas de rjes su thob pa ni ji ltar de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings lta bu ste /
analyzed: ma bsgoms pas de rjes su thob pa ni ji ltar de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings lta bu ste /
translated: What is the conceptual thought that is neither meditation nor non-meditation?🔽It is the conceptual thought that thinks, “I will attain omniscience through meditation” or “I will attain omniscience without meditating.”🔽What is the conceptual thought that is neither meditation nor non-meditation?🔽It is the conceptual thought that thinks, “I will attain omniscience through meditation” or “I will attain omniscience without meditating.”

original: 'di ni don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: What is the conceptual thought that is neither meditation nor non-meditation?🔽It is the conceptual thought that thinks, “I will attain omniscience through meditation” or “I will attain omniscience without meditating.”

original: 'di ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: What is the conceptual thought that is neither meditation nor non-meditation?

original: dgu tshan gsum pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /🔽bstan bcos las /
analyzed: dgu tshan gsum pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /🔽bstan bcos las /
translated: It is the conceptual thought that thinks, “I will attain omniscience through meditation” or “I will attain omniscience without meditating.”🔽What is the conceptual thought that is neither meditation nor non-meditation?🔽It is the conceptual thought that thinks, “I will attain omniscience through meditation” or “I will attain omniscience without meditating.”

original: sems can btags pa'i spyod yul dang // chos btags pa dang stong min dang // chags dang rab 'byed bdag nyid dang // dngos por byed dang theg gsum dang // yon ni dag pa ma yin dang // spyod pa rnam par 'khrug pa la //
analyzed: sems can btags pa'i spyod yul dang // chos btags pa dang stong min dang // chags dang rab 'byed bdag nyid dang // dngos por byed dang theg gsum dang // yon ni dag pa ma yin dang // spyod pa rnam par 'khrug pa la //
translated: and impure qualities,🔽and the disturbance of conduct.

original: 'dzin par byed pa dang po de //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa dang po de //
translated: The first of these is the grasping.

original: shes par bya ba bsgrags pa yin //
analyzed: shes par bya ba bsgrags pa yin //
translated: This is proclaimed to be what is to be known.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sems can du gdags par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can du gdags par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Sentient beings are not to be designated.

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not perceived.

original: 'di dag ni sems can du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sems can du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: These are the conceptual thoughts about the designation of sentient beings.

original: chos thams cad du btags pa ma yin pa 'di ni @187b chos su btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad du btags pa ma yin pa 'di ni @187b chos su btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are not to be designated. This is the conceptual thought about the designation of phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong par mthong ba 'di ni stong pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong par mthong ba 'di ni stong pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of the intrinsic identity of all phenomena is seen. This is the conceptual thought of non-emptiness.

original: chos dang chos mi dmigs pa la spyad pa de yang mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: chos dang chos mi dmigs pa la spyad pa de yang mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The practice of not observing phenomena and non-phenomena is also not observed.

original: 'di ni chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conceptualization of attachment.🔽And that thorough differentiation of phenomena is also by way of non-apprehension.

original: chos rnams la rab tu rnam par dbye ba byas pa de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la rab tu rnam par dbye ba byas pa de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conceptualization of the nature of thorough differentiation.

original: dngos po'i don du spyod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i don du spyod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not for the sake of an entity that one practices,

original: gang gi phyir ma byas pa dang / rnam par ma byas pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ni chos thams cad de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma byas pa dang / rnam par ma byas pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ni chos thams cad de /
translated: because all phenomena are unmade, unproduced, and uncompounded.

original: 'di ni dngos po'i ched du byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po'i ched du byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conceptualization of the purpose of an entity.

original: gal te chos thams cad ni ma byas pa rnam par ma byas pa /🔽mngon par 'dus ma byas pa de lta bu yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad ni ma byas pa rnam par ma byas pa / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa de lta bu yin mod kyi /
translated: If all phenomena are unmade, unproduced, and uncompounded,

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas /
translated: then why did the Tathāgata🔽emanate a magically created monk

original: gang la la zhig mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: gang la la zhig mngon par sprul te /
translated: and then destroy him?

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / theg pa gsum gyis sems can yongs su grol bar mdzad pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / theg pa gsum gyis sems can yongs su grol bar mdzad pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: The attainment of perfect buddhahood, the turning of the wheel of the Dharma, and the complete liberation of sentient beings by the three vehicles are all in terms of conventional truth, not ultimate truth.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is also like that.

original: 'di ni theg pa gsum gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni theg pa gsum gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conception of the three vehicles.

original: gal te yang de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sprul pa la khyad par med pa de ltar yang yon yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sprul pa la khyad par med pa de ltar yang yon yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if there is no difference between the Tathāgata and a magical creation, then offerings will be completely purified.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la phul ba'i yon ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du yang zad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la phul ba'i yon ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du yang zad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, offerings made to the Tathāgata will not be exhausted until the nirvāṇa without remainder.

original: de bzhin du sprul ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sprul ba la yang ngo //
translated: Likewise, offerings to a magical creation will also not be exhausted.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la nam mkha' la me tog gtor ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la nam mkha' la me tog gtor ba'am /
translated: Likewise, if one scatters flowers in the sky to the Tathāgata,

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes smra ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes smra ba'am /
translated: or if one says, “Homage to the Buddha,”

original: yid la byed pa'am /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'am /
translated: or mental activity,

original: mtshan mar byed pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan mar byed pa ste /
translated: or the sign.

original: gang sprul pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa dang / chos kyis 'dra'o //
analyzed: gang sprul pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa dang / chos kyis 'dra'o //
translated: The emanation is like the Tathagata and the Dharma.

original: 'di ni yon yongs su ma dag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yon yongs su ma dag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conception of the complete purification of the gift.

original: spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Practice is the perfections, etc.

original: de ni rnam par 'khrug pa ni phye ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam par 'khrug pa ni phye ba'o //
translated: It is disturbed, i.e., divided.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: From what?

original: chos nyid las te /
analyzed: chos nyid las te /
translated: From reality.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid dang / chos thams cad @188a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid dang / chos thams cad @188a * //
translated: The reality of the perfection of giving,

original: kyi chos nyid ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: kyi chos nyid ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the reality of all dharmas.

original: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyi chos rnams ji ltar rnam par 'khrug pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyi chos rnams ji ltar rnam par 'khrug pa yin zhe na /
translated: In that way, how are the dharmas of the Lord disturbed?

original: ji ltar gzhan dag 'jug par 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag 'jug par 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: Thinking, “How will others enter?”

original: ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams mtshon te /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams mtshon te /
translated: Dharmas are indicated by names and signs,

original: chos rnams ston pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chos rnams ston pa yin gyi /
translated: and the dharmas are taught.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par 'khrug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid rnam par 'khrug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the reality of the dharmas is not disturbed.

original: 'di ni chos nyid 'khrug pa la rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid 'khrug pa la rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conception of the disturbance of reality.

original: dgu tshan bzhi pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: dgu tshan bzhi pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the fourth group of nine conceptions,

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: the treatise attainment of knowledge states:

original: sems can btags dang de rgyu yi //
analyzed: sems can btags dang de rgyu yi //
translated: The object of the conception of sentient beings and its cause,

original: yul can bsgom pa'i lam 'brel pa //🔽de la gnod pa byed pa yis //
analyzed: yul can bsgom pa'i lam 'brel pa // de la gnod pa byed pa yis //
translated: the object of the path of meditation,🔽are the nine aspects of the other,

original: mi mthun phyogs gzhan rnam pa dgu //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs gzhan rnam pa dgu //
translated: the discordant class that harms it.

original: thams cad mkhyen nyid gsum dag gi //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen nyid gsum dag gi //
translated: The three aspects of omniscience

original: bdag nyid ji bzhin sgrib rnam gsum //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji bzhin sgrib rnam gsum //
translated: are the three obscurations, just as they are.🔽The path of peace, suchness and so on,🔽the discordant class that is not associated with it,🔽the discordant class that is associated with it,🔽the discordant class that is not equal to it,

original: zhi lam de bzhin nyid sogs dang // mtshungs par ldan dang mi ldan dang // mi mnyam sdug bsngal la sogs dang // nyon mongs rnams kyi rang bzhin dang // gnyis su med la kun rmongs la //
analyzed: zhi lam de bzhin nyid sogs dang // mtshungs par ldan dang mi ldan dang // mi mnyam sdug bsngal la sogs dang // nyon mongs rnams kyi rang bzhin dang // gnyis su med la kun rmongs la //
translated: the discordant class that is equal to it,🔽the discordant class that is superior to it,🔽the discordant class that is the nature of suffering and so on,🔽the discordant class that is the nature of the afflictions,🔽the discordant class that is the nature of the two obscurations,🔽the discordant class that is the nature of nonduality,

original: rnam par rtog pa tha mar bzhed //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tha mar bzhed // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and the discordant class that is the nature of complete delusion.🔽These are asserted to be the nine conceptions.

original: rnam pa dang rtags dang / mtshan ma gang gis mtshon pa'i chos de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su mkhyen te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang rtags dang / mtshan ma gang gis mtshon pa'i chos de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su mkhyen te /
translated: The Tathāgata knows the phenomena that are characterized by aspects, signs, and marks.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is said to be the one who knows all aspects.

original: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conceptual thought that is confused about the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yang gang dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / yang gang dag byang chub sems dpa'i lam de dag /
analyzed: yang gang dag nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / yang gang dag byang chub sems dpa'i lam de dag /
translated: Moreover, those who are on the path of the śrāvakas, those who are on the path of the pratyekabuddhas, and those who are on the bodhisattva path,

original: byang chub sems dpas yongs su rdzogs par byas shing lam gyi bya ba de dag byas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas yongs su rdzogs par byas shing lam gyi bya ba de dag byas te /
translated: the bodhisattva perfects them, and having performed the activities of the path,

original: smon lam yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / sems can yongs su ma smin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su ma sbyangs par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi byed de /
analyzed: smon lam yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / sems can yongs su ma smin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su ma sbyangs par yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi byed de /
translated: without fulfilling his aspirations, without ripening sentient beings, and without purifying a buddhafield, does not actualize the very limit of reality.

original: des na byang chub sems dpas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpas lam gyi rnam pa shes pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva is said to be the one who knows the aspects of the path.

original: 'di ni lam shes pa la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lam shes pa la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conceptual thought that is confused about the knowledge of the path.

original: phyi dang nang gi chos 'di thams cad de yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag gis shes te /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi chos 'di thams cad de yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dag gis shes te /
translated: All these external and internal phenomena are known by the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: lam thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lam thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: but not all paths and not all aspects.

original: des na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la @188b thams cad shes pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: des na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la @188b thams cad shes pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Therefore, the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are called “omniscient,”🔽but not the tathāgatas.

original: 'di ni thams cad shes pa la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //🔽chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu mya ngan las 'das par song ba 'am /🔽'phags pa thams cad 'dis gshegs pas na /
analyzed: 'di ni thams cad shes pa la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o // chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu mya ngan las 'das par song ba 'am / 'phags pa thams cad 'dis gshegs pas na /
translated: This is the conceptual thought that is confused about omniscience.🔽The perfection of wisdom is the perfection of wisdom of all phenomena,🔽because it has gone to nirvāṇa,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: or because all āryas have gone by it.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad pha rol don dam pa tha dad pa med pa de kho na nyid 'di gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad pha rol don dam pa tha dad pa med pa de kho na nyid 'di gzigs pa'o //
translated: Or, the tathāgatas have seen this suchness, the ultimate that is undifferentiated from all phenomena.

original: gzhan yang 'di'i khongs su de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings su gtogs pa des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di'i khongs su de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos kyi dbyings su gtogs pa des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Moreover, it is included in suchness, the perfect limit, and the dharma-element, and for that reason it is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni zhi ba'i lam la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //🔽'di ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni zhi ba'i lam la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o // 'di ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: This is the conceptual thought that is confused about the path of peace.🔽It is not that it is endowed with suchness, etc.,🔽nor is it that it is not endowed with suchness, etc.

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di ni gzugs med pa /
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di ni gzugs med pa /
translated: In the same way, it is formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: cannot be shown,

original: thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: and is unobstructing.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the same in being without characteristics.

original: 'di ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conceptual thought that is confused about being endowed with and not being endowed with suchness, etc.

original: gang gis kyang 'di dpyad par mi nus pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gis kyang 'di dpyad par mi nus pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since it cannot be analyzed by anyone,

original: thun mong ma yin pa ste 'di ni mi mnyam pa la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa ste 'di ni mi mnyam pa la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: it is not shared in common. This is the conceptual thought that is confused about the unequaled.

original: 'di la spyod pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi don la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la spyod pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi don la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, practice is the practice of the meaning of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conceptualization of delusion regarding suffering, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa don kyang ma yin don med pa yang ma yin pa 'di ni rang bzhin la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa don kyang ma yin don med pa yang ma yin pa 'di ni rang bzhin la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Attachment, etc., are neither meaningful nor meaningless. This is the conceptualization of delusion regarding nature.

original: 'di ltar gnyis su med pa dang / gnyis su byar med pa ma yin pa'i chos dmigs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyis su med pa dang / gnyis su byar med pa ma yin pa'i chos dmigs pa de bzhin du /
translated: Thus, the non-apprehension of a dharma that is not non-dual and not dual

original: gnyis kyi chos rjes su thob pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis kyi chos rjes su thob pa med pa yin te /
translated: is the non-attainment of a dharma that is dual.

original: 'di ni gnyis kyi dngos po la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis kyi dngos po la rmongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conceptualization of delusion regarding the entity of duality.

original: de ltar bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa sum cu rtsa drug bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa sum cu rtsa drug bstan to //
translated: Thus, the thirty-six conceptualizations to be abandoned by cultivation have been explained.

original: de ltar re zhig skyon rnams zad na yang yon tan rnams ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig skyon rnams zad na yang yon tan rnams ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: Now, if the faults are exhausted in this way, how do the virtues arise?

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise states:

original: yams nad 'di dag zad nas ni //
analyzed: yams nad 'di dag zad nas ni //
translated: When these sicknesses are exhausted,

original: yun ring lon nas dbugs phyin ltar //
analyzed: yun ring lon nas dbugs phyin ltar //
translated: after a long time, as if sighing,

original: rnam pa kun du 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: rnam pa kun du 'gro ba yi //
translated: in every way,

original: bde sgrub @189a * //
analyzed: bde sgrub @189a * //
translated: the accomplishment of happiness,

original: yon tan phun tshogs kun //
analyzed: yon tan phun tshogs kun //
translated: the perfection of all good qualities,

original: rgya mtsho che la chu bo bzhin //🔽'bras bu mchog gis sba ba yi //
analyzed: rgya mtsho che la chu bo bzhin // 'bras bu mchog gis sba ba yi //
translated: like the great ocean for the four rivers,🔽the great being,

original: sems dpa' chen po de la ni //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po de la ni //
translated: who is sealed with the supreme fruit,

original: rnam pa kun du ston par byed //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa kun du ston par byed // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is shown in every way.

original: yon tan ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa yin te /
translated: Good qualities are naturally accomplished,

original: skyon gyis zil gyis mi non pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: skyon gyis zil gyis mi non pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: and are simply not overcome by faults.

original: yun ring po nas skyon zad na //
analyzed: yun ring po nas skyon zad na //
translated: After a long time, when the faults are exhausted,

original: bos pa bzhin du de ni byang chub sems dpa' sten par byed do //
analyzed: bos pa bzhin du de ni byang chub sems dpa' sten par byed do //
translated: like a sigh, the bodhisattva attends to them.

original: skyon thams cad spangs pa ni sba ba'o //
analyzed: skyon thams cad spangs pa ni sba ba'o //
translated: Abandoning all faults is the seal.

original: rnam pa ni thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni thams cad du'o //
translated: In every way.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi phan yon no //
analyzed: spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi phan yon no //
translated: The benefit of the path of cultivation is from “the bodhisattva, the great being” up to “will be abandoned.”

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin brjod par bya ste /🔽de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin brjod par bya ste / de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Uninterrupted meditative stabilization will now be explained.

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: In this regard, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:🔽The virtues of the beings of the billion-world universe,🔽the sravakas,🔽the pratyekabuddhas,

original: stong gsum skye bo nyan thos dang // bse ru'i rtogs pa phun tshogs dang // byang chub sems dpa' skyon med la //
analyzed: stong gsum skye bo nyan thos dang // bse ru'i rtogs pa phun tshogs dang // byang chub sems dpa' skyon med la //
translated: and the bodhisattvas,

original: bkod pa'i dge rnams dper mdzad nas //
analyzed: bkod pa'i dge rnams dper mdzad nas //
translated: are taken as an example.

original: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //
translated: Through the many merits

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar med de //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar med de //
translated: up to buddhahood,

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
translated: there is uninterrupted meditative stabilization.

original: de ni rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: That is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bar du gcod par nus pa ni bar chad do //
analyzed: bar du gcod par nus pa ni bar chad do //
translated: Interruption means that which can interrupt.

original: de med pa ni bar chad med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni bar chad med pa'o //
translated: The absence of that is uninterrupted.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mdo las gsungs te /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mdo las gsungs te /
translated: Uninterrupted meditative stabilization is stated in the sutras.

original: bar chad med pa dang bar chad kyi rgyu ni ji ltar gsungs she na /
analyzed: bar chad med pa dang bar chad kyi rgyu ni ji ltar gsungs she na /
translated: How are the causes of interruption and non-interruption stated?

original: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis so //
translated: Through the many merits.

original: de yang ji ltar gsungs she na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar gsungs she na /
translated: How is that stated?

original: dge ba ni bsod nams te /
analyzed: dge ba ni bsod nams te /
translated: Virtue is merit.

original: de nyid dper mdzad nas dge ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid dper mdzad nas dge ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind of virtue is that?

original: ci stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa gang la bkod pa'o //
analyzed: ci stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa gang la bkod pa'o //
translated: It is the virtue of establishing the sentient beings of the billion-world universe in the state of discipleship, in the state of the Solitary Sages, and in the state of the Bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos ni slob ma rnams so //
analyzed: nyan thos ni slob ma rnams so //
translated: The disciples are the learners.

original: bse ru ni rang sangs rgyas rnams te /
analyzed: bse ru ni rang sangs rgyas rnams te /
translated: The rhinoceroses are the Solitary Sages.

original: de dag gi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rtogs pa'o //
translated: The state of those is the state of the Solitary Sages.

original: sngar skyon med pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: sngar skyon med pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa'o //
translated: The state of the Bodhisattvas is the perfection of the realization of the Bodhisattvas who have entered the faultless state.

original: bsod nams mang po nyid kyang gang du gsungs she na /
analyzed: bsod nams mang po nyid kyang gang du gsungs she na /
translated: Where is it said that that is a great deal of merit?

original: bcom ldan 'das ma chen mo dag las so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma chen mo dag las so //
translated: In the Great Sutras of the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: 'di ji ltar gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar gsungs she na /
translated: How is it said there?

original: dmigs pa can gyi byang @189b chub sems dpa' gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal par byas pa'i sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams de dag pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la se gol gtogs pa srid du snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ches bsod nams mang
analyzed: dmigs pa can gyi byang @189b chub sems dpa' gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bskal par byas pa'i sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams de dag pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la se gol gtogs pa srid du snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ches bsod nams mang
translated: The merit of the bodhisattvas who are focused on objects of observation is greater than the merit that arises from generosity for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.🔽

original: du bskyed do //
analyzed: du bskyed do //
translated: The merit of the bodhisattva who has the meditative stabilization of the stream of dharma for just the time of a finger snap is greater than the merit of the bodhisattvas who have the meditative stabilization of the heroic stride, who have the meditative stabilization of the heroic stride for as many eons as there are sands in the Ganges river, and who have the meditative stabilization of the heroic stride for as many eons as there are atoms in all the buddhafields.

original: 'di rab tu byed pa 'di las ji ltar gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'di rab tu byed pa 'di las ji ltar gsungs she na /
translated: How is this explained in this chapter?

original: yang med kyang yang gi don du 'gro ste /
analyzed: yang med kyang yang gi don du 'gro ste /
translated: Although it is not stated, it is understood.

original: yang ni ma gsungs pa'i don bsdu ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ni ma gsungs pa'i don bsdu ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a summary of the meaning not stated.

original: de ni rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid //
translated: It is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ces bya ba ni de yang sangs rgyas nyid de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de yang sangs rgyas nyid de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is also buddhahood, which has the characteristic of omniscience.

original: 'di yi dmigs pa dngos med de //
analyzed: 'di yi dmigs pa dngos med de //
translated: Its object is non-entityness.

original: bdag po dran pa yin par bzhed //
analyzed: bdag po dran pa yin par bzhed //
translated: Its master is mindfulness.

original: rnam pa bzhi nyid ces bya ba gsungs pa la bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di'i dmigs pa ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi nyid ces bya ba gsungs pa la bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di'i dmigs pa ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'o //
translated: The four aspects are stated. The object of this uninterrupted samādhi is the unreality of all phenomena.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni dran pa'o //
translated: The dominant condition is mindfulness.

original: rnam pa ni zhi ba nyid de /
analyzed: rnam pa ni zhi ba nyid de /
translated: The aspect is peacefulness,

original: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa nub pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa nub pa'o //
translated: the subsiding of the aspects of all phenomena.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'di la /
translated: With regard to this knowledge of all aspects,

original: rab tu smra ba rnams brgyud mar rgol te /
analyzed: rab tu smra ba rnams brgyud mar rgol te /
translated: the disputations of the logicians continue.

original: rgol ba ni smra ba dang smra ba'i mtshon chas 'debs pa'i tshul yod pa de ni brgyud mar rgol ba ste /
analyzed: rgol ba ni smra ba dang smra ba'i mtshon chas 'debs pa'i tshul yod pa de ni brgyud mar rgol ba ste /
translated: Disputation is the method of striking with the weapons of speech and speech. That is continuous disputation,

original: ji ltar dbyig pa dang dbyig pas lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dbyig pa dang dbyig pas lta bu'o //
translated: just like a club and a club.

original: de'i phyir mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las /
translated: Therefore, in the sūtras,

original: rab 'byor thabs la mkhas pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'tshal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la thob par bya ba ma yin pas thabs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor thabs la mkhas pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'tshal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la thob par bya ba ma yin pas thabs te /
translated: it is said, “Subhūti, those who wish to complete all skillful means…” and so on. Skillful means is not something to be attained.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: It is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de la mkhas pa ni log par rtog pa rnams sel ba ste /
analyzed: de la mkhas pa ni log par rtog pa rnams sel ba ste /
translated: Skill in this is the removal of false notions.

original: de dag 'thob par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag 'thob par 'dod pa'o //
translated: One should attain these.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bar ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the defining characteristic of the uninterrupted meditative concentration.

original: spyad par bya ba ni sbyor ba dang / sgrub ba dang / sgom pa'o //
analyzed: spyad par bya ba ni sbyor ba dang / sgrub ba dang / sgom pa'o //
translated: Practice is application, accomplishment, and cultivation.

original: bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pas na /
analyzed: bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pas na /
translated: Cultivation is the attainment of the knowledge of all modes through the uninterrupted meditative concentration.

original: log par rtog pa thams cad zad pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: log par rtog pa thams cad zad pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: All false notions are exhausted, he thinks.

original: mngon par grub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ji lta ba dang / bdag po ji lta ba dang / rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par grub par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ji lta ba dang / bdag po ji lta ba dang / rnam pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment is the realization of the objective, the subjective, and the modes as they are.

original: mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngang gis sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngang gis sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: Attainment is the spontaneous accomplishment.

original: 'das pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams bcad pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams bcad pa'o //
translated: The past is the cutting off of the interval.

original: rab 'byor zhes bya @190a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes bya @190a * //
translated: Subhūti!🔽🔽

original: ba la sogs pas ni de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs pa'i phan yon gzhan gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: ba la sogs pas ni de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs pa'i phan yon gzhan gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The passage beginning Subhuti, etc., states another benefit intended by the Tathagata.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis snyoms par zhugs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis snyoms par zhugs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He does not enter into the meditative concentration of the absence of conflict.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa de ni /🔽yang ngan 'gro 'am /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa de ni / yang ngan 'gro 'am /
translated: The one who has attained the meditative concentration of the absence of conflict🔽does not go to an unfortunate rebirth

original: bde 'gror 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: bde 'gror 'gro ba med do //
translated: or to a fortunate rebirth.

original: lhag ma le'u rdzogs pa'i bar du ni rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma le'u rdzogs pa'i bar du ni rtogs sla'o //
translated: The remainder is easy to understand up to the conclusion of the chapter.

original: log par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: log par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the misinterpretations,

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: the treatise Attainment of Knowledge says:

original: dmigs pa 'thad dang de yi ni //
analyzed: dmigs pa 'thad dang de yi ni //
translated: The object, the ascertainment of its nature,🔽omniscience,🔽the ultimate and the conventional,🔽the application, the three jewels,🔽the thought of the Muni with its means,

original: ngo bo nyid nges gzung ba dang // rnam kun mkhyen nyid ye shes dang // dam pa'i don dang kun rdzob dang // sbyor dang dkon mchog gsum pa dang // thabs bcas thub pa'i rtog pa dang // phyin ci log ni lam bcas dang // gnyen po mi mthun phyogs dag dang //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid nges gzung ba dang // rnam kun mkhyen nyid ye shes dang // dam pa'i don dang kun rdzob dang // sbyor dang dkon mchog gsum pa dang // thabs bcas thub pa'i rtog pa dang // phyin ci log ni lam bcas dang // gnyen po mi mthun phyogs dag dang //
translated: the perversions together with the path,🔽the antidote and the opposing factors,

original: mtshan nyid dang ni sgom pa la //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni sgom pa la //
translated: the characteristics and the cultivation,

original: smra ba rnams kyi log rtog pa //
analyzed: smra ba rnams kyi log rtog pa //
translated: The misconceptions of the logicians

original: rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid rten can //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid rten can //
translated: are based on the knowledge of all things.

original: rnam pa bcu drug dag tu bzhed //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug dag tu bzhed //
translated: They are accepted as being of sixteen kinds.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: drug dang bcu ni bcu drug ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: drug dang bcu ni bcu drug ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Six and ten are sixteen.

original: ci'i phyir bcu drug yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcu drug yin zhe na /
translated: Why are there sixteen?

original: gang gi phyir dmigs pa 'thad pa la sogs pa'i don bcu drug po de dag la'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dmigs pa 'thad pa la sogs pa'i don bcu drug po de dag la'o //
translated: Because there are sixteen topics, such as the object, which are tenable.

original: de ltar na ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rten can yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rten can yin zhe na /
translated: In what way are they based on the knowledge of all things?

original: dmigs pa la sogs pa ni de dag gi yul la'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la sogs pa ni de dag gi yul la'o //
translated: The object, etc. are their objects.

original: yul dang 'brel pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yul du nye bar gdags te /
analyzed: yul dang 'brel pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yul du nye bar gdags te /
translated: Because they are related to the object, the knowledge of all things is designated as the object.

original: dper na rgyal po'i bus nyes pa byas na /
analyzed: dper na rgyal po'i bus nyes pa byas na /
translated: For example, when the son of a king commits a crime,

original: rgyal pos nyes pa byas par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyal pos nyes pa byas par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: the king is said to have committed the crime.

original: log par rtog pa rnams ni phal cher gnyen pos gnod par rtog par byas pa'i //
analyzed: log par rtog pa rnams ni phal cher gnyen pos gnod par rtog par byas pa'i //
translated: The misconceptions are mostly made by those who think that the antidote is harmful.

original: de la log par rtog pa dang po ni gang de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa dngos po med pa de gang yin /
analyzed: de la log par rtog pa dang po ni gang de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dmigs pa dngos po med pa de gang yin /
translated: The first misconception is this: “If the object of the knowledge of all things is a non-entity, what is it?

original: gal te gang gi phyir chos rnams kyi kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo de nyid yin na ni 'khrul par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gang gi phyir chos rnams kyi kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo de nyid yin na ni 'khrul par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the imagined nature of things, then it is an error,

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like the store-consciousness.

original: ci ste gzhan gyi dbang de ji ltar med ce na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan gyi dbang de ji ltar med ce na /
translated: If it is the relative nature, how can it be non-existent?

original: 'dir lan ni gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir lan ni gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni med pa ste /
translated: The answer is this: What is without intrinsic reality is non-existent.

original: chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo med pa'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba ni med do //
translated: Since the intrinsic reality of things does not exist, there is no origination from a cause.

original: gzhan yang chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid @190b med de 'di ni dmigs pa 'thad pa la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid @190b med de 'di ni dmigs pa 'thad pa la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the intrinsic reality of all things does not exist. This is a misconception about the feasibility of the object.

original: gal te chos thams cad dngos po med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad dngos po med pa yin na /
translated: If all things are non-existent,

original: las dang po pa thabs la mkhas pa gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyod ce na /
analyzed: las dang po pa thabs la mkhas pa gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyod ce na /
translated: by what means will the beginner, skilled in means, practice generosity and so on?

original: sbyin par bya ba dang / len pa dang / sbyin bdag ngo bo nyid med par nges par gzung ba nyid ni de'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba dang / len pa dang / sbyin bdag ngo bo nyid med par nges par gzung ba nyid ni de'i thabs la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: The fact that the object given, the recipient, and the donor are apprehended as having no intrinsic reality is the skill in means.

original: 'di ni de'i ngo bo nyid med par nges par gzung ba la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i ngo bo nyid med par nges par gzung ba la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the misapprehension of the apprehension of their unreality.

original: de lta na bden pa mthong ba'i thabs la mkhas pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na bden pa mthong ba'i thabs la mkhas pa ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the skill in means of one who has seen the truth?

original: des ni chos rnams 'phags pa'i spyan gyis gzigs pa yin te /🔽gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po yang mi dmigs te /🔽sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dam /
analyzed: des ni chos rnams 'phags pa'i spyan gyis gzigs pa yin te / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po yang mi dmigs te / sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dam /
translated: He sees things with the eye of the noble ones.🔽He does not even apprehend the dependent reality.

original: kun du brtags pa de yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa de yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the imagined reality, which is the object of the eye of the noble ones, does not exist,🔽and because the reality that is the result of the eye of the noble ones, which is the eye of wisdom, does not exist.

original: dngos po gzhan kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid lta ci smos te /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to mention the other reality, the imagined reality?

original: de ni shin tu med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni shin tu med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because that does not exist at all.

original: de sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyod pa na sbyin par bya ba dang / len pa dang / sbyin bdag so sor med do zhes yang dag par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de sbyin pa la sogs pa la spyod pa na sbyin par bya ba dang / len pa dang / sbyin bdag so sor med do zhes yang dag par shes pa yin te /
translated: When he practices generosity and so on, he knows that there is no giver, no recipient, and no gift.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mi dmigs pa ni ji ltar med par shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mi dmigs pa ni ji ltar med par shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he know that things and nonthings are not apprehended?

original: kun rdzob tu yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: In terms of the conventional, not in terms of the ultimate.

original: 'dir sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad ni lam gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad ni lam gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: Here, all generosity and so on are aspects of the path.

original: rnam pa thams cad shes pa de ni dngos po dang / dngos po med pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad shes pa de ni dngos po dang / dngos po med pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is the nonapprehension of things and nonthings.

original: de la mthar phyin pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du 'du shes pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la mthar phyin pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du 'du shes pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: The notion that it is the essence of the perfected knowledge is a misconception about the knowledge of a knower of all aspects.

original: gang kun rdzob nyid don dam pa ste /
analyzed: gang kun rdzob nyid don dam pa ste /
translated: The conventional itself is the ultimate.

original: gang gi phyir de dag de bzhin nyid du gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag de bzhin nyid du gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Because they are the same in suchness.

original: 'on kyang phung po rnams la mngon par 'du shes pa de dag la lan gdab pa'i don du kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang phung po rnams la mngon par 'du shes pa de dag la lan gdab pa'i don du kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas /
translated: However, in order to respond to those who conceive of the aggregates,

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba dang / dngos por 'du shes la dngos po'o zhes bstan te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba dang / dngos por 'du shes la dngos po'o zhes bstan te /
translated: in dependence on the conventional truth, it is taught that “there is no thing” and that “things exist” for those who conceive of things.

original: don dam par ni dngos po dang / dngos po med pa yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: don dam par ni dngos po dang / dngos po med pa yang mi dmigs so //
translated: But ultimately, things and non-things are not observed.

original: 'di ni bden pa gnyis la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bden pa gnyis la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is a misconception about the two truths.

original: sbyor ba ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni spyod pa'o //
translated: “ Application” is practice.

original: chos thams cad stong pa yin na /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa yin na /
translated: If all phenomena are empty,

original: ji ltar spyod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar spyod ce na /
translated: how can one practice?

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi stong pa nyid yin pa la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi stong pa nyid yin pa la /
translated: The emptiness of all generosity and so on

original: thams cad 'khor gsum mi dmigs @191a * //
analyzed: thams cad 'khor gsum mi dmigs @191a * //
translated: is the non-observation of the three spheres.

original: pa'o // 'di ni sbyor ba la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // 'di ni sbyor ba la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is a misconception about application.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba las kyi rkyen dang sbyar na shes bya thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba las kyi rkyen dang sbyar na shes bya thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If “buddha” is applied to the condition of karma, then all objects of knowledge would become buddhas.

original: ji ste byed pa'i rkyen dang sbyar nas rtogs pa dang ldan pa sangs rgyas yin na ni sems dang ldan pa thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste byed pa'i rkyen dang sbyar nas rtogs pa dang ldan pa sangs rgyas yin na ni sems dang ldan pa thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one who is endowed with realization in connection with the causal condition is a Buddha, then all who have minds would be Buddhas.

original: 'dir lan ni yang dag pa'i don sangs rgyas zhes bya ba yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir lan ni yang dag pa'i don sangs rgyas zhes bya ba yin pa'am /
translated: Here the answer is: One who is called a Buddha is one who has realized the true meaning.

original: yang dag pa'i chos mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i chos mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba yin nam /
translated: Or, one who is called a Buddha is one who has realized the true Dharma.

original: yang dag pa'i don rab tu rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba yin pa'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don rab tu rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba yin pa'am /
translated: Or, one who is called a Buddha is one who has thoroughly realized the true meaning.

original: 'di la chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par sangs rgyas pa zhes bya ba yin pa ste /
translated: Or, one who is called a Buddha is one who has fully awakened to all dharmas just as they are.

original: phyogs bzhi char la yang 'bru mang po par byas nas /
analyzed: phyogs bzhi char la yang 'bru mang po par byas nas /
translated: In all four cases, the word “Buddha” should be supplied.

original: nges par tshig gi byang chub par bya'o //
analyzed: nges par tshig gi byang chub par bya'o //
translated: This is the correct wording.

original: yang dag pa'i don zhes bya ba la don ni shes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don zhes bya ba la don ni shes bya'o //
translated: As for “true meaning,” “meaning” refers to the knowable.

original: de dang 'brel pa'i rtog pa ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i rtog pa ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The realization connected with that is the summarized meaning.

original: gang la yang dag pa nyid kyi don rtogs pa yod pa de ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: gang la yang dag pa nyid kyi don rtogs pa yod pa de ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: One who has the realization of the true meaning is a Buddha.

original: gzhan dag pa ni nges par kha cig tu 'khrul pa yod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag pa ni nges par kha cig tu 'khrul pa yod do //
translated: The other is pure, but it is not certain that there is no error in some cases.

original: ji ltar yang dag pa'i don sangs rgyas yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag pa'i don sangs rgyas yin zhe na /
translated: How is the Buddha the meaning of reality?

original: buddha'i gnas su ni bud bzhag la /
analyzed: buddha'i gnas su ni bud bzhag la /
translated: The syllable budh is placed in the place of buddha,

original: aartha'i gnas su ni dha bzhag la /
analyzed: aartha'i gnas su ni dha bzhag la /
translated: and the syllable dhar is placed in the place of artha.

original: sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bsams la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bsams la /
translated: It becomes buddha.

original: yang dag pa'i chos mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa'i don ma yin pa'i don shes par byed pa nyid ni skyes bu dang 'brel ba pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i chos mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa'i don ma yin pa'i don shes par byed pa nyid ni skyes bu dang 'brel ba pa'o //
translated: The realization of the true Dharma is the understanding of the meaning of the true and the meaning of the untrue. It is the connection with the person.

original: 'dir ni rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par byas pa yin te /
translated: Here, the highest complete realization is made.

original: de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa smos te /
analyzed: de rab tu bstan pa'i phyir mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, complete enlightenment is mentioned.

original: 'di'i bsdu ba'i don ni tshig gnyis kho na la yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i bsdu ba'i don ni tshig gnyis kho na la yin te /
translated: The summary meaning of this is only in two phrases.

original: de la buddha'i sgra la ni bud bya la /
analyzed: de la buddha'i sgra la ni bud bya la /
translated: In that, the syllable budh is to be done in the place of buddha,

original: dharm'a'i sgra la ni yi ge gnyis pa'i phyi'o //
analyzed: dharm'a'i sgra la ni yi ge gnyis pa'i phyi'o //
translated: and the syllable dhar is in the place of the second syllable.

original: yang dag pa'i don rab tu rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi don te /🔽tshig gsum ni 'bru mang po par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don rab tu rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi don te / tshig gsum ni 'bru mang po par bya ba yin te /
translated: The phrase “correct discernment of the ultimate” refers to the direct realization of the ultimate.🔽The three terms in this phrase are in the plural.🔽The term “dhātu” is placed at the end of each of the first three terms.🔽The term “dhātu” is placed at the end of each of the first three terms.

original: dha'i sgra la ni snga ma kun la ni bu bzhag go //
analyzed: dha'i sgra la ni snga ma kun la ni bu bzhag go //
translated: The term “dhātu” is placed at the end of each of the first three terms.🔽The term “dhātu” is placed at the end of each of the first three terms.🔽The term “dhātu” is placed at the end of each of the first three terms.🔽The term “dhātu” is placed at the end of each of the first three terms.🔽The term “dhātu” is placed at the end of each of the first three terms.

original: 'di la chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni blo dang / rtogs pa dang / mchod pa'i don la de ltar byung ba'i rkyen bya'o //🔽de ltar byung ba'i rkyen byed pa pa yin pas drug par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni blo dang / rtogs pa dang / mchod pa'i don la de ltar byung ba'i rkyen bya'o // de ltar byung ba'i rkyen byed pa pa yin pas drug par bya ste /
translated: The term “dhātu” is placed at the end of each of the first three terms.

analyzed: dang po'i tshig @191b la ni bu bya / gnyis pa la da bya /
translated: The term “dhātu” is placed at the end of each of the first three terms.

original: gsum pa la ni dha'i sgra'o //🔽'di ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la log par rtog pa'o //🔽de nas chos dkon mchog gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum pa la ni dha'i sgra'o // 'di ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog la log par rtog pa'o // de nas chos dkon mchog gang zhe na /
