original: chos thams cad las khyad par du gyur pa nyid do //🔽de la gal te chos las chos nyid tha dad par bzhag ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad las khyad par du gyur pa nyid do //🔽de la gal te chos las chos nyid tha dad par bzhag ste /
translated: The term “dhātu” is placed at the end of each of the first three terms.🔽The

original: chos dang chos nyid 'di gnyis ni yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig las te /
analyzed: chos dang chos nyid 'di gnyis ni yang dag par bsdu ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig las te /
translated: because of the phrase “in order to include both phenomena and dharmata.”

original: de'i tshe ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la byang chub tu bzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la byang chub tu bzhag ste /
translated: At that time, the Tathagata’s wisdom is posited as enlightenment,

original: byang chub ni ngo bo'i rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub ni ngo bo'i rkyen dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because enlightenment has the condition of an essence.

original: yang na chos ni chos nyid kyang yin te //
analyzed: yang na chos ni chos nyid kyang yin te //
translated: Or, phenomena are also dharmata,

original: chos kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the nature of phenomena.

original: de'i tshe ni de nyid chos dkon mchog ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni de nyid chos dkon mchog ste /
translated: At that time, that itself is the jewel of the Dharma,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the limit of reality,

original: de kho na nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is the ultimate of suchness.

original: de'i tshe ni byang chub kyi las kyi rkyen dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni byang chub kyi las kyi rkyen dang ldan pa'o //
translated: At that time, it has the condition of the activity of enlightenment.

original: byang chub gnyi ka yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la 'jug ste /
analyzed: byang chub gnyi ka yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la 'jug ste /
translated: Both kinds of enlightenment enter the Tathagata’s wisdom,

original: khyad par du gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are distinguished.

original: de la chos nyid kyi phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la chos nyid kyi phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Regarding that, from the perspective of the aspect of dharmata,

original: byang chub ni stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub ni stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings zhes gsungs te /
translated: Enlightenment is said to be emptiness, suchness, the limit of reality, the real nature, and the dharma-element.

original: de la stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid ni mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Among them, emptiness is in terms of the characteristic.

original: rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin nyid do //🔽de kho na nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de bzhin nyid do // de kho na nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i phyir /
translated: It is suchness because it is not subject to change.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
translated: It is the limit of reality because it is the ultimate reality.

original: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos nyid do //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos nyid do //
translated: It is the real nature because it is the nature of all dharmas.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: It is the dharma-element because it is the cause of the noble ones.

original: yang byang chub ming tsam mo zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yang byang chub ming tsam mo zhes gsungs te /
translated: Again, enlightenment is said to be a mere name.

original: ming gi don gyis stong pa nyid ni byang chub ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ming gi don gyis stong pa nyid ni byang chub ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The meaning of the name is emptiness, up to enlightenment.

original: yang dbyer med pa'i don ni byang chub kyi don du'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yang dbyer med pa'i don ni byang chub kyi don du'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Again, the meaning of non-division is the meaning of enlightenment,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la de bzhin nyid tsam snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la de bzhin nyid tsam snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because in the gnosis of omniscience, only suchness appears.

original: ye shes kyi phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: ye shes kyi phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the point of view of the side of intuition,

original: byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i byang chub bo zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i byang chub bo zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is the suchness of enlightenment, the nonerroneous suchness, the undifferentiable suchness, and the unchanging enlightenment.

original: de la byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba'i de bzhin nyid de /🔽de kho na bzhin du rtogs par bya ba'i @192a * //
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba'i de bzhin nyid de / de kho na bzhin du rtogs par bya ba'i @192a * //
translated: The suchness of enlightenment is the suchness to be realized.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo yin gyi /
translated: It is the nature of things just as they are,

original: brdzun pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brdzun pa'i ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: and not a false nature.

original: ma nor ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'khrul ba'o //🔽gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ma nor ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'khrul ba'o // gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: Nonerroneous means nondeluded.🔽The undifferentiable suchness is the suchness of enlightenment,

original: byang chub las gzhan pa ni brdzun pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub las gzhan pa ni brdzun pa ste /
translated: which is not false,

original: de'i de bzhin nyid byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de'i de bzhin nyid byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: and its suchness is the essence of enlightenment.

original: med pa de ni ngo bo byang chub nyid la snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: med pa de ni ngo bo byang chub nyid la snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: That nonexistence appears in the essence of enlightenment itself,

original: de dang bral ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: and the freedom from that is undifferentiable suchness.

original: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi rang bzhin rang gi bdag nyid kyis gsal ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi rang bzhin rang gi bdag nyid kyis gsal ba ste /
translated: The meaning of “unchanging nature” is the clarity of the nature of enlightenment by its very essence.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po ni brdzun pa'i bdag nyid du snang ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dngos po ni brdzun pa'i bdag nyid du snang ba'o //
translated: Other things appear as the nature of falsity.

original: de dang bral ba ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de dang bral ba ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Freedom from that is “unchanging.”

original: de yang 'khrul pas dben pa'i ye shes ni byang chub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang 'khrul pas dben pa'i ye shes ni byang chub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Moreover, the meaning of “enlightenment” is the pristine wisdom that is free from error.

original: yang ming dang mtshan ma tsam 'di ni byang chub po zhes bya ba gsungs pa la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar te /
analyzed: yang ming dang mtshan ma tsam 'di ni byang chub po zhes bya ba gsungs pa la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rim pa gzhan du sbyar te /
translated: Again, it is said that “this mere name and sign is enlightenment.” The word “this” is applied in another way:

original: ming dang mtshan ma tsam 'di zhes bya ba gang rtogs pa de ni byang chub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma tsam 'di zhes bya ba gang rtogs pa de ni byang chub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “enlightenment” is the realization of “this mere name and sign.”

original: sbyor ba nyid byang chub tu mtshon pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyid byang chub tu mtshon pa yin gyi /
translated: The very application is the illustration of enlightenment.

original: 'di byang chub ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di byang chub ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not enlightenment,

original: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is nonconceptual.

original: de la ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: de la ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po'o //
translated: In this regard, “name” is the formless aggregates.

original: de dag ni brdzun pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni brdzun pa ste /
translated: They are false.

original: don 'dra ba'i rnam pa ni mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: don 'dra ba'i rnam pa ni mtshan ma'o //
translated: The aspect of similarity of meaning is the sign.

original: yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rtogs pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rtogs pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: Moreover, since it is the realization of the Buddhas,

original: byang chub ces gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub ces gsungs te /
translated: it is called enlightenment.

original: khyad par du gyur pa yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: khyad par du gyur pa yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that it is a special state.

original: yang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bas na byang chub ces gsungs pa la /
analyzed: yang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bas na byang chub ces gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, since it is fully realized by the Buddhas, it is called enlightenment.

original: tshig 'di don gtso bo yin gyi /
analyzed: tshig 'di don gtso bo yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of this expression is primary,

original: sgra ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni ma yin te /
translated: not the sound.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rtogs pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rtogs pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: Since it is the realization of the Buddhas,

original: byang chub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is called enlightenment.

original: drug pa'i bsdu pa byas nas /
analyzed: drug pa'i bsdu pa byas nas /
translated: Having made the sixth case

original: tshig snga ma la ni bo bya la /
analyzed: tshig snga ma la ni bo bya la /
translated: elision of the first syllable and

original: tshig 'og ma la ni dhi gzhag go //
analyzed: tshig 'og ma la ni dhi gzhag go //
translated: addition of the syllable dhi to the last syllable.

original: 'di ni chos dkon mchog la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos dkon mchog la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is a false notion about the Jewel of the Dharma.

original: tshogs yin pa'i phyir dge 'dun te /
analyzed: tshogs yin pa'i phyir dge 'dun te /
translated: The Saṅgha is a collection,

original: mi phyed pa dang mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: mi phyed pa dang mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: meaning indivisible and unassailable.

original: gang las mi phyed pa dang / gang gis mi phyed pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi phyed pa dang / lha dang bcas pa bdud dang bcas pa dang / dman pa byang chub sgrub pa'i chos dang / mi dge ba'i chos kyis mi phyed pa'o//
analyzed: gang las mi phyed pa dang / gang gis mi phyed pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi phyed pa dang / lha dang bcas pa bdud dang bcas pa dang / dman pa byang chub sgrub pa'i chos dang / mi dge ba'i chos kyis mi phyed pa'o//
translated: It is not divided from the perfect enlightenment, and it is not divided by the gods, demons, and so forth, by the inferior doctrines that are practiced for the sake of enlightenment, and by nonvirtuous doctrines.

original: @192b 'di ni dge 'dun dkon mchog la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: @192b 'di ni dge 'dun dkon mchog la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the misconception of the Jewel of the Saṅgha.🔽The means and realization of the Muni,

original: thabs bcas thub pa'i rtogs pa dang // zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: thabs bcas thub pa'i rtogs pa dang // zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i tshig ste /
translated: This is the statement of the chapter.

original: thabs la mkhas pa ni thabs kyis bstan te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa ni thabs kyis bstan te /
translated: Skill in means is taught by the means.

original: yul gyis yul can bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyis yul can bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object is taught by the subject.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par rtogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par rtogs pa bstan te /
translated: Realization is taught by the clear realization.

original: yang dag pa'i don mngon sum du rtogs pas na mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don mngon sum du rtogs pas na mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: It is a clear realization because it is a direct realization of the meaning of reality.

original: log pa'i shes pa dang / mi shes pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa dang / mi shes pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: It is not a wrong consciousness or ignorance.

original: thub pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po gtso bo'i rgyen byas te /
analyzed: thub pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po gtso bo'i rgyen byas te /
translated: The Muni is the principal entity.

original: sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “buddhahood” is the meaning of “awakening.”

original: thabs mkhas pa la byang chub mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa la byang chub mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “awakening is realized through skillful means” is the meaning of “compendium.”

original: 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa la re ba mi byed de /
analyzed: 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ma bral ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa la re ba mi byed de /
translated: Without apprehending the three spheres, with a mind that is not separate from omniscience, one should not hope for the evolutionary development of generosity, etc.

original: 'on kyang sems can thams cad dgrol ba'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed de /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can thams cad dgrol ba'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed de /
translated: But in order to liberate all sentient beings, one should dedicate the merit to complete knowing.

original: de la sogs pa thabs la mkhas pa rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de la sogs pa thabs la mkhas pa rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said that the skillful means are extensive.

original: 'di thabs la mkhas pa la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di thabs la mkhas pa la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is a misconception about skillful means.

original: spros pa dang bral ba'i mngon bar rtogs pa ni yod de /
analyzed: spros pa dang bral ba'i mngon bar rtogs pa ni yod de /
translated: The realization of freedom from conceptual elaboration does exist.

original: gang la dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang la dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is the nonexistence of existence and the nonexistence of nonexistence.

original: 'di ni mngon par rtogs pa la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par rtogs pa la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is a misconception about realization.

original: mdo las ni spros pa'i sgra dang / bstan bcos las ni phyin ci log gi sgra brjod na gnyi ga yang don gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las ni spros pa'i sgra dang / bstan bcos las ni phyin ci log gi sgra brjod na gnyi ga yang don gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In the sutras, the term “conceptual elaboration” is used, and in the treatises, the term “error” is used.

original: gzugs rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa gang yin pa'i phyin ci log ni rab tu mang ste /
analyzed: gzugs rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa gang yin pa'i phyin ci log ni rab tu mang ste /
translated: There are many errors, such as the belief that form is permanent or impermanent, happy or sad, a self or not a self, and so on.

original: mdor bsdus na rnam par rtog pa ji snyed pa de thams cad ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus na rnam par rtog pa ji snyed pa de thams cad ni spros pa'o //
translated: In brief, all conceptual thoughts are conceptual elaborations.

original: mi spro 'phro bar mi byed ces bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
analyzed: mi spro 'phro bar mi byed ces bya ba ni gnyen po'o //
translated: “ Not elaborating” and “not causing elaboration” are the antidotes.

original: mi 'phro ba ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: mi 'phro ba ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: “ Not elaborating” is the dharmadhatu.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is nonconceptual.

original: de 'phro bar mi byed pa ni rnam par rtog par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de 'phro bar mi byed pa ni rnam par rtog par mi byed pa'o //
translated: “ Not causing elaboration” means not conceptualizing.

original: 'di ni phyin ci log gi log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci log gi log par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the error of error.

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpas ngan song gi lam rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas par shes par bya /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpas ngan song gi lam rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas par shes par bya /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva should understand the paths to the lower realms together with their causes and results.

original: de dag las sems can rnams bzlog par bya ba nas //
analyzed: de dag las sems can rnams bzlog par bya ba nas //
translated: From among those, one should know the paths of humans,

original: @193a * // mi dang mi'am ci dang / nam mkha' lding dang / dri za la sogs pa'i lam dang / de bzhin du rgyal chen bzhi'i ris dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa nas /
analyzed: @193a * // mi dang mi'am ci dang / nam mkha' lding dang / dri za la sogs pa'i lam dang / de bzhin du rgyal chen bzhi'i ris dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa nas /
translated: half-humans, garuḍas, gandharvas, and so on, and similarly the paths of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyikas, the Trāyastriṃśas,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dang / de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam nas /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar dang / de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam nas /
translated: up to the Naiva­saṃjñā­nāsaṃjñāyatana, and similarly the path of the stream-enterer,

original: dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi bar dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bcas par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi bar dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bcas par shes par bya'o //
translated: up to the path of the arhat, the path of the pratyekabuddha, the path of the bodhisattva, and the path of the Buddha, together with their causes and results.

original: gang yang 'bras bu de la gzhag par 'os pa ni de dag de la rnam par 'jog par byed pas na //
analyzed: gang yang 'bras bu de la gzhag par 'os pa ni de dag de la rnam par 'jog par byed pas na //
translated: And those who are worthy to be established in those results, they establish them in those.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bar du'o //
translated: Up to the Buddha.

original: bdag nyid theg pa dman pa'i la las 'das te /
analyzed: bdag nyid theg pa dman pa'i la las 'das te /
translated: Having transcended the path of the lower vehicles,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa mthong bas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa mthong bas byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: By seeing omniscience, one enters into the faultlessness of the bodhisattva.

original: 'di ni lam la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lam la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is a false notion about the path.

original: 'dir 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: Here, all noble persons are not endowed with the afflictions, secondary afflictions, the realms of desire, form, and formlessness, the factors of awakening, the perfections, and so on,

original: de'i 'bras bu dang / 'phags pa'i chos thams cad dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu dang / 'phags pa'i chos thams cad dang ldan pa yang ma yin bral ba yang ma yin /
translated: nor are they free from the results of those and all the qualities of the noble ones.

original: gzugs med pa bstan du med par 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa bstan du med par 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa ste /
translated: They are formless, cannot be shown, and are like this: they are of a single characteristic, which is the absence of characteristics.

original: gang de ltar mi shes pa de la kun rdzob tu byang chub kyi phyogs byang chub sgrub par byed pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang de ltar mi shes pa de la kun rdzob tu byang chub kyi phyogs byang chub sgrub par byed pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: For one who does not know this, the relative is taught as the factors of awakening that accomplish awakening.

original: 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is a false notion about the adverse and the counteragent.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma las sems can rnams gzung bar bya ba'i don du kun rdzob kyi bden pa la brten nas /🔽chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rgya cher bstan te /

analyzed: chos thams cad chags pa med pa ni ma chags pa ste /

original: bgegs med pa nyid do //
analyzed: bgegs med pa nyid do //

analyzed: rim gyis sems can yongs su grol bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' des de rjes su rig par bya'o //

translated: How is it that, beginning from the first production of the thought of enlightenment,🔽he practices the perfection of generosity?🔽He himself gives gifts and he establishes others in the perfection of generosity.

analyzed: sbyin pa'i bsngags pa yang rjod par byed /

analyzed: de sbyin pa des longs spyod kyi phung po chen po thob po //
translated: By that generosity, he obtains a great mass of wealth.

translated: With a mind free from stinginess, he gives away food and drink, clothes and ointments, beds and dwellings, and other necessities of life, whatever is desired.

analyzed: de tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po dang ldan pa de nyid kyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i sa las 'da' bar byed /

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug par byed /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug par byed /

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed /

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor bar byed /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor bar byed /

analyzed: sems can rnams theg pa gsum la 'god cing 'khor ba las yongs su grol bar byed de /

analyzed: de ltar sbyin pas mthar gyis bya ba byed kyang de dang sems can rnam la mi dmigs so //

analyzed: de ltar 'di la ngo bo nyid med de gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med do //

analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthar gyis pa'i bya ba'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa drug kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis mthar gyis pa'i bya ba'o //

analyzed: sems 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gzhan yang bsod nams kyang 'jig rten na chos su brjod la de yang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams yin no //

analyzed: chos thams cad dbyer mi phyed pa ni tha mi dad pa'i mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: The inseparability of all phenomena is the sameness of non-difference,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of non-existence.

analyzed: des rjes su rig par bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //

analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de rnams la 'jog par byed /

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba nas /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba nas /

analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad ma yin /
translated: He is not the major and minor marks.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po ma yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po ma yin /
translated: He is not the aggregates of morality, etc.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa ma yin /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa ma yin /
translated: He is not the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the correct knowledges,

original: snying rje chen po ma yin /
analyzed: snying rje chen po ma yin /
translated: He is not great compassion.

original: byams pa chen po ma yin /
analyzed: byams pa chen po ma yin /
translated: He is not great loving kindness.

original: ma 'dres pa'i chos bco brgyad ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i chos bco brgyad ma yin /
translated: He is not the eighteen special qualities of a Buddha.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa yang ma yin par yid la byed do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa yang ma yin par yid la byed do //
translated: He is not dependent origination, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de dag ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are the nature of non-entity.

original: dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pa 'di ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pa 'di ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: This non-mindfulness and non-attention is the mindfulness of the Buddha.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: When he practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du yid la mi byed de /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du yid la mi byed de /
translated: he does not pay attention to wholesome dharmas, to conditioned or unconditioned dharmas, up to

original: de dag dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: yid la mi byed pa 'di ni chos rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: yid la mi byed pa 'di ni chos rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: This nonattention is the recollection of the Dharma.

original: gang de bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun skyes bu gang zag bzhi dang / skyes bu gang zag chen po brgyad po ni /
analyzed: gang de bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun skyes bu gang zag bzhi dang / skyes bu gang zag chen po brgyad po ni /
translated: The four pairs of persons, the eight individual persons, who are the Saṅgha of the Bhagavat’s śrāvakas,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis med de gang ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i chos de ni med de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis med de gang ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i chos de ni med de /
translated: are not existent by intrinsic nature. That which is not existent by intrinsic nature is nonexistent.

original: yid la mi byed pa 'di ni dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: yid la mi byed pa 'di ni dge 'dun rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: This nonattention is the recollection of the Saṅgha.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skyod pa na ma ral ba ma zhig pa ma 'dres pa mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin pa mthu dang ldan pa mkhas pas bsngags pa /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skyod pa na ma ral ba ma zhig pa ma 'dres pa mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin pa mthu dang ldan pa mkhas pas bsngags pa /
translated: When he is practicing the perfection of wisdom, he is not torn, not destroyed, not mixed up, not holding to the highest, powerful, praised by the wise,

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i tshul khrims la gnas nas /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i tshul khrims la gnas nas /
translated: having attained the absorption of meditative stabilization, he abides in morality.

original: tshul khrims dngos po med par yid la byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims dngos po med par yid la byed do //
translated: He attends to morality as a nonexistent thing.

original: yid la byed pa 'di ni tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa 'di ni tshul khrims rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: This attention is the recollection of morality.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na zang zing dang / chos dang / yan lag dang / @195b nyid lag thams cad gtong na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na zang zing dang / chos dang / yan lag dang / @195b nyid lag thams cad gtong na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du yid la bya'o //
translated: When they practice the perfection of wisdom, they should give up all their possessions, all their Dharma, and all their limbs and minor parts, and they should do so by paying attention to the fact that they have no intrinsic nature.

original: yid la mi byed pa 'di ni gtong ba rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: yid la mi byed pa 'di ni gtong ba rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: This non-attention is the recollection of giving.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na gang rgyal chen bzhi'i ris nas /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na gang rgyal chen bzhi'i ris nas /
translated: When they practice the perfection of wisdom, they should not pay attention to the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm,

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar du skyes pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa'i lha de dag ni med de /
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi bar du skyes pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa'i lha de dag ni med de /
translated: up to the gods of the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realm, who are stream enterers.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: They should not pay attention to them because they have no intrinsic nature.

original: yid la byed par rjes su dran pa 'di ni lha rjes su dran pa'o //🔽'di ni rjes su dran pa drug pa ste /
analyzed: yid la byed par rjes su dran pa 'di ni lha rjes su dran pa'o // 'di ni rjes su dran pa drug pa ste /
translated: This recollection is the recollection of the gods.🔽This is the sixth recollection.

original: rjes su dran pa drug gi mthar gyis pa'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa drug gi mthar gyis pa'i bya ba'o //
translated: This is the practice of the six recollections.

original: chos thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos te phung po dang khams dang / skye mched dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos te phung po dang khams dang / skye mched dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang /
translated: Dharmas are so called because they hold their own characteristics, such as the aggregates, elements, sense bases, factors of awakening,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
translated: perfections,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar ni chos thams cad do //
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de dag 'byung ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba med par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'byung ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba med par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-arising of those is the non-arising of the non-arising itself.

original: mthar gyis pa'i bya bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mthar gyis pa'i bya bar rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be known as the practice of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'byung ba med pa ni 'byung ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa ni 'byung ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The non-arising is the nature of non-arising.

original: de ltar na de dag ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Thus, they are the nature of non-existence.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid med pa de ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: That which has no nature is non-existent.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: When practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: dang po sems bskyed pa la brten nas /
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed pa la brten nas /
translated: based on the first generation of the mind of awakening,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams la mos par byas te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams la mos par byas te /
translated: Having conceived of phenomena that are the nature of non-entityness,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi nas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi nas /
translated: they cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la sgom par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la sgom par byed do //
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams yang dag par rtogs nas /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams yang dag par rtogs nas /
translated: Having realized phenomena that are the nature of non-entityness,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byed cing /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byed cing /
translated: they turn the wheel of Dharma

original: theg pa gsum gyis 'khor ba las sems can yongs su sgrol bar byed de /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis 'khor ba las sems can yongs su sgrol bar byed de /
translated: and liberate sentient beings from cyclic existence by means of the three vehicles.

original: 'di ni chos rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mthar gyis pa'i bya ba ste bcu gsum pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni chos rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mthar gyis pa'i bya ba ste bcu gsum pa bstan to //
translated: This is the thirteenth topic explained, the sequential activity of phenomena that are the nature of non-entityness.

original: de'i 'og tu rgol ba rang gis brtags nas lan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rgol ba rang gis brtags nas lan brjod par bya ste /
translated: After that, having imagined an opponent, a response should be stated.

original: gal te dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sgom par byed na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sgom par byed na /
translated: If one cultivates the perfection of wisdom and so on by way of the nature of non-entityness,

original: de sgom pa ni 'bras bu med de rta'i rva bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: de sgom pa ni 'bras bu med de rta'i rva bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: The objection is: “Meditation on that is fruitless, like the mane of a horse.”

original: chos thams cad 'gyur ba med pa dang @196a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'gyur ba med pa dang @196a * //
translated: The reply is given by “All phenomena are changeless,

original: mnyam pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa lan gsungs te /
analyzed: mnyam pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa lan gsungs te /
translated: unequalled, etc.”

original: 'gyur ba med pa ni chos dbyings so //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa ni chos dbyings so //
translated: Changeless is the dharma-element.

original: de dang mnyam pa ni chos thams cad de /
analyzed: de dang mnyam pa ni chos thams cad de /
translated: Equal to that are all phenomena.

original: ma bsgoms pa tsam gyis ni ma yin zhing chos kyi dbyings la dmigs nas /
analyzed: ma bsgoms pa tsam gyis ni ma yin zhing chos kyi dbyings la dmigs nas /
translated: It is not just non-meditation, but having observed the dharma-element,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyur 'gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi rgyur 'gyur pa yin te /
translated: it becomes the cause of the noble ones.

original: de nyid chos kyi dbyings zhes brjod na /
analyzed: de nyid chos kyi dbyings zhes brjod na /
translated: If that itself is called the dharma-element,

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu med par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu med par 'gyur /
translated: then it would be fruitless.

original: so so rang rig pa zhes bya bas bdag dang / rnam par rig pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: so so rang rig pa zhes bya bas bdag dang / rnam par rig pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since it is said to be “individually self-cognized,” isn’t there a self and awareness?

original: de'i phyir 'dzin pa yod pas gzung ba yang yod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dzin pa yod pas gzung ba yang yod de /
translated: Therefore, since there is grasping, there is also the grasped.

original: des na chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'o zhes bya ba de mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: des na chos thams cad ni dngos po med pa'o zhes bya ba de mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is unreasonable to say that all phenomena are unreal.” This is the objection.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / rnam par rig pa med par shes rab kyis rjes su rtogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan gsungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / rnam par rig pa med par shes rab kyis rjes su rtogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan gsungs te /
translated: The reply is stated by ...because of the realization by wisdom of all phenomena as selfless and as non-apprehension.

original: bdag med pa dang rnam par rig pa med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang rnam par rig pa med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Selflessness and non-apprehension are as follows:

original: bdag gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of selflessness is due to the absence of the characteristics of a self.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par rig pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par rig pa med pa'o //
translated: Non-apprehension is due to the absence of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: shes rab kyis rjes su rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni tshad mas yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis rjes su rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni tshad mas yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Realization by wisdom is due to the certainty of valid cognition.

original: bdag ni rtag pa gcig pa'i ngo bo shes pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pa gcig pa'i ngo bo shes pa yin la /
translated: The self is a cognition that is permanent and unitary,

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni de lta bur gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni de lta bur gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: but form, etc. are not like that.

original: de'i phyir bdag med pa nyid du 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med pa nyid du 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established as selfless.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba de nyid kyis phyir yang rnam par rig pa'i rnam pa yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba de nyid kyis phyir yang rnam par rig pa'i rnam pa yang ma grub ste /
translated: Also, due to the absence of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, the aspect of apprehension is not established.🔽 🔽Because of the realization by wisdom of all phenomena as selfless and as non-apprehension is stated in order to show the absence of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the characteristic of grasping.

original: 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir gzung ba yang med de /
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir gzung ba yang med de /
translated: And because there is no grasping, there is no grasped.

original: des na chos thams cad dngos po med par grub po //
analyzed: des na chos thams cad dngos po med par grub po //
translated: Therefore, all things are established as unreal.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba de nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba de nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa yin te /
translated: That which is expressed by the words form, etc. is just form, etc.

original: de dag brjod pa 'jig rten na yang yod la nyan pa rnams la yang mi slu ba'i tha snyad yod na chos thams cad dngos po med pa de dag las zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: de dag brjod pa 'jig rten na yang yod la nyan pa rnams la yang mi slu ba'i tha snyad yod na chos thams cad dngos po med pa de dag las zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: If that expression exists in the world and is not deceptive for the listeners, then, in that case, all things are unreal.

original: chos thams cad ming tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ming tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan gsungs so //
translated: He responds to that objection with the words all things are mere names, etc.

original: don gyis stong pa'i ming ni ming tsam mo //
analyzed: don gyis stong pa'i ming ni ming tsam mo //
translated: A name that is empty of an object is a mere name.

original: des chos de dag thams cad brjod pa na blo'i rnam pa de dag la don med do //
analyzed: des chos de dag thams cad brjod pa na blo'i rnam pa de dag la don med do //
translated: When all those things are expressed by that, there is no object in those aspects of cognition.

original: phyi rol nyid du rtogs pas phyi rol @196b nyid du 'jug pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid du rtogs pas phyi rol @196b nyid du 'jug pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Because they engage external objects as external.

original: phyi rol gyi don nyid kyang med de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don nyid kyang med de /
translated: External objects do not exist.

original: phyi rol med kyang sgra las don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol med kyang sgra las don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, even though external objects do not exist, meaning is understood from sound.

original: gal te blo nyid sgra las phyi rol gyi dngos por rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te blo nyid sgra las phyi rol gyi dngos por rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the mind itself is understood from sound as an external thing,

original: de dag ni de la don gyi dngos po med de gzhan du tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de la don gyi dngos po med de gzhan du tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: those do not have the nature of an object there, because they are different from it.

original: tha mi dad na ni blo dang ldan pas kyang don thob pas mi slu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad na ni blo dang ldan pas kyang don thob pas mi slu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were not different, then even one who has the mind would attain the object, and so would not be deceived.

original: de'i phyir don gyi dngos po med pas ming tsam dang tha snyad gdags pa tsam gyis brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyi dngos po med pas ming tsam dang tha snyad gdags pa tsam gyis brjod do //
translated: Therefore, because it does not have the nature of an object, it is said to be mere name, mere social convention.

original: gal te re zhig tha snyad tsam ni yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te re zhig tha snyad tsam ni yod do zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that social convention itself exists,

original: tha snyad gdags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te gang du yang med ces bya ba ni don med pa'i phyir lus dang ngag dang / yid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad gdags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te gang du yang med ces bya ba ni don med pa'i phyir lus dang ngag dang / yid kyang ma yin te /
translated: it is said, “Social convention is not anything at all,” because it does not exist anywhere, due to the absence of an object. It is not the body, speech, or mind,

original: brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of expression and the means of expression are not observed.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: “All phenomena” and so on concludes.

original: tha snyad med pa brjod du med pa zhes bya ba ni de rnams la de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad med pa brjod du med pa zhes bya ba ni de rnams la de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression “without conventional expressions, inexpressible” is because they do not exist in those .

original: de nyid kyi sgras med pa dang tshig med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi sgras med pa dang tshig med pa'o //
translated: The word “just” means “without” and “not”.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams tshad dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir de'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa yang tshad dang ldan pa yin zhing de'i phyir de la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang tshad dang ldan par 'gyur ba yang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams tshad dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir de'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa yang tshad dang ldan pa yin zhing de'i phyir de la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang tshad dang ldan par 'gyur ba yang /
translated: Since form, etc., are limited in quantity, its emptiness, etc., are also limited in quantity. Therefore, is it not the case that the perfection of wisdom that has that as its object is also limited in quantity?

original: mi 'dod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: This is the objection.

original: chos thams cad tshad med pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni lan gsungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad tshad med pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni lan gsungs te /
translated: The answer is given by “because all things are immeasurable”.

original: chos thams cad tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: chos thams cad tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: “All things are immeasurable” means because of their immeasurability.

original: ji ltar dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir chos rnams la tshad med do //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir chos rnams la tshad med do //
translated: How is it that things are immeasurable because they are characterized by non-existence?

original: nam mkha' la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid med pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid de la yang tshad med de gcod par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid med pa de bzhin du stong pa nyid de la yang tshad med de gcod par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as space has no characteristic of the nature of non-existence, so too that emptiness has no measure, because it is not cut off.

original: des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang tha mi dad do //
analyzed: des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang tha mi dad do //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom is not different.

original: gal te de lta na gzugs la sogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag kyang ji ltar snang zhe na 'di dag ni chos kyi mtshan ma yin gyi chos kyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta na gzugs la sogs pa'i sngon po la sogs pa 'di dag kyang ji ltar snang zhe na 'di dag ni chos kyi mtshan ma yin gyi chos kyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then how do these blue and so forth of form and so on appear? They are the signs of phenomena, not the entities of phenomena.

original: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir dang / mi snang ba bdag nyid snang ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽chos rnams kyi mtshan ma yang chos rnams kyi 'khrul @197a * //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo dang bral ba'i phyir dang / mi snang ba bdag nyid snang ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro // chos rnams kyi mtshan ma yang chos rnams kyi 'khrul @197a * //
translated: Because they are devoid of the nature of one and many, and because it is illogical for the non-appearing to appear.

original: pa'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: pa'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: The signs of phenomena are the aspects of error of phenomena.

original: de yang snang ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir snang ba ni de dag med pa yin yang snang ste /
analyzed: de yang snang ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir snang ba ni de dag med pa yin yang snang ste /
translated: And that is the nature of appearance, so appearance is that even when they do not exist.

original: 'khrul ba rnams la ni med pa'i mtshan nyid snang ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khrul ba rnams la ni med pa'i mtshan nyid snang ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the characteristics of non-existence appear to those who are deluded.

original: gal te de lta na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang mi 'grub ste de ni 'khrul pa yang ma yin la rnam pa dang bcas pa'i blo ni 'khrul pa yin zhing rnam pa med pa'i blo ni rmi lam na yang nyams su myong ba ma
analyzed: gal te de lta na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang mi 'grub ste de ni 'khrul pa yang ma yin la rnam pa dang bcas pa'i blo ni 'khrul pa yin zhing rnam pa med pa'i blo ni rmi lam na yang nyams su myong ba ma
translated: If that is so, then the perfection of wisdom is not established, because it is not delusion, and a cognition with aspects is delusion, and a cognition without aspects is not experienced even in a dream.

original: yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: This is the objection.

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan gsungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan gsungs te /
translated: The answer is given by the verse beginning with “Because all phenomena are without characteristics,” and so on.

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma nub ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma nub ste /
translated: The characteristics of all phenomena have subsided.

original: shes pa snang ba dang rnam pa med do //
analyzed: shes pa snang ba dang rnam pa med do //
translated: Cognition is without appearance and aspects.

original: des na rnam pa spangs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: des na rnam pa spangs pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, because aspects are abandoned, it should be known as the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin no zhes bsams so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhin no zhes bsams so //
translated: like the four formless absorptions. This is the thought.

original: 'o na rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma 'di spangs pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings yang dag par yid la byed pa ma yin na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma 'di spangs pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings yang dag par yid la byed pa ma yin na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: This is the objection.

original: chos thams cad nges par 'byed pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni lan gsungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad nges par 'byed pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni lan gsungs te /
translated: The reply is given by because it is the discrimination of all dharmas.

original: nges par 'byed pa ni 'dir so sor rtog pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa ni 'dir so sor rtog pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, discrimination is said to be discernment.

original: chos thams cad yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: chos thams cad yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis mngon sum du byas te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the direct realization of the nature of the perfected of all dharmas by the wisdom of discernment.

original: de ni de dag gi nges par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi nges par 'byed pa'o //
translated: That is their discrimination.

original: des na 'di ni de'i mtshan nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'di ni de'i mtshan nyid kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is the perfection of wisdom by its very nature, is what is meant.

original: de ltar na de nyid legs par yid la byed pa'i thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i rim gyis lhun gyis grub pa mngon par 'du mi byed pa yid la byed cing chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la spros pa med pa'i shes pa yang skye ba yin te //
analyzed: de ltar na de nyid legs par yid la byed pa'i thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i rim gyis lhun gyis grub pa mngon par 'du mi byed pa yid la byed cing chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la spros pa med pa'i shes pa yang skye ba yin te //
translated: Thus, by the process of hearing, reflection, and meditation, which properly attend to reality, one generates the non-constructive attention that is spontaneous and non-deferential, and also the cognition that is free from conceptual proliferation with respect to the reality of all things.

original: de ni de la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the discernment of that reality.

original: ji ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gang yin /
analyzed: ji ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the perfection of wisdom?

original: dag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is purity,

original: de ni mi rigs te 'di ltar de'i tshe dag pa gang yin /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te 'di ltar de'i tshe dag pa gang yin /
translated: that is not correct, because at that time, what is pure?

original: bdag ni med pas mi 'dod la /
analyzed: bdag ni med pas mi 'dod la /
translated: Since the self does not exist, it is not that.

original: skad cig re re la 'jig pa'i phyir sems ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig re re la 'jig pa'i phyir sems ni ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the mind, because it is destroyed moment by moment.

original: ji ste sems kyi rgyun la yin no zhe na /🔽de yang rang bzhin gyis ma dag pa'am /
analyzed: ji ste sems kyi rgyun la yin no zhe na / de yang rang bzhin gyis ma dag pa'am /
translated: If it is the continuum of the mind,🔽is that continuum pure by nature

original: dag pa cig yin grang na /
analyzed: dag pa cig yin grang na /
translated: or is it not?

original: phyogs dang po ltar na de ni dag pa ma @197b yin te /
analyzed: phyogs dang po ltar na de ni dag pa ma @197b yin te /
translated: If it is the first case, it is not pure,

original: sol ba bdar ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sol ba bdar ba bzhin no //
translated: like a burnt wick.

original: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na don med do //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa ltar na don med do //
translated: If it is the second case, it is meaningless.

original: ji ste sems kyi chos nyid dag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste sems kyi chos nyid dag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is the purity of the nature of mind,🔽that is also unreasonable, because there is no transformation.

original: de yang mi rigs te de la ni rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te de la ni rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: This is the objection.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan gsungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan gsungs te /
translated: The reply is given by “because all phenomena are pure by nature,” and so forth.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa de'i phyir dgongs pa des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rjes su rig par bya /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa de'i phyir dgongs pa des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rjes su rig par bya /
translated: Because all phenomena are pure by nature, with that intention one should understand the perfection of wisdom,

original: rjes su gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su gnas par bya'o //
translated: and one should abide in it.

original: de ni rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir de yang mi rigs so zhes smras pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de ni rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir de yang mi rigs so zhes smras pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But wasn’t it said that because there is no transformation, that is also unreasonable?

original: 'di ni smras kyang 'on kyang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ni smras kyang 'on kyang mi rigs te /
translated: Although that was said, it is still unreasonable.

original: gtan tshigs nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the reason is certain.

original: de ni rang bzhin kho nas rnam par dag kyang /
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin kho nas rnam par dag kyang /
translated: Although that is pure by nature,

original: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir glo bur gyi sgrib pa'i dri mas dri ma can du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir glo bur gyi sgrib pa'i dri mas dri ma can du byas pa yin te /
translated: Because it is not their nature, it is made impure by the stains of adventitious obscurations.

original: sprin dang / mun pa dang / khug rna la sogs pas bsgribs pas nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: sprin dang / mun pa dang / khug rna la sogs pas bsgribs pas nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: Like the sky, which is obscured by clouds, darkness, fog, and so on.

original: phyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas de dag bsal bas rnam par dag par 'gyur te/ sprin la sogs pa bsal ba'i nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: phyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas de dag bsal bas rnam par dag par 'gyur te/ sprin la sogs pa bsal ba'i nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: Later, by the perfection of wisdom, they are removed and it becomes pure, like the sky when the clouds and so on are removed.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan la /
translated: The perfection of wisdom was taught by the Lord.

original: bstan pas mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i shes pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: bstan pas mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i shes pa skyed par byed do //
translated: And by teaching it, it produces a cognition that has signs.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: Therefore, is the perfection of wisdom not with signs? This is the objection.

original: chos thams cad tshig med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan gsungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad tshig med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan gsungs te /
translated: The reply is stated in the passage beginning with “Because all dharmas are without words,” and so on.

original: chos thams cad ni tshig med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni tshig med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all dharmas are without words,

original: tshig gis rang gi ngo bo mi ston te /
analyzed: tshig gis rang gi ngo bo mi ston te /
translated: Words do not reveal their own nature.

original: mtshon pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: mtshon pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: They are only the means of revealing.

original: des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni don dam pa ston pa'i don du rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni don dam pa ston pa'i don du rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom should be understood as having the ultimate as its object.

original: gal te las zad cing nyon mongs pa zad kyang /
analyzed: gal te las zad cing nyon mongs pa zad kyang /
translated: If karma and afflictions are exhausted,

original: yang srid du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: yang srid du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: but there is still rebirth,

original: ji ste zad pas skye ba yang zad de /
analyzed: ji ste zad pas skye ba yang zad de /
translated: or if, due to exhaustion, birth is also exhausted,

original: de 'du byed lhag ma tshe ji srid kyi bar du gnas nas rang nyid 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'du byed lhag ma tshe ji srid kyi bar du gnas nas rang nyid 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: and it abides for the remainder of its life and then ceases by itself,

original: des na byang chub kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na byang chub kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: then it would be enlightenment,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ni ma yin te /
translated: but not unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i khyad par ni brjod par bya ba ma yin nam zhe na zhes bya ba @198a * //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni brjod par bya ba ma yin nam zhe na zhes bya ba @198a * //
translated: Isn't its distinction inexpressible?

original: ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: ni rgol ba'o //
translated: This is the objection.

original: tshig gsum gyis ni lan gsungs te //
analyzed: tshig gsum gyis ni lan gsungs te //
translated: The answer is given in three statements.

original: chos thams cad 'gog pa med pa zhes bya ba ni zad pa med pa'i chos rnams mi zad pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'gog pa med pa zhes bya ba ni zad pa med pa'i chos rnams mi zad pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: The absence of cessation of all dharmas is to be recognized as the perfection of wisdom, because of the non-exhaustion of inexhaustible dharmas.

original: ji ltar 'gog pa med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gog pa med ce na /
translated: How is there no cessation?

original: spang ba dang mnyam pa ni nges pa med pas spang ba dang / khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spang ba dang mnyam pa ni nges pa med pas spang ba dang / khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of a difference between what is to be relinquished and what relinquishes, since there is no certainty that what is equal is the same.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: All dharmas is to be recognized as the perfection of wisdom, because all defiled dharmas are nirvana.

original: ji ltar de dag gi de bzhin nyid de kho na bzhin du shes pa ni de bzhin nyid dang mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar de dag gi de bzhin nyid de kho na bzhin du shes pa ni de bzhin nyid dang mnyam pa'o //
translated: How is it that the knowledge of suchness of those is the same as suchness?

original: de ltar de dag de bzhin nyid dang mnyam pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar de dag de bzhin nyid dang mnyam pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they are the same as suchness?

original: chos thams cad mi 'ong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi 'ong zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said: “All dharmas do not come, etc.”

original: mi 'ong zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas so //
analyzed: mi 'ong zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus nas so //
translated: “Do not come” means from the future time.

original: mi 'gro zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: mi 'gro zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus su'o //
translated: “It does not go” means in the past.

original: gang nas 'ong bar bya ba dang / gang du 'gro bar bya ba de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang nas 'ong bar bya ba dang / gang du 'gro bar bya ba de dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no coming from anywhere and no going to anywhere.

original: gang yang mi shes pa ni rang rig pa tsam gyis dus mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang mi shes pa ni rang rig pa tsam gyis dus mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is not known” means that it is not known by mere self-awareness.

original: mi shes pa'i phyir dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ni shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i phyir dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ni shes pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not known, and because coming and going are preceded by knowledge.

original: de bas na mi skye shin tu mi skye zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mi skye shin tu mi skye zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “It does not arise, it does not arise at all.”

original: 'di tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This much shows the perfection of the bodhisattvas’ own aim.

original: 'di rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa yin na yang /
analyzed: 'di rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa yin na yang /
translated: Although this is the perfection of their own aim,

original: 'jig rten na rang gi don la rang bzhin gyis dga' ba'i phyir de'i don du dka' ba yang 'bad par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten na rang gi don la rang bzhin gyis dga' ba'i phyir de'i don du dka' ba yang 'bad par byed do //
translated: because in the world one naturally delights in one’s own aim, one strives with difficulty for that aim.

original: gzhan gyi don ni dka' ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ni dka' ste /
translated: But the aim of others is difficult.

original: sems can rnams mtha' yas pa'i phyir dang / gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / log par rtog pa mang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams mtha' yas pa'i phyir dang / gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / log par rtog pa mang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: The objection is: “Because sentient beings are infinite, because they are different, and because there are many wrong ideas.”

original: bdag dang gzhan du mi lta ba'i phyir zhes bya ba lan gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du mi lta ba'i phyir zhes bya ba lan gsungs te /
translated: The reply is: “Because of the non-apprehension of self and other.”

original: bdag dang gzhan zhes bya ba ni dbye ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan zhes bya ba ni dbye ba'o //
translated: “Self and other” is a distinction.

original: de mi mthong ba'i phyir sems can thams cad dang bdag mnyam pa nyid du lta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de mi mthong ba'i phyir sems can thams cad dang bdag mnyam pa nyid du lta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because that is not seen, all sentient beings are seen as the same as oneself.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pa'i mdo las /
translated: Thus, in the Vimalakirti Sutra,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ri rab dang mnyam pa bskyed kyang /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ri rab dang mnyam pa bskyed kyang /
translated: it says: “Even though one generates the view of the transitory aggregates equal to Mount Meru,

original: byang chub kyi sems bskyed cing de las sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skye'o zhes @198b gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed cing de las sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skye'o zhes @198b gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: if one generates the thought of enlightenment, all the qualities of a Buddha are generated from that.”

original: de'i 'og tu dka' ba'i 'du shes kyi gnyen po de lta ji ltar so sor brtag par bya ba de ni chos thams cad 'phags pa dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dka' ba'i 'du shes kyi gnyen po de lta ji ltar so sor brtag par bya ba de ni chos thams cad 'phags pa dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: After that, the antidote to the idea of difficulty is the contemplation of the ease of obtaining the optimum human rebirth.🔽

original: khong khro ba med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: khong khro ba med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
translated: After that, the antidote to the idea of difficulty is the analysis of how that is. That is taught by the passage beginning with “All phenomena are noble and arhat” and ending with “Because of the absence of anger, one should know the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de la dang po sems can rnams dgra bcom pa nyid la sogs par dka' ba'i 'du shes bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dang po sems can rnams dgra bcom pa nyid la sogs par dka' ba'i 'du shes bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: There, first, in order to dispel the idea of difficulty with respect to arhatship, etc.,

original: chos thams cad 'phags pa dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'phags pa dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said that “all phenomena are noble and arhat.”

original: chos thams cad ni sems can tha snyad du gdags pa'i yul te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sems can tha snyad du gdags pa'i yul te /
translated: All phenomena are the objects of the conventional designation of sentient beings.

original: 'phags pa dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: They are noble and arhat.

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are merely the nature of natural purity.

original: khur mi khyer ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir khur mi khyer ba'o //
analyzed: khur mi khyer ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir khur mi khyer ba'o //
translated: “Not carrying a burden” means not carrying a burden because of the nature of non-entityness.

original: sems can gdul bar bya ba'i don du phyogs bcur sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ba na /
analyzed: sems can gdul bar bya ba'i don du phyogs bcur sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ba na /
translated: In order to tame sentient beings, one goes to the buddha-fields in the ten directions.

original: dka' ba'i 'du shes bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dka' ba'i 'du shes bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel the notion of difficulty,

original: chos thams cad yul med cing phyogs med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad yul med cing phyogs med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “All phenomena are non-objective and non-directional,” and so forth.

original: yul med pa'i phyir dang / phyogs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul med pa'i phyir dang / phyogs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are non-objective and non-directional.

original: rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de ni de bzhin nyid ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de ni de bzhin nyid ngo bo nyid de /
translated: “By the very nature of their essence” means that the nature of form and so forth is suchness, the very essence.

original: de ni yul na med de /
analyzed: de ni yul na med de /
translated: That is not in a place,

original: gnas pa med pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of non-abiding.

original: phyogs kyang med de /
analyzed: phyogs kyang med de /
translated: There is no direction,

original: cha med pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: cha med pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: because it is partless like space.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal spang bar dka' ba'i 'du shes bsal ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni 'khor ba'i chos thams cad 'gag pa na rab tu sim par byed pa nyid kyis bde ba'i 'du shes skyed pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal spang bar dka' ba'i 'du shes bsal ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni 'khor ba'i chos thams cad 'gag pa na rab tu sim par byed pa nyid kyis bde ba'i 'du shes skyed pa nyid de /
translated: In order to dispel the notion of the difficulty of abandoning the sufferings of saṃsāra, it is said that when all the phenomena of saṃsāra cease, one should generate the notion of bliss by being thoroughly refreshed.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand it as the perfection of wisdom.

original: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag //
analyzed: kye ma 'du byed rnams mi rtag //
translated: Alas, conditioned things are impermanent,

original: skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
analyzed: skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin //
translated: they have the nature of arising and passing away.

original: skyes nas 'gag par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: skyes nas 'gag par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: Having arisen, they cease;

original: de dag myur du zhi ba bde //
analyzed: de dag myur du zhi ba bde //
translated: their pacification is bliss.

original: zhes pa'o // 'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba rdzogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyan thos kyi 'dul ba rdzogs pa'i don to //
translated: The word “alas” has the meaning of completing the training of the disciples.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dul ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'dul ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the training of the bodhisattvas,

original: dga' ba med cing dga' ba dang bral ba med pa'i phyir @199a * //
analyzed: dga' ba med cing dga' ba dang bral ba med pa'i phyir @199a * //
translated: it is said, “because there is no joy and no absence of joy.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽🔽

original: dga' ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la shin tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la shin tu dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is delighting in nirvāṇa.

original: dga' ba dang bral ba ni shin tu 'khor ba la skyo ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bral ba ni shin tu 'khor ba la skyo ba'o //
translated: Absence of joy is being weary of saṃsāra.

original: de med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dga' ba dang bral ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dga' ba dang bral ba med pa'o //
translated: The absence of those two is the absence of joy and absence of joy of the bodhisattvas.

original: de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med pa ste /
translated: They are the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the discrimination of not abiding in either cyclic existence or nirvana.

original: 'dod chags med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The phrase free from attachment and so on refers to the discrimination of freedom from attachment.

original: chos thams cad la chags pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la chags pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par ma zhen pa'o //
translated: The phrase free from all attachments refers to non-attachment.

original: chags pa dang ma chags pa dang / de'i gnyen po de dang bral ba dang / gsum mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'di ni rnam par rtog pa spang ba la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang ma chags pa dang / de'i gnyen po de dang bral ba dang / gsum mi dmigs pa'i phyir 'di ni rnam par rtog pa spang ba la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the discrimination of the abandonment of discrimination, because the three-attachment, non-attachment, and the antidote that is free from them-are not apprehended.

original: chos thams cad ni lam thams cad de /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni lam thams cad de /
translated: All phenomena are all paths,

original: mngon par rtogs pa bdun no //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa bdun no //
translated: which are the seven realizations.

original: de nyid byang chub ste /
analyzed: de nyid byang chub ste /
translated: That itself is enlightenment,

original: byang chub thob par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub thob par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the attainment of enlightenment.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi ye shes khong du chud pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi ye shes khong du chud pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that one penetrates the wisdom of the Buddha.

original: khong du chud pa ni thob pa ste /
analyzed: khong du chud pa ni thob pa ste /
translated: Penetration is attainment.
