original: de ni byang chub ste /
analyzed: de ni byang chub ste /
translated: That is enlightenment.

original: legs par rtogs pa thob pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: legs par rtogs pa thob pa la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The realization of the individual characteristic is the discernment of the path.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos thams cad de /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos thams cad de /
translated: All dharmas are so called because they hold their own characteristics.

original: de ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa ste /
translated: They are emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi don dang bral ba'i phyir dang / mtshan ma thams cad nub pa'i phyir dang / 'khrul pa'i ngo bo'i khams gsum pa la smon pa med pa nyid kyi phyir te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi don dang bral ba'i phyir dang / mtshan ma thams cad nub pa'i phyir dang / 'khrul pa'i ngo bo'i khams gsum pa la smon pa med pa nyid kyi phyir te go rims bzhin no //
translated: Because of the meaning of mere representation, because of the disappearance of all signs, and because of the absence of wishes for the triple world which is the essence of error, respectively.

original: 'di ni lam la so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lam la so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the discernment of the path.

original: gal te de dag rnam par thar ba'i sgo'i lam la'ang sgom pa de'i tshe 'ang dman pa'i byang chub tu ltung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dag rnam par thar ba'i sgo'i lam la'ang sgom pa de'i tshe 'ang dman pa'i byang chub tu ltung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If they cultivate the path which is the gate to liberation, then at that time they will fall into an inferior enlightenment.

original: de'i phyir byams pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byams pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “great love,” etc.

original: chos thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam thams cad do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam thams cad do //
translated: All dharmas are the path of the bodhisattva.

original: sman zhes bya ba ni theg pa dman pa la dga' ba'i nad chen po sel ba'o //
analyzed: sman zhes bya ba ni theg pa dman pa la dga' ba'i nad chen po sel ba'o //
translated: The “medicine” is the cure for the great disease of delight in the Lesser Vehicle.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: byams pa chen po sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byams pa chen po sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “preceded by great lovingkindness,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir byams pa chen po ni de dag gi sngon du @199b 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byams pa chen po ni de dag gi sngon du @199b 'gro ba'o //
translated: Because great lovingkindness precedes them.

original: gzhan yang de dag tshad med pa bzhi dang / lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir byams pa la sogs pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag tshad med pa bzhi dang / lhan cig gnas pa'i phyir byams pa la sogs pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, they abide in lovingkindness, etc., because they dwell together with the four immeasurables.

original: tshangs pa lta bur gyur ba zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa lta bur gyur ba zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “Like Brahmā” means like Brahmā.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang mi len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang mi len pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: Similarly, “because they do not take up hatred” is the teaching.

original: zhe sdang thams cad mi len pa zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang thams cad mi len pa zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o //
translated: “They do not take up any hatred” is the explanation.

original: zhe sdang thams cad byams pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: zhe sdang thams cad byams pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: All hatred is the adversary of lovingkindness, etc.

original: go rims bzhin du gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / khong khro ba dang / rjes su chags pa'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / khong khro ba dang / rjes su chags pa'o //
translated: malice, violence, displeasure, anger, and attachment, respectively.

original: smon pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon pa med pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of expectancy is because of being free from delight in nirvana.

original: khong khro ba med pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba la shin tu skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khong khro ba med pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba la shin tu skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of anger is because of not being wearied by samsara.

original: 'di ni mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa bcu gsum phan yon dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa bcu gsum phan yon dang bcas pa'o //
translated: This is the gradual clear realization with its benefits.

original: skad cig ma'i gcig pa'i mngon par rtogs par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i gcig pa'i mngon par rtogs par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The clear realization in one moment should be stated.

original: skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs byang chub //
analyzed: skad cig gcig mngon rdzogs byang chub //
translated: Enlightenment is in one moment.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ni rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ni rnam pa bzhi //
translated: It has four aspects by way of its characteristics.

original: zhes bya ba la chos thams cad zag pa med pa sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la chos thams cad zag pa med pa sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa dang /
translated: One realizes all contaminated and uncontaminated phenomena in a single moment of mind.🔽One realizes all phenomena in a single moment of mind.🔽One realizes all phenomena as signless in a single moment of mind.

original: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis rtogs pa dang / chos thams cad gnyis su med par sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis rtogs pa dang / chos thams cad gnyis su med par sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis rtogs pa'o //
translated: One realizes all phenomena as nondual in a single moment of mind.

original: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: With respect to the first, the treatise states:

original: sbyin la sogs pa re res kyang //
analyzed: sbyin la sogs pa re res kyang //
translated: Since each, such as generosity,

original: zag med chos kun bsdus pa'i phyir //🔽thub pa'i skad cig gcig pa yi //
analyzed: zag med chos kun bsdus pa'i phyir // thub pa'i skad cig gcig pa yi //
translated: encompasses all uncontaminated phenomena,🔽this is understood to be the Sage’s

original: rtogs par 'di ni shes par bya //
analyzed: rtogs par 'di ni shes par bya //
translated: realization in a single moment.

original: ji ltar skyes bus zo chun rgyud //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bus zo chun rgyud //
translated: Just as a person can set in motion

original: rdog thabs gcig gis bskyod pa na //
analyzed: rdog thabs gcig gis bskyod pa na //
translated: a chain of events with a single step,🔽so too is the Sage’s realization

original: thams cad cig car 'gul ba ltar //
analyzed: thams cad cig car 'gul ba ltar //
translated: in a single moment.

original: skad cig gcig shes de bzhin no //
analyzed: skad cig gcig shes de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the knowledge of one instant.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni //
translated: The bodhisattva who practices the perfection of wisdom

original: sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis @200a * //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis @200a * //
translated: enters into the knowledge of one instant of mind.

original: 'jug pa na sbyin pa la sogs pa re res kyang /
analyzed: 'jug pa na sbyin pa la sogs pa re res kyang /
translated: By each of the perfections such as generosity,

original: zag pa med pa'i chos kun bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos kun bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: all the uncontaminated dharmas are included,

original: 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are led by that.

original: skad cig ma gcig pa'i rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig pa'i rtogs pa ste /
translated: The realization of one instant is

original: sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis rtogs pa'o //
translated: the realization of one instant of mind.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba dang po'o //
translated: This is the first.

original: de ltar na ji ltar skyes bus rdog thabs gcig gis bskyod pa na /
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar skyes bus rdog thabs gcig gis bskyod pa na /
translated: Thus, just as when a person moves one part of a waterwheel,

original: zo chun gyi rgyud thams cad cig car 'gul ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: zo chun gyi rgyud thams cad cig car 'gul ba de bzhin du /
translated: the entire series of buckets moves simultaneously,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems dang ldan pa ni /
translated: in the same way, one who has the mind of generosity and so on

original: zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi tshogs cig car 'dren par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi tshogs cig car 'dren par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: simultaneously leads the entire collection of uncontaminated dharmas. This is the meaning.

original: de'i phyir med las /
analyzed: de'i phyir med las /
translated: Therefore, in the sutra,

original: rgya mtsho mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rgya mtsho mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be known as boundless because the ocean is boundless.

original: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bsdu ba'i phyir dang / de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dang / ma bral ba'i phyir zab cing rgya che ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bsdu ba'i phyir dang / de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dang / ma bral ba'i phyir zab cing rgya che ba ste /
translated: Here, the perfection of wisdom is profound and vast because it includes everything and because it is never separated from the attention of omniscience.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa re re'i sems kyi skad cig ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa re re'i sems kyi skad cig ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Each moment of mind of generosity and so on is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i mu med pa ni mu med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mu med pa ni mu med pa ste /
translated: Its boundlessness is boundlessness.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams 'dren pa nyid de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams 'dren pa nyid de /
translated: It is the leader of uncontaminated dharmas.

original: de dag phan tshun 'brel pa ni yin ring du yongs su 'dren pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun 'brel pa ni yin ring du yongs su 'dren pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are mutually connected because they lead each other far.

original: de rjes su rig par bya ba ni shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de rjes su rig par bya ba ni shes par bya'o //
translated: That should be known means should be understood.

original: de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rgya mtsho mu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rgya mtsho mu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said: because the ocean is boundless.

original: zab cing rgya che ba'i rgya mtsho ni mu med de /
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba'i rgya mtsho ni mu med de /
translated: The ocean of the profound and the vast is boundless.

original: mu med pa ni cig car chu bo'i chu 'dren pa de nyid de /
analyzed: mu med pa ni cig car chu bo'i chu 'dren pa de nyid de /
translated: The boundless is the simultaneous drawing in of the waters of the rivers,

original: de dag phan tshun 'dren pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun 'dren pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are drawn in mutually.

original: rgya mtsho mu med pa'i dpe des de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgya mtsho mu med pa'i dpe des de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “just as” is by the example of the boundless ocean.

original: 'di ni zag pa med pa'i chos sems kyi skad cig gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa ste dang po'i //
analyzed: 'di ni zag pa med pa'i chos sems kyi skad cig gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa ste dang po'i //
translated: This is the first moment of the uncontaminated Dharma realization.

original: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: With regard to the second moment, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: gang tshe chos dkar thams cad kyi /
analyzed: gang tshe chos dkar thams cad kyi /
translated: When all virtuous dharmas

original: rang bzhin shes rab pha rol phyin //
analyzed: rang bzhin shes rab pha rol phyin //
translated: are the nature of the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam smin chos nyid gnas skabs skyes /
analyzed: rnam smin chos nyid gnas skabs skyes /
translated: the dharmatā of the fully ripened state arises,

original: de yi skad cig gcig ye shes //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de yi skad cig gcig ye shes // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: that is the wisdom of a single moment.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i chos ni rnam smin gyi chos so //🔽de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i chos ni rnam smin gyi chos so // de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: The dharmas that arise from fully ripened karmic seeds are the dharmas of full ripening.🔽The state of that is just that.

original: de'i gnas skabs 'del yod pa de la @200b de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs 'del yod pa de la @200b de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The state of that is the present.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos dkar thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad dang // gang dag zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad 'dis sngon ngo bo nyid med par bsgoms pas /
analyzed: chos dkar thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad dang // gang dag zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad 'dis sngon ngo bo nyid med par bsgoms pas /
translated: All wholesome dharmas refers to all wholesome dharmas, and also to all defiled and undefiled dharmas, which are cultivated by this perfection of wisdom as being without an own-being.

original: de dag kyang phyis rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang phyis rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: And later on, they are born from the maturation of karma.

original: des na rang bzhin nyid kyis de dag ngo bo nyid med par yang dag par rig ste /
analyzed: des na rang bzhin nyid kyis de dag ngo bo nyid med par yang dag par rig ste /
translated: Therefore, one knows them to be essentially without an own-being by their very nature.

original: de'i phyir dkar po thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dkar po thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the nature of all wholesome dharmas.

original: 'di lta bu de gang gi tshe skyes pa ni phun gsum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta bu de gang gi tshe skyes pa ni phun gsum tshogs pa ste /
translated: When this is born, it is the perfection of all perfections.

original: de'i tshe sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis de dag thams cad la lhun gyis grub par shes so //
analyzed: de'i tshe sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis de dag thams cad la lhun gyis grub par shes so //
translated: At that time, one knows all of them spontaneously in a single moment of thought.

original: zag pa med pa thams cad la 'bad pa dang bcas pa 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa thams cad la 'bad pa dang bcas pa 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first, which is accompanied by effort with regard to all undefiled dharmas.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa la lhun gyis grub pa ni gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa la lhun gyis grub pa ni gnyis pa ste /
translated: The second is the spontaneous perfection of both defiled and undefiled dharmas.

original: de'i phyir mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las /
translated: Therefore, a sutra declares:

original: nam mkha' mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nam mkha' mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “One should understand that the perfection of wisdom is limitless because space is limitless.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs dang / dkar po'i chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang rnam par smin pa'i chos nyid kyi gnas skabs dang / dkar po'i chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the reality of the maturation of the wholesome dharmas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mu med pa ni de dag thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid med par ro gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mu med pa ni de dag thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid med par ro gcig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is limitless because all of them are of one taste in the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: lhun gyis grub pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: It is spontaneous because it is born from the maturation of the wholesome dharmas.

original: de'i mu med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mu med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is limitless because of that.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: nam mkha' mu med pa nyid kyi dpes gsungs so //
analyzed: nam mkha' mu med pa nyid kyi dpes gsungs so //
translated: It is taught by the example of the limitless space.

original: nam mkha' ni nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni nam mkha' ste /
translated: Space is space.

original: de'i gzugs kyi rdzas kyi dngos po med par gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gzugs kyi rdzas kyi dngos po med par gcig pa'o //
translated: It is one in the absence of the substance of form.

original: mu med pa ni lhun gyis grub pa ste /
analyzed: mu med pa ni lhun gyis grub pa ste /
translated: It is limitless because it is spontaneous.

original: g-yo ba med pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'o //
translated: It is unmoving.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga mu med pa ji lta bu 'di ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dkar po'i chos thams cad sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga mu med pa ji lta bu 'di ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dkar po'i chos thams cad sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the second is the realization of all virtuous qualities born of evolution in a single moment of mind.

original: gsungs pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: gsungs pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: In consideration of this, the treatise states:

original: sbyin la sogs pa'i spyod pa yis //🔽chos kun rmi lam 'drar gnas nas //
analyzed: sbyin la sogs pa'i spyod pa yis // chos kun rmi lam 'drar gnas nas //
translated: By the practice of generosity and so on,

original: chas rnams mtshan nyid med pa nyid //
analyzed: chas rnams mtshan nyid med pa nyid //
translated: while abiding in the dream-like nature of all phenomena,🔽the characteristics of all phenomena

original: skad cig ma ni gcig gis rtogs //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba nas /🔽dri za'i grong khyer zhes bya ba'i bar ni yum chen mo /
analyzed: skad cig ma ni gcig gis rtogs // zhes bya ba gsungs te / rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba nas / dri za'i grong khyer zhes bya ba'i bar ni yum chen mo /
translated: are realized in a single moment.

original: @201a * // las gsungs pa /
analyzed: @201a * // las gsungs pa /
translated: The passage from “dream-like” up to “like a gandharva city” is stated in the Great Mother.

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise states:

original: tshig gcig smos pa ni thams cad gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gcig smos pa ni thams cad gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The mention of a single word is because all are of the same nature.

original: de yang don rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de yang don rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: Moreover, it is due to the characteristic of various meanings.

original: 'di dag so sor snang ba ni ji lta bu'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag so sor snang ba ni ji lta bu'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: They appear individually, but because they do not have any characteristics, they are without characteristics.

original: des na sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: des na sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa la gnas nas /
translated: Therefore, because they are like an illusion, all phenomena are without characteristics.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
translated: Abiding in that, they complete the six perfections.

original: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par skad cig ma gcig gis rtogs shing shes te /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par skad cig ma gcig gis rtogs shing shes te /
translated: In a single instant, they realize and understand that all phenomena are without characteristics.

original: khams kyi don ni sna tshogs pa nyid kyis na rtogs pa'i don ni shes pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: khams kyi don ni sna tshogs pa nyid kyis na rtogs pa'i don ni shes pa la 'jug go //
translated: The meaning of realm is the meaning of diversity, and the meaning of realization is the meaning of cognition.

original: 'di ltar ri rab sna tshogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar ri rab sna tshogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because Mount Meru is diverse,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sna tshogs pa nyid du rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sna tshogs pa nyid du rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom should be understood to be diverse.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par gang ro gcig par shes pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par gang ro gcig par shes pa 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The single taste of all phenomena, which are like an illusion and without characteristics, is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir ro gcig pa yin yang gang chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba 'di ni ri rab sna tshogs pa nyid kyi dpes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ro gcig pa yin yang gang chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba 'di ni ri rab sna tshogs pa nyid kyi dpes rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, although there is one taste, this appearance of all phenomena as various illusions should be understood by the example of the various aspects of Mount Meru.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' gzugs med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' gzugs med pa'i phyir yod pa ma yin yang /
translated: Just as space, because it is formless, does not exist,

original: ri rab kyi rnam pa sna tshogs su bstan te /
analyzed: ri rab kyi rnam pa sna tshogs su bstan te /
translated: it is taught to have various aspects, such as Mount Meru.

original: ri rab kyi logs bzhi'i kha dog gi phyogs kyang de dang 'dra ba'i kha dog tu snang ste /
analyzed: ri rab kyi logs bzhi'i kha dog gi phyogs kyang de dang 'dra ba'i kha dog tu snang ste /
translated: The colors of the four sides of Mount Meru appear as those colors.

original: de ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin no //
translated: That is just like that.

original: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par sems kyi skad cig gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par sems kyi skad cig gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The realization in one moment of mind of all phenomena as lacking a characteristic is the third.

original: bzhi pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bzhi pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the fourth,

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: the treatise states:

original: rmi lam dang ni de mthong nyid //
analyzed: rmi lam dang ni de mthong nyid //
translated: Just as a dream and the one who sees it

original: gnyis kyi tshul du mi mthong ltar //🔽chos rnams gnyis su med pa yi //
analyzed: gnyis kyi tshul du mi mthong ltar // chos rnams gnyis su med pa yi //
translated: are not seen in a dualistic manner,🔽in one moment

original: de nyid skad cig gcig gis mthong //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid skad cig gcig gis mthong //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the reality of nondual phenomena is seen.

original: gsum pa la ni chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu'i rnam par so sor snang ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu'i rnam par so sor snang ba'o //
translated: In the third, all phenomena appear as dreams.

original: bzhi pa la ni de dag nub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni de dag nub pa'i phyir /
translated: In the fourth,

original: ston ka'i nyi ma phyed kyi nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bslad pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ston ka'i nyi ma phyed kyi nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bslad pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: they disappear, like the sky at noon in autumn, free from all pollution.

original: de la rmi lam du mthong ba ni mi dang glang po dang / rta la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la rmi lam du mthong ba ni mi dang glang po dang / rta la sogs pa ste /
translated: In the dream, one sees men, elephants, horses, etc.

original: rmi lam mo //
analyzed: rmi lam mo //
translated: The dream is the object.

original: de mthong ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de mthong ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: Seeing it is seeing it for oneself.

original: de dag nub pa'i phyir gang de dag mi mthong ba ni gnyis kyi tshul du tha dad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nub pa'i phyir gang de dag mi mthong ba ni gnyis kyi tshul du tha dad pa med pa'o //
translated: The disappearance of those is the non-existence of the duality, since one does not see them.

original: de ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis @201b med pa'i stong pa ste /
analyzed: de ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis @201b med pa'i stong pa ste /
translated: That is the emptiness of the duality of object and subject.

original: chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid don dam pa skad cig ma gcig gis mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid don dam pa skad cig ma gcig gis mthong ba'o //
translated: The reality of phenomena, the ultimate, is seen in a single moment.

original: de nyid gzugs mu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid gzugs mu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: That is stated in the line “because form is limitless,” and so forth.

original: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: Here, the perfection of wisdom is the fourth, the clear realization in one moment.

original: de'i mu med pa nyid ni chos thams cad don dam pa dri ma med pa'i nam mkha' kho na ltar des yang dag par rig pas na /
analyzed: de'i mu med pa nyid ni chos thams cad don dam pa dri ma med pa'i nam mkha' kho na ltar des yang dag par rig pas na /
translated: Its infinity is because all phenomena are just the stainless space of ultimate reality, which is known by that.

original: de rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known in that way.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: gzugs la sogs pa mu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is because form, etc. are infinite.

original: ji ltar de dag mu med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag mu med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they infinite?

original: gnyis su snang ba nub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnyis su snang ba nub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the appearance of duality has subsided.

original: ji srid du 'di mu yod pa de srid du ni gzhan gyi mtshan ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji srid du 'di mu yod pa de srid du ni gzhan gyi mtshan ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As long as it has a limit, it is the sign of another.

original: gzugs dang de'i 'dzin pa dag nub kyang mu med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang de'i 'dzin pa dag nub kyang mu med pa ma yin te /
translated: Even when form and its apprehension have subsided, it is not without limit.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs nyid ces gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs nyid ces gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn't it said that it is form itself?

original: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du gsungs pas so //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du gsungs pas so //
translated: Indeed, but it is said that it is from form up to consciousness.

original: de lta mod kyi 'dzin pa zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'dzin pa zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn't it said that grasping?

original: ma yin te der yang phung po nyid bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma yin te der yang phung po nyid bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: No, because even there the aggregates are included,

original: snang ba med par 'dzin pa'i bdag mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba med par 'dzin pa'i bdag mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not reasonable for a self to grasp without appearances.

original: chos thams cad gnyis su med par sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad gnyis su med par sems kyi skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The realization of all dharmas in a single moment of mind without duality is the fourth.

original: skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa ste bdun pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par rtogs pa ste bdun pa'o //
translated: Realization in a single moment is the seventh.

original: mngon par rtogs pa brgyad pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa brgyad pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The eighth realization is the dharmakaya.

original: de'i dngos po yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i dngos po yang bzhi ste /
translated: Its entities are also four:

original: sku gsum dang mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsum dang mdzad pa'o //
translated: the three kayas and deeds.

original: de ltar sngar /
analyzed: de ltar sngar /
translated: As such, previously:🔽The svabhavikakaya, the sambhogakaya,🔽and likewise the other, the nirmanakaya,

original: ngo bo nyid longs rdzogs bcas dang // de bzhin gzhan ni sprul ba dang // chos sku mdzad par bcas pa ste //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid longs rdzogs bcas dang // de bzhin gzhan ni sprul ba dang // chos sku mdzad par bcas pa ste //
translated: the dharmakaya, and deeds,

original: rnam pa bzhir ni yang dag brjod //🔽ces gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir ni yang dag brjod // ces gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: are expressed as the four aspects.

original: chos ni lam ste /
analyzed: chos ni lam ste /
translated: Dharma is the path,

original: de yang 'dir khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang 'dir khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir /
translated: and that is also here because of the progress of distinctions.

original: skabs kyi mngon par rtogs pa bdun gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: skabs kyi mngon par rtogs pa bdun gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the definition of the seven realizations in this context.

original: de na chos kyis thob pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: de na chos kyis thob pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The body that is attained through the Dharma is the Dharma body.

original: sku ni lus so //
analyzed: sku ni lus so //
translated: Body means physical form.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi lus gsum ni sku gsum mo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi lus gsum ni sku gsum mo //
translated: The three bodies of the Buddhas are the three bodies.

original: bcom ldan 'das yum chen mo las rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yum chen mo las rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa /
translated: In the Great Mother of the Victorious Ones, it is said:

original: zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa dgra @202a * //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra @202a * //
translated: “The nature of all the uncontaminated phenomena, which are completely pure in every respect,

original: bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su rig par bya'o //
translated: is the Thus-Gone One, the Foe-Destroyer, the Completely Perfect Buddha.”

original: gzhan yang chos de dag nyid rtogs pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos de dag nyid rtogs pas /
translated: Moreover, through the realization of these very phenomena,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir /
translated: because of the complete and perfect awakening to unsurpassed, complete, and perfect enlightenment,

original: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pa'i sku /
analyzed: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pa'i sku /
translated: the body is adorned with the thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la theg pa'i mchog gi chos bla na med pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / rab tu dga' ba'i bde ba la longs spyad par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la theg pa'i mchog gi chos bla na med pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / rab tu dga' ba'i bde ba la longs spyad par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One teaches the Dharma to the bodhisattvas so that they may enjoy the unsurpassed joy, happiness, and delight of the supreme vehicle.

original: gzhan yang chos de dag nyid rtogs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos de dag nyid rtogs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: Moreover, by realizing those very dharmas, they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa sna tshogs kyi sprin gyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag tu dus thams cad du sems can rnams kyi don mdzad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa sna tshogs kyi sprin gyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag tu dus thams cad du sems can rnams kyi don mdzad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One performs the welfare of sentient beings in the limitless, boundless world systems of the ten directions at all times through the clouds of various emanations.

original: mdo sde rgyan las /🔽sku gsum dag gis sangs rgyas kyi //
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan las / sku gsum dag gis sangs rgyas kyi //
translated: In the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, it says:🔽The bodies of the buddhas

original: sku bsdus par ni shes bya ste //
analyzed: sku bsdus par ni shes bya ste //
translated: should be understood as being included in the three bodies.

original: sku gsung dag gis rang gzhan gyi //
analyzed: sku gsung dag gis rang gzhan gyi //
translated: The meaning of self and other is shown by the three bodies,

original: don 'di rten dang bcas par bstan //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don 'di rten dang bcas par bstan // zhes gsungs so //
translated: together with their support.

original: de bas na sku gsum dang / mdzad pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bzhi ni chos kyi sku bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na sku gsum dang / mdzad pa'i dbye bas rnam pa bzhi ni chos kyi sku bstan te /
translated: Thus, the Dharma Body is fourfold, according to the division of the three bodies and the four activities.

original: de la ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid kho na ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid ni rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid kho na ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Here, the essence is the nature, and the essence itself is the essence body.

original: yang na de nyid la ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba'i rnam par dag pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'o //
analyzed: yang na de nyid la ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba'i rnam par dag pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'o //
translated: Or, the perfection of the highest purity which is the cause of the essence is the essence body.🔽The enjoyment body is the body which is the support for the enjoyment of the Great Vehicle teachings.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i don du 'gyur ba yin pas /🔽longs spyod rdzogs bcas so //🔽sprul pa ni sprul pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i don du 'gyur ba yin pas / longs spyod rdzogs bcas so // sprul pa ni sprul pa'o //
translated: It is the enjoyment body because it is the cause of enjoyment.🔽The emanation body is the body which is the support for the emanations.

original: der grub pa'i sku ni sprul pa nyid do //
analyzed: der grub pa'i sku ni sprul pa nyid do //
translated: The emanation body is the body which is the support for the emanations.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Here, in terms of the essence body,

original: bstan bcos las //
analyzed: bstan bcos las //
translated: the treatise states:🔽The essence body of the Sage

original: thub pa'i ngo bo nyid sku ni //
analyzed: thub pa'i ngo bo nyid sku ni //
translated: is the transformation of the basis

original: zag pa med pa'i chos skun du //🔽rnam par dag gyur gang dag yin //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos skun du // rnam par dag gyur gang dag yin //
translated: of the uncontaminated aggregates.

original: de dag rang bzhin mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin mtshan nyid can //
translated: It has the characteristic of nature.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin ni chos nyid de /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin ni chos nyid de /
translated: Their nature is reality.

original: chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
translated: The realm of phenomena is not the Tathagata,

original: shin tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurdity.

original: 'on kyang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: However, the realm of phenomena is pure.

original: @202b de ltar yang sangs rgyas kyi sa las shin tu 'das sangs rgyas kyis ni rnam pa lngas bsdus te /
analyzed: @202b de ltar yang sangs rgyas kyi sa las shin tu 'das sangs rgyas kyis ni rnam pa lngas bsdus te /
translated: Thus, the Buddha stage is summarized in five ways.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes yin no zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes yin no zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: The pure realm of phenomena, mirror-like pristine awareness, the pristine awareness of uniformity, the pristine awareness of individual realization, and the pristine awareness of successful activities.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The pure realm of phenomena is the extremely pure realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / chos nyid tha dad pa gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / chos nyid tha dad pa gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the extremely pure realm of phenomena and reality itself are not different in any way.

original: de'i phyir mdo las nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor mu med par snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor mu med par snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, a sutra declares:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The infinite perfection of wisdom should be understood from the infinite appearance of the orb of the sun’s light.

original: skrag pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon thams cad spangs pa ni shel dag pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: skrag pa nyid la sogs pa'i skyon thams cad spangs pa ni shel dag pa lta bu'o //
translated: Here, the orb of the sun is free from all faults, such as darkness, and is like a pure crystal.

original: de la zla ba dang / nyi ma dag las gzhan pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku'i dpe'o //
analyzed: de la zla ba dang / nyi ma dag las gzhan pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku'i dpe'o //
translated: The moon and sun are examples of the bodies of the disciples and hermit buddhas, which are different from the orb of the sun.

original: zla ba dang / nyi ma shel sgong dag pa lta bu de dag pas 'di lhag pa yin te /
analyzed: zla ba dang / nyi ma shel sgong dag pa lta bu de dag pas 'di lhag pa yin te /
translated: Those two, the moon and sun, are like pure crystal spheres, but this [buddha body] is superior to them.

original: gang gi phyir phyogs bcur 'od zer gyi dra ba spros pa des shes bya'i yul mtha' yas pa dag la shes pa mtha' yas pa skyed pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku'i dpe'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyogs bcur 'od zer gyi dra ba spros pa des shes bya'i yul mtha' yas pa dag la shes pa mtha' yas pa skyed pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i sku'i dpe'o //
translated: The light-web that is emitted in the ten directions is the example of the liberated body of the Buddhas, which generates infinite knowledge in regard to infinite objects of knowledge.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni chos kyi sku zhes kyang brjod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni chos kyi sku zhes kyang brjod de /
translated: For that very reason, it is also called the Dharma Body,

original: gang gi phyir chos mtha' yas pa brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos mtha' yas pa brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the support of infinite dharmas.

original: de ni 'dir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa las skyes ba'i ye shes mtha' yas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa las skyes ba'i ye shes mtha' yas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Here, the infinite knowledge born from the pure Dharma-element is the perfection of wisdom.

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor snang ba'i dpes de ni shes bya mu med pa la snang bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor snang ba'i dpes de ni shes bya mu med pa la snang bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it illuminates the infinite objects of knowledge through the example of the orb of the sun's light.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi dag pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi dag pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: Thus, the purity of the Buddha dharmas is the Dharma-element,

original: nyi ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nyi ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: like the sun.

original: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: And that is the perfection of wisdom.

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the orb of the sun's light rays.

original: gang des mu med par snang ba de la 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor mu med par snang ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gang des mu med par snang ba de la 'od zer gyi dkyil 'khor mu med par snang ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the orb of the sun's light rays appears without limit, so the orb of the buddhas' light rays of gnosis appears without limit.

original: de la 'dis ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de la 'dis ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'o //
translated: Here, the essence of the buddhas' utterly pure expanse of reality is the nature body.

original: de yang shes bya thams cad la shes pa dbang du bya ba dang / de nyid sems can gyi don dbang du byed pa @203a * //
analyzed: de yang shes bya thams cad la shes pa dbang du bya ba dang / de nyid sems can gyi don dbang du byed pa @203a * //
translated: That is the mastery of gnosis with regard to all objects of knowledge, the mastery of that for the benefit of sentient beings,

original: dang / khyab par byed pa dang / rtag pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: dang / khyab par byed pa dang / rtag pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: the pervasiveness and the permanence.

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: In this regard, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge says:

original: rgyu ni yongs su smin gyur nas //
analyzed: rgyu ni yongs su smin gyur nas //
translated: When the cause has fully ripened,

original: gang dang gang la gang dang ni //🔽gang tshe bya ba phan 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang dang gang la gang dang ni // gang tshe bya ba phan 'gyur ba //
translated: whatever, wherever,🔽whenever, and however

original: de dang de la de snang de //
analyzed: de dang de la de snang de //
translated: is beneficial, that appears there.

original: lha yi rgyal pos char phab kyang //
analyzed: lha yi rgyal pos char phab kyang //
translated: Even though the king of gods sends down rain,

original: sa bon mi rung mi 'khrungs ltar //
analyzed: sa bon mi rung mi 'khrungs ltar //
translated: a bad seed will not grow.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni byon gyur kyang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni byon gyur kyang //
translated: Even though the buddhas have come,

original: skal ba med pas bzang mi myong //
analyzed: skal ba med pas bzang mi myong //
translated: The unfortunate do not experience the good.

original: de ltar mdzad pa rgya che'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar mdzad pa rgya che'i phyir //
translated: Because of the vastness of his deeds,

original: sangs rgyas khyab par nges par brjod //
analyzed: sangs rgyas khyab par nges par brjod //
translated: it is said that the Buddha is all-pervading.

original: de nyid zad pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid zad pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the inexhaustibility of that,

original: rtag pa zhes kyang brjod pa yin //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes kyang brjod pa yin //
translated: it is also said to be eternal.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'o //
translated: That is the essential body.

original: snang ngo zhes bya ba ni sprul pa ste bsod nams las so //
analyzed: snang ngo zhes bya ba ni sprul pa ste bsod nams las so //
translated: Appears is the emanation, from merit.

original: gang dang gang zhes bya ba ni de dang de dag ces bya bar rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang zhes bya ba ni de dang de dag ces bya bar rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: Whatever is to be understood as those and those.

original: de dang de zhes bya bas ni phan par byed pa zhes don gyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang de zhes bya bas ni phan par byed pa zhes don gyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Those and those is to be understood by the meaning of benefactor.

original: ci'i phyir de dang de la zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dang de la zhes gsungs she na /
translated: Why is it said to be in those and those?

original: lha'i rgyal pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lha'i rgyal pos zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The king of gods, etc.

original: mdzad pa rgya che ba ni skal ba dang ldan pa thams cad la mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: mdzad pa rgya che ba ni skal ba dang ldan pa thams cad la mdzad pa'o //
translated: The vastness of deeds is the deeds for all the fortunate ones.

original: de nyid kyi mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi mdzad pa ste /
translated: That itself is the deed.

original: 'di nyid ni nyid kyi sku'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni nyid kyi sku'o //
translated: This is the essential body.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la ni brjod par bya ba mang du yod de de la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la ni brjod par bya ba mang du yod de de la longs spyod rdzogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In this regard, it is stated:

original: sgra thams cad mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sgra thams cad mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: “Since all sounds are limitless, the perfection of wisdom should be understood to be limitless.”

original: ston pas bstan nas /
analyzed: ston pas bstan nas /
translated: The Teacher teaches,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mnyan te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mnyan te /
translated: the Bodhisattvas listen,

original: theg pa mchog gi chos yang dag par rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa mchog gi chos yang dag par rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: and the correct realization of the Dharma of the supreme vehicle is here the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa ste /
translated: That itself is the Enjoyment,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the Enjoyment.

original: gang yang mkhas pa rnams kyi yid bde ba'i mtshan nyid chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po ste /
analyzed: gang yang mkhas pa rnams kyi yid bde ba'i mtshan nyid chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po ste /
translated: Moreover, the small, middling, and great characteristics of the mental bliss of the wise

original: dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / rab tu dga' ba'i bde ba nyams su myong bar byed pa de ni dngos kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / rab tu dga' ba'i bde ba nyams su myong bar byed pa de ni dngos kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment of the enjoyment body is the experience of joy, bliss, and delight.

original: de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom of the enjoyment body should be understood as limitless.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sgra thams cad mu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sgra thams cad mu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs gsum pa'o //
translated: Because all sounds are limitless. This is the third reason.

original: gang gi phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa de gnyis dang go rims bzhin du mu med par ston pa'i sgra dang / @203b bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa de gnyis dang go rims bzhin du mu med par ston pa'i sgra dang / @203b bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed par sbyar ro //
translated: Because those two enjoyment bodies are limitless, respectively, the sound that teaches them and the produced and producer are applied.

original: thams cad ces ci'i phyir smes she na gdul bya rnams sna tshogs pa thams cad la snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ces ci'i phyir smes she na gdul bya rnams sna tshogs pa thams cad la snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is everything said? Because it appears to all the various disciples.

original: ji ltar mu med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mu med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it limitless?

original: mtha' ma med par sku des ston pa la dus tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' ma med par sku des ston pa la dus tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the time of teaching by that body is immeasurable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i byang chub kyang mu med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i byang chub kyang mu med pa nyid do //
translated: The perfect enlightenment of the Tathagata is also infinite.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa mu med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mu med par rjes su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom should be known as infinite because of the infinity of the accomplishment of all Buddha-qualities.

original: ji skad du ston pa nyid kyis theg pa chen po'i mchog yang dag par rtags pa ni 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gsungs so //
analyzed: ji skad du ston pa nyid kyis theg pa chen po'i mchog yang dag par rtags pa ni 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par gsungs so //
translated: And the Teacher himself has said that the realization of the supreme vehicle is here the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i mu med pa ni de'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de'i mu med pa ni de'i rgyu ste /
translated: Its infinity is its cause,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos yang dag par sgrub pa mu med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos yang dag par sgrub pa mu med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning the infinity of the accomplishment of all Buddha-qualities.

original: chos de yang bcom ldan 'das yum chen mo las gsungs te /
analyzed: chos de yang bcom ldan 'das yum chen mo las gsungs te /
translated: And that Dharma is taught in the Great Mother of the Buddhas.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang // mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang // mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the thirty-seven factors of awakening, the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, the ten universal bases, the eight bases of subjugation, the meditative stabilization of absence of conflict,

original: smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / dbang bcu dang / stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / bsrung ba med pa gsum dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang /
analyzed: smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / dbang bcu dang / stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / bsrung ba med pa gsum dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang /
translated: the cognition resulting from a resolve, the four correct knowledges, the four purities, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the three closely placed recollections, the three establishments of mindfulness,

original: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: the nature of being without affliction, the complete destruction of the latent tendencies, great compassion, the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos las /
translated: Therefore, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:🔽The factors of enlightenment, immeasurables,

original: byang chub phyogs mthun tshad med dang // rnam par thar dang mthar gyis ni //
analyzed: byang chub phyogs mthun tshad med dang // rnam par thar dang mthar gyis ni //
translated: liberations,🔽the nine serial absorptions,

original: snyoms 'jug dgu yi bdag nyid dang // zad par bcu yi bdag nyid dang // zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ni //
analyzed: snyoms 'jug dgu yi bdag nyid dang // zad par bcu yi bdag nyid dang // zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched ni //
translated: the ten totalities,🔽the eight subjugations,🔽the four specific discernments,

original: rab tu dbye ba rnam brgyad dang // nyon mongs med par smon mkhyen dang // mngon shes so sor yang dag rig //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba rnam brgyad dang // nyon mongs med par smon mkhyen dang // mngon shes so sor yang dag rig //
translated: the four knowledges of thorough liberation,🔽the four correct individual liberations,🔽the four purities in all aspects,🔽the ten powers,🔽the ten powers,

original: rnam pa thams cad dag bzhi dang // dbang bcu dang ni stobs bcu dang // mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi dag dang // bsrung ba med @204a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad dag bzhi dang // dbang bcu dang ni stobs bcu dang // mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi dag dang // bsrung ba med @204a * //
translated: the four fearlessnesses,🔽the three closely placed recollections,🔽the three unmixed states,🔽the three foundations of mindfulness,🔽the nature of nonforgetfulness,

original: pa rnam gsum dang // dran pa nyer gzhag rnam gsum dang // bsnyel ba mi mnga' chos nyid dang // bag chags yang dag bcom pa dang // skye la thugs rje chen po dang // thub pa kho na'i ma 'dres chos //
analyzed: pa rnam gsum dang // dran pa nyer gzhag rnam gsum dang // bsnyel ba mi mnga' chos nyid dang // bag chags yang dag bcom pa dang // skye la thugs rje chen po dang // thub pa kho na'i ma 'dres chos //
translated: the complete destruction of the propensities,🔽great compassion for beings,🔽and the unshared qualities of the Sage🔽are the thirty-four qualities of the Buddha.

original: bco brgyad bshad pa gang yin dang // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid dang // chos kyi sku zhes brjod pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bco brgyad bshad pa gang yin dang // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid dang // chos kyi sku zhes brjod pa yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: are said to be the Dharma Body.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang tshad med pa zhes zlas dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang tshad med pa zhes zlas dbye bar bya'o //
translated: The factors of enlightenment and the immeasurables should be distinguished.

original: mthar gyis zhes bya ba ni 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //🔽bsrung ba med pa zhes bya ba ma yin pa las bsrung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mthar gyis zhes bya ba ni 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o // bsrung ba med pa zhes bya ba ma yin pa las bsrung ba'i phyir /
translated: Gradually should be applied to the following.

original: bsrung ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don te rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bsrung ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don te rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The meaning of absence of protection is threefold: because there is no protection from what is not protected,🔽because there is no protection from what is protected, and because there is no protection from what is not to be protected.

original: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i chos kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i chos kyi tshogs so //
translated: The Dharma Body is the collection of undefiled dharmas of the Buddhas.

original: skabs ji lta ba bzhin du bdag gis mang du bshad de lhag ma yang bdag gis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: skabs ji lta ba bzhin du bdag gis mang du bshad de lhag ma yang bdag gis bshad par bya'o //
translated: I have explained it extensively according to the occasion. I will now explain the rest.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad ces bya ba ni gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba ni kha dog bzang ba dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad ces bya ba ni gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba ni kha dog bzang ba dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The eight liberations are as follows: 1) Perceiving forms internally, one sees external forms. This is the first liberation.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni snga ma bzhin te 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni snga ma bzhin te 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: 2) Not perceiving forms internally, one sees external forms. This is the second.

original: sdug pa'i rnam par thar ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas shing rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa 'di ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam par thar ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas shing rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa 'di ni gsum pa'o //
translated: 3) Having attained the liberation of beauty, one abides in it. This is the third.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa zhes bya ba dang brgyad de /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa zhes bya ba dang brgyad de /
translated: The four formless liberations are the sphere of infinite space, etc. The eighth is the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: 'di dag gis sgrib pa las rnam par grol bas na rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gis sgrib pa las rnam par grol bas na rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: They are called liberations because one is liberated from obscurations through them.

original: de la gsum ni mya ngan las 'das pa la sgrib pa las rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: de la gsum ni mya ngan las 'das pa la sgrib pa las rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: Among them, the first three liberate one from the obscurations to nirvana.

original: lhag ma ni zhi bar gnas pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni zhi bar gnas pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: The rest are liberations from the obscurations to the attainment of tranquil abiding.

original: yang gsum ni gzugs can no //
analyzed: yang gsum ni gzugs can no //
translated: Three are material.

original: lnga ni gzugs can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lnga ni gzugs can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Five are immaterial.

original: brgyad pa ni sgrib pa rab tu zhi pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni sgrib pa rab tu zhi pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the pacification of obscurations.

original: gzugs can ni bdag la gzugs su 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ni bdag la gzugs su 'du shes pa'o //
translated: The material ones are for one who has the perception of form in regard to the self.

original: lta ba ni yid kyis mos shing sprul nas lta ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba ni yid kyis mos shing sprul nas lta ba'o //
translated: The liberation of the view is for one who, having emanated by mental resolve, views.

original: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa ni sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i gzugs de dag sprul nas mi byed pa'i 'du shes thob pas go rims bzhin du mthun pa dang / mi @204b mthun pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa ni sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i gzugs de dag sprul nas mi byed pa'i 'du shes thob pas go rims bzhin du mthun pa dang / mi @204b mthun pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The liberation of the beautiful is for one who, having emanated those forms that are beautiful and not beautiful, obtains the perception of non-making, in order to abandon, respectively, the agreeable and the disagreeable.

original: 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa ni brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa ni brgyad pa ste /
translated: The cessation of perception and feeling is the eighth.

original: sems dang sems las 'byung ba nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyis bsdus pa sngar kun nas ldang ba las de 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las 'byung ba nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyis bsdus pa sngar kun nas ldang ba las de 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of mind and mental factors, which are included in the afflicted mind, from the prior arousal.

original: dmigs pa'i sgom pa zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched sems la gnas pa'i phyir zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched de /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i sgom pa zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched sems la gnas pa'i phyir zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched de /
translated: The bases of mastery are so called because they are the bases for the mastery of meditative concentration that is, the mastery of the meditative absorption of the formless realm and the mastery of the subjugation of the object of observation.

original: de dag ni brgyad do //
analyzed: de dag ni brgyad do //
translated: There are eight of them.

original: de la dang po'i rnam par thar pa las ni gnyis sgrub po //
analyzed: de la dang po'i rnam par thar pa las ni gnyis sgrub po //
translated: The first two liberations are established from the first base of mastery.

original: gnyis pa las kyang gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyis pa las kyang gnyis so //
translated: The second two are established from the second base of mastery.

original: gsum pa las ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: gsum pa las ni bzhi'o //
translated: The third four are established from the third base of mastery.

original: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu la kha dog ngan pa dang / kha dog bzang po dang / dman pa dang / gya nom par lta ba'o //🔽gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes shing /
analyzed: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu la kha dog ngan pa dang / kha dog bzang po dang / dman pa dang / gya nom par lta ba'o // gzugs de dag zil gyis mnan nas shes shing /
translated: The first base of mastery is to have the internal perception of form and to see small external forms with bad color and good color, inferior and excellent.

original: de ltar 'du shes par 'gyur ba 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes par 'gyur ba 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: To see those forms and to know them and to have that perception is the first base of mastery.

original: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen po la kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan par lta zhing de bzhin du shes par 'gyur pa 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chen po la kha dog bzang po dang kha dog ngan par lta zhing de bzhin du shes par 'gyur pa 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second base of mastery is to have the internal perception of form and to see large external forms with good color and bad color and to know them and to have that perception.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu la sogs par lta ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs chung ngu la sogs par lta ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third liberation is to consider that one's own body is formless while seeing small external forms, and so on.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs la chen po la sogs par lta bu ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs la chen po la sogs par lta bu ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth liberation is to consider that one's own body is formless while seeing large external forms, and so on.

original: rnam par thar pa gsum pa las ni bzhi mngon par sgrub po //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum pa las ni bzhi mngon par sgrub po //
translated: The third liberation is the basis for the accomplishment of the fourth.

original: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba ni sngon po //
analyzed: nang gzugs su 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba ni sngon po //
translated: The fifth liberation is to consider that one's own body is formless while seeing external forms, which are blue,

original: kha dog sngon po //🔽sngon por ston pa /
analyzed: kha dog sngon po // sngon por ston pa /
translated: blue in color,

original: sngon pa snang ba /
analyzed: sngon pa snang ba /
translated: blue in appearance,🔽blue in hue.

original: dper na zar ma'i me tog gam //
analyzed: dper na zar ma'i me tog gam //
translated: For example, it is like the flower of flax

original: yul b'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa sngon po //
analyzed: yul b'a r'a na s'i'i ras phun sum tshogs pa sngon po //
translated: or like the color of the excellent cloth of Vārāṇasī, which is blue,

original: kha dog sngon po /🔽sngon por ston pa /
analyzed: kha dog sngon po / sngon por ston pa /
translated: blue in color,

original: sngon por snang ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: sngon por snang ba de bzhin du /
translated: blue in appearance,🔽blue in hue.

original: gzugs de dag kyang zil gyis mnan nas /
analyzed: gzugs de dag kyang zil gyis mnan nas /
translated: Having overcome material forms,

original: de ltar 'du shes par 'gyur zhing lta ba 'di ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes par 'gyur zhing lta ba 'di ni lnga pa'o //
translated: one sees these forms and has this perception. This is the fifth liberation.

original: de bzhin du ser po la sogs pa ni dper na dong ka'i mi tog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ser po la sogs pa ni dper na dong ka'i mi tog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni drug pa'o //
translated: Likewise, yellow, etc.🔽The sixth is like the flower of the kimshuka tree, etc.

original: de bzhin du dmar po la sogs pa ni dper na pan du dzi ba ka'i me tog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bdun pa'o //🔽de bzhin du dkar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du dmar po la sogs pa ni dper na pan du dzi ba ka'i me tog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bdun pa'o // de bzhin du dkar po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The seventh is like the bandhujivaka flower, etc.

original: dper na skar ma pa ba sangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brgyad pa'o //🔽de la chung @205a * //
analyzed: dper na skar ma pa ba sangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brgyad pa'o // de la chung @205a * //
translated: The eighth is like the moon, etc.

original: du zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi grangs su ston pa yin te /
analyzed: du zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi grangs su ston pa yin te /
translated: Among them, small means that it is shown to be a number of sentient beings.

original: tshad chung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad chung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a small measure.

original: kha dog bzang po dang / ngan pa ni sdug ba dang / mi sdug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog bzang po dang / ngan pa ni sdug ba dang / mi sdug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Good color and bad color are due to beauty and unattractiveness.

original: dman pa dang / gya nom pa ni lha la yod pa dang / mi la yod pa'o //🔽rnam par thar pa de dag la mos par byas nas /
analyzed: dman pa dang / gya nom pa ni lha la yod pa dang / mi la yod pa'o // rnam par thar pa de dag la mos par byas nas /
translated: Inferior and excellent are those of the gods and humans, respectively.🔽Having become absorbed in those liberations,

original: zil gyis mnan pa'i skye mched kyis zil gyis gnon par byed do //
analyzed: zil gyis mnan pa'i skye mched kyis zil gyis gnon par byed do //
translated: one should practice the subjugations.

original: yang dang yang du mi mthong zhing mi snang bar byas pa'i phyir zil gyis gnon pa'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du mi mthong zhing mi snang bar byas pa'i phyir zil gyis gnon pa'o //
translated: They are overcome because they are not seen again and again, and do not appear.

original: shes pa ni zhi gnas kyis so //
analyzed: shes pa ni zhi gnas kyis so //
translated: Knowledge is through serenity.

original: mthong ba ni lhag mthong gis so //
analyzed: mthong ba ni lhag mthong gis so //
translated: Seeing is through transcendent insight.

original: de ltar 'du shes par 'gyur ba ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes par 'gyur ba ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They become aware of this because they are free from the conceit of self.

original: chen po ni sems can ma yin par ston pa ste /
analyzed: chen po ni sems can ma yin par ston pa ste /
translated: The great ones are the non-sentient things.

original: de dag ni khyim dang gzhal med khang dang / ri la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni khyim dang gzhal med khang dang / ri la sogs pa ste /
translated: They are houses, palaces, mountains, etc.

original: tshad chen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad chen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are great because of their great size.

original: sngon po zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: Blue is the teaching.

original: lhag ma ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The rest is the explanation.

original: kha dog sngon po zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i kha dog go //🔽sngon por ston pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i kha dog go //
analyzed: kha dog sngon po zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i kha dog go // sngon por ston pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i kha dog go //
translated: Blue color is the innate color.

original: sngon por snang ba ni gnyi ga'i kha dog tu snang ba'o //
analyzed: sngon por snang ba ni gnyi ga'i kha dog tu snang ba'o //
translated: Blue appearance is the color of both.

original: aom ma ka ni zar ma'o //
analyzed: aom ma ka ni zar ma'o //
translated: Om makani means sapphire.

original: kar ma ka ni dong ka'o //
analyzed: kar ma ka ni dong ka'o //
translated: Karmakani means emerald.

original: ban du dzi ba ka ni pan du ka'o //
analyzed: ban du dzi ba ka ni pan du ka'o //
translated: Bandhujīvaka is Bandhumat.

original: pa ba sangs ni thor sa shar ba'i skar ma'o //🔽zad par bcu'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: pa ba sangs ni thor sa shar ba'i skar ma'o // zad par bcu'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: Pāṇḍara is the star of the Pleiades.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched kyis zil gyis mnan nas /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched kyis zil gyis mnan nas /
translated: The ten spheres of totality are called spheres of totality because they make all things such as earth their objects and pervade them.

original: sa la sogs pa thams cad kun du khyab bar byas pa'i phyir zad par gyi skye mched ces brjod do //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa thams cad kun du khyab bar byas pa'i phyir zad par gyi skye mched ces brjod do //
translated: They are called spheres of totality because they make all things such as earth their objects and pervade them.

original: kha cig ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched de ni zad par gyi skye mched du brjod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched de ni zad par gyi skye mched du brjod do //
translated: Some say that the spheres of mastery are called spheres of totality because they pervade all things such as earth.

original: kha cig ni sa la sogs pa dag gis khyad par du ston te /🔽zad par sa dang / zad par sa dang / zad par me dang / zad par rlung dang / zad par sngon po dang / zad par ser po dang / zad par dmar po dang / zad par dkar po dang / zad par nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang /
analyzed: kha cig ni sa la sogs pa dag gis khyad par du ston te / zad par sa dang / zad par sa dang / zad par me dang / zad par rlung dang / zad par sngon po dang / zad par ser po dang / zad par dmar po dang / zad par dkar po dang / zad par nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang /
translated: Others say that they are taught as spheres of totality because they are distinguished by earth and so on.

original: zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do //
analyzed: zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do //
