translated: The ten spheres of totality are the totality of earth, the totality of water, the totality of fire, the totality of wind, the totality of blue, the totality of yellow, the totality of red, the totality of white, the totality of the sphere of infinite space, and the totality of the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: rnam pa thams cad dag pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni rten yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / thugs yongs su dag pa dang / ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad dag pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni rten yongs su dag pa dang / dmigs pa yongs su dag pa dang / thugs yongs su dag pa dang / ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The four purities are the purity of the support, the purity of the object, the purity of mind, and the purity of wisdom.

original: de la bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i @205b phyogs rnams kyi gnas ngan len rten las gtan du bral zhing rang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du skye ba dang / gnag du gnas pa dang 'chi 'pho la dbang bsgyur ba'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i rten yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: de la bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i @205b phyogs rnams kyi gnas ngan len rten las gtan du bral zhing rang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du skye ba dang / gnag du gnas pa dang 'chi 'pho la dbang bsgyur ba'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i rten yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of the support is the support that is completely purified, free from the negative reflex actions of the side of affliction together with their traces, and that has mastery over all the aspects of birth, abiding, and death, just as one wishes.

original: sprul pa dang / yongs su bsgyur ba dang / dmigs pa thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du dbang bsgyur ba ni dmigs pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa dang / yongs su bsgyur ba dang / dmigs pa thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du dbang bsgyur ba ni dmigs pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of the object is the mastery over all the aspects of all emanations, transformations, and objects.

original: snga ma bzhin du sems kyi gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sems kyi gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas /
translated: The purity of mind is the mind that is completely purified, free from all the negative reflex actions of mind, just as before.🔽The purity of wisdom is the wisdom that is completely purified, free from all the negative reflex actions of wisdom.

original: sems la rnam pa thams cad du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba ni /
analyzed: sems la rnam pa thams cad du dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba ni /
translated: The increase of the roots of virtue in every way in the mind

original: rnam pa thams cad du thugs yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du thugs yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: is the complete purity of the mind.

original: snga ma bzhin du ma rig pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral pas shes pa dang shes bya thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba ni rnam pa thams cad kyi ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ma rig pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral pas shes pa dang shes bya thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba ni rnam pa thams cad kyi ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: And the mastery of all cognition and the objects of cognition, due to being free from all the negative tendencies of the side of ignorance, as before, is the complete purity of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: dbang bcu ni bcu la dbang ba ste /
analyzed: dbang bcu ni bcu la dbang ba ste /
translated: The ten masteries are mastery over ten things.

original: tshe la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod par tshe la gnas pa dang spang ba la'o //
analyzed: tshe la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod par tshe la gnas pa dang spang ba la'o //
translated: Mastery over life is mastery over remaining in life and abandoning it for as long as one wishes.

original: sems la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod par bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod par bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mastery over mind is mastery over meditative concentration, entering meditative equipoise as one wishes.

original: yo byad la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod bar 'tshog chas nye bar gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yo byad la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod bar 'tshog chas nye bar gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mastery over equipment is mastery over the presence of necessities as one wishes.

original: las la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod par lus dang ngag gi las grub pa'o //
analyzed: las la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod par lus dang ngag gi las grub pa'o //
translated: Mastery over action is mastery over accomplishing physical and verbal actions as one wishes.🔽Mastery over birth is mastery over taking birth in any way one wishes.

original: skye ba la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa rnams su skye par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa rnams su skye par byed pa'o //
translated: Mastery of birth is the ability to be born in any way one wishes.

original: rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: Mastery of magical powers is the ability to manifest any of the higher perceptions as one wishes.

original: smon lam la dbang ba ni smon lam thams cad yang dag par 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam la dbang ba ni smon lam thams cad yang dag par 'byor pa'o //
translated: Mastery of vows is the ability to fulfill all vows.

original: mos pa la dbang ba ni gang ji ltar mos pa de bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mos pa la dbang ba ni gang ji ltar mos pa de bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Mastery of aspiration is the ability to transform anything into anything else, as one aspires.

original: ye shes la dbang ba ni gang kho na shes par 'dod pa de nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes la dbang ba ni gang kho na shes par 'dod pa de nyid shes pa'o //
translated: Mastery of knowledge is the ability to know anything one wishes to know.

original: chos la dbang ba ni mdo la sogs pa chos rnam par 'jig pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: chos la dbang ba ni mdo la sogs pa chos rnam par 'jig pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Mastery of the teaching is the ability to analyze the Dharma of the scriptures and so on.

original: bsrung ba med pa gsum na de bzhin gshegs pa ni sku'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: bsrung ba med pa gsum na de bzhin gshegs pa ni sku'i spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The three fearlessnesss are as follows. The Tathagata is completely pure in his physical behavior.

original: de la yongs su ma dag pa ni sku'i spyod pa mi mnga' bas /
analyzed: de la yongs su ma dag pa ni sku'i spyod pa mi mnga' bas /
translated: He has no impure physical behavior.

original: gzhan la las shes su 'ong ngo zhes bcas pa'i dgongs pa gang yang mi mnga' ba 'di ni bsrung ba med pa dang po'o //
analyzed: gzhan la las shes su 'ong ngo zhes bcas pa'i dgongs pa gang yang mi mnga' ba 'di ni bsrung ba med pa dang po'o //
translated: He has no intention of thinking, “Let others know this about me” and so on. This is the first fearlessness.

original: de bzhin du gsung gi phrin las ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung gi phrin las ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the activity of speech is the second.

original: de bzhin du thugs kyi phrin las ni gsum pa'o //🔽dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum ni ji ltar @206a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du thugs kyi phrin las ni gsum pa'o // dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum ni ji ltar @206a * //
translated: Likewise, the activity of mind is the third.

original: mdo las gsungs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pa bzhin te /
translated: The three establishments of mindfulness are as stated in the sutra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa na /
translated: When the Tathagata teaches the Dharma,

original: gcig tu gus par nyan cing brtun te /
analyzed: gcig tu gus par nyan cing brtun te /
translated: if one listens respectfully,

original: bka' sems la nye bar 'jog cing /
analyzed: bka' sems la nye bar 'jog cing /
translated: with a mind that is focused on the teachings,

original: chos kyi rjes su chos nye bar sgrub pa na /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su chos nye bar sgrub pa na /
translated: and practices the Dharma in accordance with the teachings,🔽the Tathagata will not be pleased or delighted,

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur thugs yeng yeng por mi 'gyur ba dang / gzhan dag gus par mi nyen cing /
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur thugs yeng yeng por mi 'gyur ba dang / gzhan dag gus par mi nyen cing /
translated: and if others do not listen respectfully,

original: rna ba'i 'dud pa la sogs pa la des de bzhin gshegs pa thugs khong khro bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dud pa la sogs pa la des de bzhin gshegs pa thugs khong khro bar mi 'gyur /
translated: with ears perked up, the Tathagata will not be displeased,

original: mi bzod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mi bzod par mi 'gyur /
translated: unhappy, or dissatisfied.

original: thugs mi mnyes par mi 'gyur ba dang / gcig tu gus par nyan pa dang gcig tu gus par mi nyan pa de dag la des de bzhin gshegs pa de dag dgyes pa'am /
analyzed: thugs mi mnyes par mi 'gyur ba dang / gcig tu gus par nyan pa dang gcig tu gus par mi nyan pa de dag la des de bzhin gshegs pa de dag dgyes pa'am /
translated: Whether they listen respectfully or not, the Tathagata will not be pleased or

original: khong khro ba gnyis su mi 'gyur bar thams cad du dran pa dang / shes bzhin du ldan pas btang snyoms su bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: khong khro ba gnyis su mi 'gyur bar thams cad du dran pa dang / shes bzhin du ldan pas btang snyoms su bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He is equanimous, because he is mindful and vigilant, and because he is not agitated by anger or attachment.

original: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sems can gyi don mdzad pa la dus las mi 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba'i chos nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sems can gyi don mdzad pa la dus las mi 'da' ba ste /
translated: The nature of being without forgetfulness means that the buddhas do not pass beyond the time for acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni bya ba'i mdzad pa gzhan mi mnga' bar rig pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di ni bya ba'i mdzad pa gzhan mi mnga' bar rig pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, it should be understood that he has no other activity than this.

original: bag chags yang dag par bcom pa ni gang nyon mongs pa spangs kyang ma spangs pa ltar spyod pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: bag chags yang dag par bcom pa ni gang nyon mongs pa spangs kyang ma spangs pa ltar spyod pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags so //
translated: The complete destruction of the propensities means that even though he has abandoned the afflictions, he acts as if he has not, because he has the propensities of the afflictions.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa la mi mnga' ste /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have these.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das ni bag chags yang dag par bcom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das ni bag chags yang dag par bcom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat is said to have completely destroyed the propensities.

original: thugs rje chen po ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar dus thams cad du phan pa'i dgongs pas 'jig rten la lan drug tu gzigs pa ste su ni nyams /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar dus thams cad du phan pa'i dgongs pas 'jig rten la lan drug tu gzigs pa ste su ni nyams /
translated: Great compassion means that the Bhagavat, with a mind of benefit, looks upon the world six times each day and night, thinking, “Who is deteriorating?

original: su ni 'phel zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: su ni 'phel zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Who is increasing?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi dbye ba mtha' yas pa mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi dbye ba mtha' yas pa mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Omniscience means the knowledge of the infinite varieties of natures and distinctions of all phenomena.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa la sogs pa'o //🔽'dir ni rtsod pa'i rgyu'i nyon mongs pa la nyon mongs pa 'di dag gis bdag la dmigs nas nyon mongs pa skye bar mi 'gyur bar /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa la sogs pa'o // 'dir ni rtsod pa'i rgyu'i nyon mongs pa la nyon mongs pa 'di dag gis bdag la dmigs nas nyon mongs pa skye bar mi 'gyur bar /
translated: Afflictions are quarrels, disputes, and so on.🔽Here, afflictions are the causes of disputes.

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the meditative absorption that one enters in order to prevent the arising of afflictions that focus on oneself.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan dag gi grong la sogs par 'jug pa na bdag la dmigs nas de dag gi nyon mongs pa mi skye ba ni nyan thos la yang yod /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan dag gi grong la sogs par 'jug pa na bdag la dmigs nas de dag gi nyon mongs pa mi skye ba ni nyan thos la yang yod /
translated: Because when others enter a town and so on, their afflictions do not arise by focusing on oneself.

original: sangs rgyas la yang @206b yod /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la yang @206b yod /
translated: This is also the case for śrāvakas and buddhas.

original: de ni thun mong yin no //
analyzed: de ni thun mong yin no //
translated: This is the common case.

original: de dag gi mdzad pa'i khyad par de'i ting nge 'dzin de dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de dag gi mdzad pa'i khyad par de'i ting nge 'dzin de dbang du byas nas /
translated: The distinctive activity of buddhas is that, on the basis of that meditative absorption,

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: nyan thos nyon mongs med pa'i lha //
analyzed: nyan thos nyon mongs med pa'i lha //
translated: Sravakas have knowledge without affliction

original: mi yi nyon mongs spong nyid dang // rgyal ba'i grong sogs de dag gi //
analyzed: mi yi nyon mongs spong nyid dang // rgyal ba'i grong sogs de dag gi //
translated: With regard to humans,

original: nyon mongs rgyun gcod nyon mongs med //
analyzed: nyon mongs rgyun gcod nyon mongs med //
translated: and the Conqueror has knowledge without affliction

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /🔽nyan thos kyi nyon mongs pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mthong ba spong bar byed de /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te / nyan thos kyi nyon mongs pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mthong ba spong bar byed de /
translated: With regard to the afflictions of those in the villages and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa mngon sum du spong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mngon sum du spong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The sravakas have knowledge without affliction with regard to the cause of affliction, but they do not abandon affliction through direct perception.

original: bde bar gshegs pas ni sngar bshad pa'i nyon mongs pas rgyun bcad pa'i phyir yin gyi mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas ni sngar bshad pa'i nyon mongs pas rgyun bcad pa'i phyir yin gyi mthong ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The Sugata has knowledge without affliction with regard to the cessation of the continuum of affliction, but not with regard to direct perception.🔽This is the meaning.

original: 'jig rten gyi spyod pa la sogs pa 'di shes par bya'o zhes smos pa byas nas snyoms par zhugs te shes pa bskyed pa de ni nyan thos kyi smon nas shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi spyod pa la sogs pa 'di shes par bya'o zhes smos pa byas nas snyoms par zhugs te shes pa bskyed pa de ni nyan thos kyi smon nas shes pa'o //
translated: The sravakas have knowledge through prayer with regard to the knowledge of the world, such as the knowledge that one should engage in this conduct in the world.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: With regard to the Tathagata, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: sangs rgyas smon nas mkhyen pa ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas smon nas mkhyen pa ni //
translated: The Buddha has knowledge through prayer

original: lhun gyis grub dang chags spangs dang // thogs pa med dang rtag gnas dang // 'dri ba kun len 'debs par bzhed //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub dang chags spangs dang // thogs pa med dang rtag gnas dang // 'dri ba kun len 'debs par bzhed //
translated: Spontaneous, free of attachment,🔽unimpeded, always in even meditation,

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he is accepted as the one who answers all questions.

original: lhun gyis grub pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Spontaneous, because of nonconceptuality.

original: thogs pa med pa ni thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ni thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Unimpeded, because of unimpededness everywhere.

original: rtag gnas ni rtag tu sems ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag gnas ni rtag tu sems ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Always in even meditation, because his mind is always in concentration.

original: 'dri ba kun lan 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni dris pa thams cad sel ba'o //
analyzed: 'dri ba kun lan 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni dris pa thams cad sel ba'o //
translated: He is accepted as the one who answers all questions, because he removes all doubts.

original: de yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus rang gi zhing yongs su dag par skyes te /
analyzed: de yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus rang gi zhing yongs su dag par skyes te /
translated: Moreover, the Enjoyment Body is born in a Pure Land,

original: ji srid nam mkha' gnas kyi bar du bzhugs so //
analyzed: ji srid nam mkha' gnas kyi bar du bzhugs so //
translated: and remains there as long as space endures.

original: de ci'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called a Buddha land?

original: gtsor ni de nyid der skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtsor ni de nyid der skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Primarily, because he is born there.

original: 'jig pa dang rab tu 'jig pas na 'jig rten te /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang rab tu 'jig pas na 'jig rten te /
translated: The world is so called because of its destruction and complete destruction.

original: skye dgu dang de'i snod do //
analyzed: skye dgu dang de'i snod do //
translated: It is the living beings and their container.

original: de bas na 'jig rten gyi khams ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten gyi khams ni gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, the world is twofold.
